Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: BelfastAlison028
Reviews.Content: Firstly hotel was very easy to get to from the airport - just hop on the aerobus and go right to Espanya square (you will know where when you see tall towers off a roundabout). About 15-20mins. On arrival we were offered a choice of room sizes and we were given a room on the 7th floor over looking the main street and square which was nice. The room itself had a huge bed, tv, safe, minibar, bath/shower and usual bathroom kit and a small balcony. We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel itself is quite dark and moody which I love, the bar was nice and modern in the main downstairs area but please be aware that to order drinks you have to ask at reception for the waiter - I don't know where he is when he doesn't stay at the bar. Drinks are very well priced compared to in town centre. The rooftop pool is lovely...to look at!! We went to go for a swim but it was freezing so couldn't get in the whole 4 days. I can only imagine in the summer time it is just so relaxing to be in it over looking the square. Location was brill - across the road in front of the towers was the underground and was so easy to use. The stop for the tour buses is also close to here - the tour bus is the best way to get around everywhere and can hop on and off. There is a shopping centre directly beside the hotel which is very handy. To top the whole trip off, my husband to be proposed on the balcony of the hotel!!! he tried at other times through the trip to no avail : ) Note: do not eat at the chinese buffett (come out the front door and turning right) we both got food poisoning as food wasn't even warm never mind hot. All in all, would stay again : )

Reviews.Title: “I give A for B hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrewjo1
Reviews.Content: B hotel was located very conveniently near to Subway station, shopping mall (with big supermarket in it), restaurants and Aerobus bus stop. Walking distance around 5-10 minutes. From our 16-H journey with our 2 years-old daughter, we arrived there very early. Luckily, They allowed us to check-in at the very moment we arrived (without additional charge). We were very thankful. All the staffs were very attentive and welcoming. The room was surprisingly big with nice chic bathroom. They provided us with baby cot. The overall design was minimalist and trendy. The important thing was that it was neat and clean. It was comfortable. We loved it. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: elshjj
Reviews.Content: Was here for 4 nights in Jan 2012 and it was a fabulous stay! A fabulous boutique hotel, located next to a big mall with a metro station, and about 15-20mins walk from the rail station. Room was spacious, and it was very nicely and neatly designed. There was a little balcony that overlooks the street. Bed was huge and comfortable, the tv is quite small though, but wifi connection was smooth and fuss-free. Bathroom is clean and big. There is a pool at the roof, overlooking the entire area, looks very inviting, but it was winter, too cold for a dip! The hotel is in close proximity to many attractions like National Palace of Barcelona, and as we love exploring on foot, we walked to the Port Vell, Barceloneta beach from B-Hotel. That took us probably about 30-40 mins of strolling.. There was also a decent chinese restaurant located about 8-10 mins walk away from the hotel. The mall has a huge supermarket that can fulfill all your needs if you run out of supplies. Overall a very comfortable and pleasant stay in a fabulous location! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Marketeer83
Reviews.Content: Didn't spend too much time here, just sleeping. But place was clean and comfortable and is beside a metro stop and good shopping centre. Close enough to the Old town and to Montjuic also. Room was a little noisy with traffic outside, however.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Casey-Jo Z
Reviews.Content: A pretty decent location, not far to the main attractions, the furthest we walked was to the harbour taking around 20-25mins, but fantastic metro links to everything, quick easy and cheap (at 2 euros per journey)! There were a number of restaurants and cafes around the area that didnt take more than a half an hour walk, but as mentioned the metro was incredibly useful for this purpose also. The room was beautiful and modern with an incredibly comfortable and spacious bed, that was clean and surpassed all expectations, especially the bath! The staff were immensely welcoming and friendly, coping well with our broken spanish and strong english accents. And as for the breakfast, that was lovely, clean and all fresh, with a huge variety - we only had the breakfast for one morning, but did not struggle to find other eateries around the area. Unfortunately we visited in February so there were no pool visits for us, however despite the pool being small, the view and whole terrace was stunning, being on the roof we could see a lot of the city, as well as the mountains, and i imagine this would be bliss in the summer. Oh, and visit the Hard Rock Cafe! This was our first experience of the HRC's and it was brilliant, a pleasingly priced menu, once your food has arrived - the best meal i have ever eaten! Overall Barcelona was a fabulous experience, and the hotel certainly more than contributed to this judgement. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at BH hotel and you have picked the best.”
Reviews.Author: 937MaB937
Reviews.Content: Ok., the hotel is a cutting edge modern hotel with features way better than your usual 3-4 star hotel. I also agree that you don't spend your holiday in the hotel room but this hotel has a lot more going for it ............. great design, location and a pool to die for if the weather permits. The location is also great and makes it that much more attractive. The rooms are sound proofed for added comfort and we never heard the unpleasent noises from the next door guests!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice and modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: kiong22
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in march'12. The hotel has a very good location, direct bus to the airport and easy access to all the tourist attractions. I could get to most of the tourist attractions with a 15 min metro ride. Its located beside a big shopping centre with cafes and supermarket. The rooms are clean, spacious, modern and there is free wifi. Would definitely stay in this hotel when i am in barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and funky design”
Reviews.Author: PaulaandCiaran
Reviews.Content: great hotel, great location, nice rooms, staff or nice but not super professional, breakfast was nice could be better but does the job. Pool on roof is breath taking

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a b-deluxe room (509) over the weekend of March 17th and was pretty happy overall. The room is spacous, modern with floor to ceiling windows with great views over Plaza Espana. I think if you were a light sleeper the road noise might be an issue - but it didn't bother me as the windows are pretty well sound proofed and its not a city to be in bed too early in any case! I had a double bed which two singles stuck together which is not the best. Unlike some previous reviews the bathroom was fine - no mould or any problems here. The location is good, the pool is great and the staff are pleasant and very helpful so pretty much a thumbs up all round.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay....Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SJ_likes_to_travel
Reviews.Content: So, I think the hotel was near faultless but I will start with a few bad things that stopped it getting full marks..... As you can see from my attached photo, the mirror was cracked in our room, which is actually the door to the bathroom. I think this was a basic design fault as the door was a sliding door and slammed easily. Also, we had an internal room, which just had a view of other rooms and the courtyard. However, I thought the hotel was fantastic. I really don't understand how people can complain about the location, the hotel is at Plaza Espanya which is a good 20-25 min walk to the Rambla but a 6 minute metro journey. But it is very close to Montjuic as well. The hotel itself was immaculately clean and on our first day we noticed an out of place and broke tile which was fixed by the next day (without even reporting it). I read in previous reviews that the the bathroom window overlooking the room was inconvenient, well, there is a very effective electronic blind and besides that, it is pretty entertaining! The roof terrace and pool was the absolute icing on the cake and whilst it is overlooked by the shopping centre now occupying the bullring, it still offers amazing views and I imagine would be great for mid afternoon dips in the hot Barca summers. My friend and I love Barca and B-Hotel was really key in making this one of our best visits. With an honorable mention to Antonio on reception. I would definitely stay here again and 100% recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: cassiopeia1215
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in great location, and the pool on the roof is fab. But we had a room face to the street, it is too noisy. We double checked if all the windows were closed, but not help. So in the end we have to use ear plug to be able fall in sleep.

Reviews.Title: “loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: Carryduff
Reviews.Content: would not hesitate to stay hear again and the same with recommending it to friends or family for a stay. the hotel is modern, clean and the staff we encountered couldnt have been more friendly/helpful. the hotel is in a fantastic location, couldnt be easier from the airport, the metro is basically on your doorstep, and theres a multitude of lovely cafe's and restaurants within yards of the front door. if i'm back in barca i'll be back at the B hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, appalling service”
Reviews.Author: NightBreed01
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a fantastic hotel, very modern and quirky (especially the rooms). But its getting tired in places and there is an inexcusable shortage of staff. On entering reception you are generally greeted by someone and they are helpful. The bar area to the right is another matter. You have to go to reception and they call the bar man from upstairs, who is also responsible for room service, the conference rooms and other duties. We regularly waited 15 mins for the barman to come to the bar. He would then serve us one drink and disappear and we would wait again. Because we there on business, there was quite often 10-12 of us waiting for the barman, on many occasions we just gave up. The rooms were great, modern and quirky with flat screen TV,glass bathrooms looking into the bedroom and an innovative lighting system. breakfast was varied and very good. Room service was nothing short of appalling. I waited 45 mins to receive tepid tinned soup and a half cooked cheap microwave pizza that made me violently ill. This was all delivered of course by the Barman! I called room service and complained about the meal and left it outside my door and told them I was not going to pay. On checking out of the hotel they tried to bill me for the meal and said that room service had put a note on the system to say i had eaten the meal. I feel I must reiterate the fact that this is a lovely hotel, I really enjoyed it. But the situation with the bar and room service was totally unacceptable

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M
Reviews.Content: Good price and location. Only problem I found was for a hotel that seems to try to put forth a very hip image the bathroom facilities in my room were in fairly poor condition.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a weekend of fun in Barca”
Reviews.Author: styles100
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel twice - firstly with the Hubby and the second time with a few girlfriends. The first time we were a little nervous as the hotel was a bit of an unknown entity as it had only recently opened but we were very pleasantly surprised with our funky room and the lovely rooftop pool area. The location is fab - the metro is just across the street and the bus from the airport drops 50 feet from the hotel. The view from the rooftop pool area is gorgeous - with the old bullring, amazing Montjuic and architecture. It was easy to get to Las Ramblas and the beach area as well as the beautiful Sagrada Familia and Parc Guell - all a must when visiting Barcelona! I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona but especially in the Summer when you can enjoy the rooftop pool - it's small but oh so perfect when the sun is shining!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a little disappointed but for the right price it is good value.”
Reviews.Author: Adz99
Reviews.Content: The location is 10/10. A1 or A2 bus from airport drops you right at Placa Espanya non-stop in 20 mins for €5.30. Buses every 10 mins 7 days a week and they are light blue in colour (all other city buses are red). There are several tube lines and you can walk up to the Olympic Park in 20 mins. The Bull Ring shopping centre next door is very nice. Roof terrace is free if you go up via interior lifts or €1 via exterior lift. Great cafe and Supermarket in the basement. Rooms were nice but need some TLC. The water from the shower does run over to the floor and our bathroom didn't have a door (the mechanism was there but the glass was not!) the rooms are dark even in the middle of the day and the lighting system is frustrating even with instructions. You can barely see in the toilet cubicle. However it was clean and quiet and beds are huge and comfy so it did the main jobs well and for £60 a night I'm not complaining. Free wifi was superbly fast and easy and the staff were all efficient and nice to deal with. You can hear the tube even on the top floor but it isn't a bother. Barcelona itself was awesome. Highly recommend a meal at Gilda (look on here) and a walk on the beachfront. Parc Guell has stunning views also.

Reviews.Title: “B Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: B Hotel was one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in, with a great view of placa d'espanpya and excellent room features, The roof top pool looked amazing and we hope to return in the summer so we could enjoy that perk. Easy access to the metro - lovely taps bar close by and the arena had lots of shops and resturants to offer. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel. Fine location.”
Reviews.Author: johnevery
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in B Hotel with my mother. It was my first time in Barcelona, so I did a lot of research online. My criteria was: proximity to the transportation (Metro is excellent in Barcelona, always use it), ease of reaching the airport without taking a taxi, neiubourhood, cleanliness, and price. Neddless to say that there are thousand good hotels in Barcelona, so do your research, but B Hotel was on top of my list. We were not disapointed, I can tell you. B Hotel is situated on situated opposite Plaza Espanya (which is almost the heart of the city), you have all the Metro lines within 2 minute walking (tip buy T-10, ten metro tickets, Metro is clean and safe) from where you can reach basically and place of interest in 10 minutes. To get to the hotel take a shutle bus from the airport terminal (I think it goes every 10 minutes, but check), its a nice 15 minutes drive, and it's the first stop, then you have to cross the street and walk 2 minutes towards the center and it will cost you 5 Euro, taxi will cost about 35 Euro. Hotel is located in a safe neubourhood, we walked at night, and it looked very safe. Hotel itself is a modern building. We were greated by a very friendly receptionist, who offered to tell us anything we wanted to know about his city, he took out a map, and showed us everything we wanted to know, and gave detailed instructions on getting there. The room is rather big, and moder looking, with free WIFI. There's a bar downstairs, and mini bar in a room.To make the long story short, everything went very well, and we had great time! The double cost us 73 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “B-Hotel, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Lilli S
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the B-hotel through Lastminute.com after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and I have to say that we had a lovely time. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful. The roof top terrace was a nice touch, but unfortunately is quite overlooked by the roof top of the shopping mall, which had a steady flow of visitors. The location of the hotel was great, right next to restaurants and the shopping mall in the Bull Ring. The airport bus took about 20 minutes and cost 5.30€ (but a 46 (i think) takes you from the airport to Placa Espanya for 1€ but takes longer so we decided against it). The magic fountains were 2 minutes around the corner, but unfortunately were not working due to maintenance. A short walk up to the art gallery up on the hill rewards you with spectacular views. We did not have food in the hotel, preferring instead to walk up the road to a little cafe near to the Urgell station, called Bella Pan, who did a coffee and croissant for 1.50€ and it was delicious! There was also a supermarket at the bottom of the shopping mall. I will also be reviewing the restaurants around the hotel in a separate review- so check that out too if you are interested.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good base hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkE_b
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just next to Placa Espanya - easy direct access from Barcelona Airport (tourist bus or you can get the local bus for cheaper). P. Espanya is also a metro station so easy access to rest of city on doorstep of hotel and you get the train to Montserrat from there too. Shopping mall right next to hotel (old bull ring) - food court in bottom is a good cheap option for breakfast (5euros for coffee and pastry for 2 people; recommend Enrich cafe), also a supermarket there if you want to budget and make picnic lunches. Hotel itself is standard hotel, good base for exploring the city. Room was clean and with all standard amenities. Room decorated in fairly dark colour scheme so the bathroom did feel slightly like something from a nightclub, particularly with the many different light settings for the room! But shower was good and hot. Hotel staff friendly. Lobby area never busy. Get a good price on hotel - it's the location which makes this hotel a 4 star. Other tips - if looking for somewhere to eat nearby - restaurant next door (Tapa Tapa I think it was called) was good. But some little popular Catalan gems of restaurants (Tapas) we found were La Pepita and La Flauta.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and well located hotel. But the should keep an eye on the details.”
Reviews.Author: nielstre
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel, certainly the big door at the reception and the interior of the hotel. Friendly staff with also a good towel service for the pool that is located on the top of the hotel. Room was also nice and spacious. But it was not 100% clean. Some mold on the glass (next to the bath), dirt on the walls and some other details do no good to the modern interior. They really have to maintain it better...

Reviews.Title: “A mix”
Reviews.Author: Portis78
Reviews.Content: It really is a mix for me. Upon first glance- it was wonderful. Very contemporary building and room. Staff was very friendly with me always. But once the awe wears off- it has very obviously seen better days. In my room at least. The bathroom is mainly where the issues were. The glass separating the shower from the sink was disgustingly molded between the panels and the edges around the tub had thick chunks of scum in the crevices. The water would also leak from the bathroom into the room- leaving a small puddle near my bed each time. Everything else was okay- but the bathroom gave such a bad impression that the rest of the room felt very cheap as well. The location was okay- not too central though. I like to walk and everything of interest as a tourist was at least a half hour walk. Towards the end of my stay I just started taking trains and that was perfect for commuting to the hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Quality can be found in abundance”
Reviews.Author: Eimear2107
Reviews.Content: A great lOcation,not too close to the city but not too far away,close to lots of really nice restaurants,great views from building,the tourist information was second to none,really romantic and a sexy shower.clean and really friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to come back to”
Reviews.Author: kamilya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the Plaza Espanya area and there is a new mall, Las Arenas right next door which offers a great food hall, restaurants, shopping and entertainment options. The hotel is well connected to the subway, Lines 1 and 3. Staying here won't put you right in the touristy areas of Passeig de Gracia and the Ramblas (which are only about 4 or 5 stops on the subway); but it will put you in one of the nicer areas where locals live, work and play. Would recommend the B-deluxe rooms for the extra space especially if you are a couple. Would also recommend the upper floors if you are a super light sleeper. The hotel is well designed, a bit in need of maintenance but the staff are super friendly and accomodating. Thanks especially to Joel, Rachel and Marina for making my stay very pleasant. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: richard p
Reviews.Content: First off getting to the hotel from the airport was very easy. We got the aero port train to Barcelona Sants (20 mins) then had a short walk through the station then on the red line one stop down to Espanya. The hotel is located next to the old bull ring which is now a shopping center. You cant miss it as it has a big 'B' on the front! All in all approx 25-30 minutes to and from the airport. We stayed on 4th floor in one of the delux rooms which was on the main road. The room had a modern feel it and contemporary design. Very 'masculine' as my girlfriend described it. The rooms are large with a huge bed which i believe is a king size. On the top floor is the infinity pool with a lovely view of the La Plaza España de Barcelona. The room was perfect for us during our first stay. The only down side was the noise of the cars on the main road. But to be honest it didn't stop me from getting a good nights sleep. The hotel staff were always very polite and helpful. We would definitely stay again! Aside from the hotel being really good the location is perfect.The metro stop, Espanya is 1 minute walk from the hotel. 3/4 stops down takes you near Las Ramblas or you can walk 30 minutes. Also if you are planning to go to Montserrat the train leaves from here for 16 euro return. The magic fountain/olympic villiage is just up the road and there is also one of the biggest cinemas in Europe(some films in English) near Urgell which is 2 stops down. The metro system is well designed, very easy to navigate around and always on time!! With regards to restaurantes near the hotel we tried several of them. Our favourite was Pura Brasa which is next door. They do a variety of different types of food. I loved the steak, 20 inch ribs and the seared burger! Calamari was was also excellent. For snacks you can pop down to the super market in the shopping centre and also get breakfast in one of the cafes inside as well. Stay here you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but needs a refit -- urgently!”
Reviews.Author: Andre_Brazil_2011
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Location (very, very good -- a subway station is just a few steps away). - Design. - The terrace. Cons: - Old furniture. - Is not as clean as it should be (there were insects on the carpet; dirty curtains; stinky blankets...) - Reception staff could be more friendly (I asked one more key to my room -- and to use the elevator --, since my wife reached the hotel before me one night, and the woman at the desk offered the phone -- i had to call my wife and ask her to go downstairs!!!) - The piece of soap they offer is an actual poison to the skin -- be careful. - Defective wi-fi. - Noisy ventilation / warming system. - Old and poorly maintained shower / bathtub

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, comfy beds, good location”
Reviews.Author: Raff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the B-Hotel overnight last weekend (4th Dec). We were in BCN to attend the Food and wine show, Barcelona Degusta. The hotel was ideally located opposite the main show hall (La Fira), which was perfect for us. We got on the Aerobus from the airport 5.30€ and got off at the first stop, Placa Espanya. The hotel is two minutes (or three/four depending on the traffic!) from the bus stop. Check-in was smooth, we had been allocated an internal room on the 7th floor (no street view but less noise), as I had requested a peaceful room. We were happy with the room. The large window looks out over the roof tops and straight at the flats surrounding the hotel, we weren't fussed about the view anyway. Room has some funky lighting, that takes a while to figure out, but we got the hang of it. The bed was big and comfy and the room was clean. The bathroom was also clean, shame the marble has such staining, but it's unavoidable. The bath is slippery, would benefit from a slip mat or something similar. There is a static shower screen, which can make for turning on the shower a tad of a stretch, and its unfortunate that water has seeped in between the two panes of glass, again a design fault. All in all though the room and bathroom were clean and comfy, perfect for what we needed. We slept well, and even though the room was off the street and 7 floors up, you could still hear and feel the rumble of the metro as it passed under the hotel. This is not an oddity with BCN hotels located near to the metro, so again, this didn't bother us. The hotel has a lovely roof top terrace, and an infinity pool, both looking at the Placa Espanya and beyond, I should imagine it is quite a place to relax early evening in the summer. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, as we prefer to go to La Boqueria off Las Ramblas to have fresh fruit and smoothies. The reception staff were polite and on checkout offered to look after our bags for the day. We took them up on that and our bags were locked in a room off the main reception. Or flight wasn't until the evening so we actually returned to the hotel with (cough) a few extra bags and added them to the ones they were already holding, very useful. The hotel is a minute walk to the nearest metro, 3 stops and you are in Placa Cataluyna. It is also next door to a shopping centre, which was formally the bull fighting arena. On the roof top of this building are restaurants, affording the diner a great view of placa espanya and the palace. We watched the sunset with a glass of vino and some tapas, a great way to finish our trip. The bus back to the airport is just in front of this shopping centre, and we were at the airport within 10 mins, perfect. I would defo stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “B-Hotel gets an A from Me”
Reviews.Author: juangui1
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Barcelona in late November with my wife and stayed 4 nights at the B Hotel. Initial impression, I love boutique-feel hotels and this one has that contemporary, modern-design and rooms are very large for european standards. Similar to american hotel size rooms. Bed was the most comfortable out of the 3 other hotel beds we stayed at in Spain during our trip. Location is right next to a shopping/food commercial arena and the Plaza de Espanya metro stop. Not to mention, a 3 minute walk to the aerobus stop which takes you to the airport for 5.30 euros. Overall, great stay, amazing value and would not hesitate to stay at B Hotel on my next trip to Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience!”
Reviews.Author: sw01bgn
Reviews.Content: All we can say is that we had a very good experience here and would come back. Vrey contemporay room with a very decent room and bathroom to be amazed. Breakfast decent though we chose to have breakfast out partly because it was cheaper. Again we will def dtay here again on our next trip tp BArca. Mind, not far from Las Ramblas either. Bril!

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, beautiful property, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gsmason
Reviews.Content: Easy bus ride from airport to Placa D'Espanya. New hotel adjacent to former bull ring (converted to shopping center) and placa d'espanya. Must spend time on roof with pool at sunset. Easy walk Art Museum de Catalunya, Miro Museum, and Olympic Stadium. Next to Metro entrance. Very, very helpful staff. Economical value at 70 Euro/night (prebook and prepay). Very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Alison014
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Barcelona with my husband from October 1st to 5th. Let me start by saying if I could give this hotel a 4.5 I would. We paid $145 a night and got good value for our money. The location of this hotel is fantastic. Less than 5 minutes from the Espanya station which will get you anywhere you want to go. It is also a 5 minute (7 euro) cab ride from Sants Station. The airport bus drops off just down the street, there is a shopping mall right next door and the Magic Fountain is a 5 minute walk away. The rooftop was a major factor in deciding to stay at this hotel and it did not disappoint. Amazing pool, amazing view and we never had a problem getting a lounger. The bar wasn't open, but you simply had to pick up a phone and call down and your drink would come up within minutes. We spent at least an hour up there every afternoon. The only slight drawbacks of the rooftop were the observation deck on top of the mall next door (felt like everyone was watching and taking pictures of us), and the fact that even though it was really hot out, the water was freezing! The room was great. The decor was very modern and minimalist which we loved and the bed was very comfortable. There was plenty of closest space. The only comments I would make on the room are: 1) The bathtub did not look very clean. The caulking in between the tub and the tile was a little dirty, and the glass partition had a strange film inside the glass which I am assuming is from the condensation. Fine for a shower, but if you want a bath it was a little sketchy. 2) The hairdryer was built in and the cord was too short which made it a little difficult to dry your hair. 3) The "couch" they had in the room was kind of pointless as it was very hard and uncomfortable. It was however a good place to store our suitcases. All in all we had a great time and really enjoyed this hotel. We are thinking of returning to Spain next summer and will most definitely consider staying at the B-hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal short break”
Reviews.Author: Ballintoy1971
Reviews.Content: Very easy to get to using airport bus, but plenty of taxis outside arport as well. Hotel check in quick and staff very pleasant. Room spacious and comfortable with good shower. Location for us was ideal as we like a nice walk, 15-20 mins walk to placa catalunya where the ramblas starts and runs down to harbour.I would recomend that if you take tour bus, go that little bit extra for two days as there is a lot to see. Next door to hotel is the arenas centre with plenty of places to eat, we used cafe next door for breakfast, very reasonable. Only small niggle would be that the bar never seemed to be staffed, which didn't affect us as we were always out and about. Overall had a lovely time in Barcelona and would stay in B-Hotel again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the B Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jsfountain
Reviews.Content: My second stay at the B Hotel in Barcelona. This time i had a 2 night stay at the hotel for work. I chose their deluxe room because i needed to have some working space. The room was very spacious and had more than enough room for me to spread out and set up my computer and work comfortably. The view of the city from the hotel was also spectacular. The B Breakfast is always good and plentiful. Fresh food and good quality. I ordered room service the 2nd night and it was very good. All the services were top notch and the staff very helpful for anything i needed. The only thing that could be improved on is the noise from the street outside. The windows in the room do not block out the sound very well and it is easy to hear the busy traffic below (the hotel is located on one of the main streets of Barcelona). But it was never enough to annoy me and it gets quiet at night. Great stay. Always a pleasure to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: SGH2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night before and one night after our cruise that left from the port in Barcelona. The hotel's proximity to placa espanya (a stop on the aerobus from El Prat airport) made it very appealing when we booked. The service from the check-in desk was excellent. We arrived in early afternoon into Barcelona and were able to go straight to our room. The rooms we stayed in were more than adequate for our needs. The bed could have been a bit more comfortable. But overall, its a great value and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for us.”
Reviews.Author: JulieAnnArm
Reviews.Content: I picked the B Hotel for its location. It was a nice 25min walk to Las Ramblas. It is located right next to the Arenas shopping mall and the Cataluna metro stop. 10 min walk to the beautifual Magic Fountain light show (Friday & Saturday nights) and the Palau National. Plently of good restaurants in walking distance. Good supermarket in mall. The entry to the hotel is very modern and so are the rooms. The dark corridors of the hotel took a bit getting used to, but the idea of saving electricity and having motion sensors go on when you were there appealed to us. Hotel room is also controlled so that when you leave room all lights go off. Pool deck is amazing - especially lovely on an evening. Room and bathroom were very modern and comfortable and very spacious and we even had a small balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend break”
Reviews.Author: corshamfolk
Reviews.Content: Great location -200m to metro ( 3 stops to centre), airport bus & tour bus and easy walking distance to Montjuic. Super room- spacious, immaculate. Too cold to try the lovely pool. Deal included breakfast which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with all the extras !!! Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Bengy465
Reviews.Content: summer 2010 july( they didn't have an option for July 2010 so I picked a different date ) my bf and I went backpacking through Europe and this was our first destination, the pool was amazing we did not get to swim in it because it was too cold but it was still very beautiful! The room was so nice! Huge bed big tub and shower and a small balcony! The best thing was the breakfast in the morning, they had everything you could think of and it was worth paying for extra! This is a must see hotel and it is near many site seeing destinations! We would def. stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Con men receptionists”
Reviews.Author: Golddustz
Reviews.Content: We attended the Plan B hotel for a music festival in October in Barcelona. We required a late check on our room , which we enquired about and were told a price of around 40euros as we required to check out 7pm . The price soon changed and they charged us for a whole nights room rate , which was a disgrace as the hotel was not even full 80 euros .. which was a joke! I paid for a room upgrade to superior room class and to me no real difference from standard room. The bathroom doors did not even close properly .......... Maybe a good location but as always just after their money when it came to the crunch , they offer no real obligements when required...... We would never stay at this hotel again. Extremely disappointed with the service

Reviews.Title: “Super value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mate4net
Reviews.Content: Reading all the review I was a bit concerned when I booked with b hotel but couldn't resist the good price. Thanks tripadvisor I managed to put some requests upon booking and I was extremely impressed by the quality of the hotel room and how quiet it can be if you are in the right area. The only put off is the noise when housekeeping clean other rooms in the moment it did travel through and you can also hear people stay above or below your room shall they were doing something involving screaming or shouting

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Onurustunel
Reviews.Content: I and my friend spent four nights in june 2011 and i can say that the hotel with its staff exceeded our expectations. Stylish decoration, nice and clean rooms, fairly good location in barcelona and pleasant sunsets nearby the pool on the roof were indeed more than the money we paid. Las ramblas are three stops away with the metro and so are many other attractions. Believe me it is better to stay in this relatively quiet neighborhood and take metro to catalunya. It is worth for the sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent experience”
Reviews.Author: JoshNYC
Reviews.Content: B-Hotel is a neat little property tucked away right off Plaza de Espanya, right in middle of everything. I've been coming to Barcelona for years and have stayed all over the neighborhood, but a newish boutique hotel and some decent prices pushed me to try it. Lobby: it's got a few couches, a bar area (I never saw customers or a bartender), and a single computer for internet use. The lobby staff was helpful when needed, but otherwise somewhat absent (ie no bartender...ever...) Pool: awesome infinity pool on the roof, not heated (thus freezing even on a hot summer afternoon). You can arrange for a massage up there at reasonable prices (I never got around to this), or phone down and they send up a waiter for snacks and beers at the rooftop bar. Not enough chairs to go around, but I suppose this is a problem at hotel pools the world over. Pool towels could be acquired at reception, were large and of decent quality. Nicest part of the roof was going up there late at night, with the whole plaza lit up below you. Have a drink and enjoy the views...perfect. Room: I booked the standard room, which had a hard but comfortable king-size bed. Floor to ceiling glass windows look out on the Plaza, though they seem to be well-glazed and noise was not an issue (despite fairly heavy traffic 24/7). All the usual amenities were in place (safe, minibar, glass shower). The light switches were a bit complicated (yes, a light can be complicated to turn on) but gave the whole place a futuristic feel and a lot of fun to be in. Hotel wi-fi was s.l.o.w. and skype was blocked, which was just annoying. Overall a pretty decent hotel. If you're on vacation then the perfect base, away from the madness of the Ramblas, and within walking distance of great restaurants (don't eat anywhere touristy in the Plaza, please! You can do better). It would have been nice for the staff to be more present and attentive (if I'm sitting at the pool, have a waiter or bartender up there serving me alcohol!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Michael T
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: can't be beat, just steps away from the Espanya Metro and the Arenas de Barcelona, and within easy walking distance of the Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya and the Museu Picasso. ROOMS: spacious and well-appointed. Once you master the operation of the lighting system, you will appreciate the intelligence of its design. The bathroom was modern and functional, and we loved the fluffy bathrobes! Although there was free wifi in the rooms, the connection was painfully slow (despite the hotel's hi tech image). TERRACE: what a gem on the 8th floor! A wonderful place to hang out for a pre-dinner drink. It has a small bar and an infinity pool, and a drop-dead view of the Plaça d'Espanya. SERVICE: Generally good, but a couple of the ladies at the front desk need to go back to hospitality school. I never saw them smile in the 11 days I was there, and approaching them for assistance seemed like an imposition. NEIGHBOURHOOD: Lots of restaurants next door, many with outdoor seating. There is even a pretty good Chinese buffet restaurant called Dim Sum Wok. The Arenas de Barcelona (a bull ring built in 1900) is now a shopping centre, with plenty of restaurants and shops, a supermarket, an organic market and a rock n' roll museum! But it's the massive roof-top that draws the crowds. There are a number of restaurants, including a good sushi place, at the core; but the outer ring of the terrace offers a panoramic 360 degree view of the city, with the spectacular unobstructed view of the Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya the most impressive.

Reviews.Title: “B Hotel, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Steven Z
Reviews.Content: A fabulous, very well located Hotel in Barcelona, close to Plaza Espanya. This Hotel is very well located to the Barcelona Olympic stadium, Red line tourist bus(a must) , Free WiFi, Aeroporto bus drops you off 200m away from B-Hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Death Trap!”
Reviews.Author: EMDREW
Reviews.Content: On first glance we were pleasantly surprised by the size and location of the room at B Hotel. Having stayed in Barcelona several times this hotel has a central location at a reasonable price via internet searches. The room was large and looks like it has had a make over recently. The make over is sadly where the issues start. Each room has a lighting system which is had to decode, resulting in the main lights being switched on to access the bedside lights rather than using them independently. After using the shower we noticed a large puddle in the bedroom dripping on to a cable from one of the bedside lights. Looking at where the drips where coming from we could see that the hotel had previously tried to tape the leak up rather than sealing the bathroom. Our real surprise happened at 5.15am when a huge crash woke us up. The crash happened to be the radiator in the bathroom falling off the wall bringing the electrical cables with it. The radiator had been glued to the wall rather than being screwed as any normal person would do. You could also see other marks where it had been previously glued but must had fallen off. I went straight to reception to report the incident and was advised that they would look at it tomorrow. The receptionist saw no issues with using the bathroom even though I showed him photos of the exposed electrical wires below the sink. I demanding another room so that we could use the bathroom without fear of electrocution. I said that I wanted to talk to the manager when we check out. When we checked out, no one on reception was aware of the incident and our messages had not been passed on. We were advised that we could not talk to the manager. We then left our bags to continue to enjoy the city and said that we wanted to talk to the manager upon our return. Upon returning, a new team on the front desk were unaware of our issues and again we could not talk to a manager. Eventually someone came out to inform us that 'these things happen and we should expect this type of thing!' Remarks which left us speechless. Not once did anyone apologise despite three separate visits to reception. I'd like to inform B Hotel that these things do not happen in hotels which are constructed properly and who put safety & customer service first!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kschimmo
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in the city at the B Hotel. The reception desk staff was very friendly, efficient, and helpful when we arrived. They also tracked us down to give us a message from a friend later on. Our room was clean, energy efficent, and very comfortable. But mistly, it is the location of this hotel merely a second from Plaza Espanya that makes it a great deal. You are seconds from the airport bus (leaves every 5 minutes), the metro, the Barcelona Sants train station,... The views are beautiful! You will be very pleased with your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Design Hotel in Good location”
Reviews.Author: gardenia55
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for its proximity to a conference, and for the rooftop pool. We liked the modern style, but did have a few design-based problems: operating the lights, the blinds dividing the bathroom from the bedroom, finding the room numbers (at floor level) and even finding the entrance of the hotel! (no sign). Once we mastered all these, we enjoyed our stay. The bed was comfortable and the furniture and lights quite quirky. Breakfast was fine, but a bit overpriced - there are plenty of other options close by. The pool is small, but was a perfect place to relax after a day's sightseeing. Great view too as you swim. The hotel's location on Placa Espanya is great, just next to a new shopping centre, metro, bus from the airport and other buses. It's a short walk to the 'Magic Fountain' which puts on a nightly show. A small negative was that there was no iron available for loan - unusual in a hotel of this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous relaxing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Tripaliz
Reviews.Content: The thing that we enjoyed the most about BHotel was in rooftop infinity pool. Coming back to relax by the pool in the late afternoon after sight-seeing really made our holiday complete. Even if there were quite a few people up there it always felt peaceful - maybe due to the Spanish music playing and the Sangria! The rooms were very clean, simple and comfortable. Ours had a lovely view as it was on the sixth floor facing hotel front. The only thing I had trouble with was working out the light switches! Metro and cafes across the road. We liked the B_Hotel so much that we are planning to return in 2012, all the way from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Derek J
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girldriend stayed here for 3 nights - great location , nice rooms, lovely pool over looking the city. The Service is ok but not great , not much happening at the bar looking around for staff most of the time. Cocktails by the pool is a must do. Right beside the metro , buses , taxis (cheap)

Reviews.Title: “Fair Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: ewalls77
Reviews.Content: I usually do not read prior reviews before writing my own, but I did happen to read the post about the sewer smell a few moments ago. My wife and I stayed on the 4th floor from the 17th-20th of September and did not experience this issue. Perhaps this reviewer stayed earlier (or later) than us. However, this was not the case when we were there. I also have a hard time believing the staff acted the way he described. Everyone we came across on the staff was courteous and professional (If there was such a disastrous smell taking over a floor of a hotel, is it odd that only one guest complained?) With that out of the way......The B Hotel has more of a modern feel to it with minimalist features and decorations. Rooms/Bathrooms are a good size. Everything is pretty clean, but I did notice someone on our floor smoking as she walked in between rooms. You may want to double check if they have smoking rooms available. Had I known this up front, I would not have stayed here. I think this was just a dodgy person who had no idea she was in a non smoking hotel. Roofdeck pool definitely a nice feature. We stayed facing the back courtyard, which was great as we could not hear anything outside. However, we did hear alot of door shutting in the halls during the night and early in the morning which got on my nerves. The location was a bit further away from the old part of town, where inevitably everyone touring Barcelona will think they want to be. However, it's a pretty good spot when considering Barcelona as a whole given the access to the L1 and L3 (Red and Green) lines just a 2 minute walk away. The breakfast at the hotel is a disaster, so stay away. For coffee and a pastry (Cafe y pasta) go across the street to one of the little restaurants. It is cheap and good. I didn't really love the hotel, but would consider staying here again given the rate was good. Remember, you're in Barcelona. Find a hotel that is comfortable, clean and safe so you can sleep well. Other than that, who cares. Spend every second you have exploring the city. It is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great peripheral location, quiet, big rooms, just don't stay on Floor 4 (service a bit lacking)!”
Reviews.Author: Dragon l
Reviews.Content: Just in case you don't read further, I'm going to put my biggest caveat up front and then follow with many more positive things. The 4th floor is a disaster. At first, it had no electricity. Yet, they refused to change our room. "We'll fix it." They did. Ok, I'm happy. Then, the room started getting REALLY stinky... we thought it was a spray the maid was using. Until, the next day at 1am, we came home and it had clarified into full sewer feces scent, so overpowering my nose hairs felt singed. Would they switch our room? NO! "Open the window," he said. So I made him come to the room to smell it. "That's a city smell," he says. Around the world, including India etc., never have I stewed in such a pungent fecal smell. After an hour of heated demands, we were moved for one night (by now it was 3am) to a hotel across the city (and I had to fight to get them to pay for it) until a new room could be made up the next day. I was exhuasted and FURIOUS. Why not just take care of the problem immediately instead of arguing for an hour and telling me to open a window to sleep? That room was pure toxin and I was extremely concerned for my health. That being said, one very very bad and infuriating evening did not overcome my overall happiness with the hotel. It was worn around the edges -- lots of mold in the shower, shower sprayed everywhere, the tiny piece of soap they gave would last about 5 minutes (forewarning to bring your own), lobby smells like cigar smoke, furniture/rugs worn, and the rooms and hallways are VERY DARK. The hallways being dark seems to be common everywhere in Europe, so I wasn't concerned. However, I had no idea what I looked like for 5 days because I couldn't see a thing in our bathroom. However, the rooms are BIG for Europe and so was the bathroom, even with the standard room. You have lots of buttons by the bed to turn on all sets of lights and everything was designed to be really cool (albeit quite nonfunctional). There are blinders between the bathroom and the bed, which is divided by glass, so you do have to be quite comfortable with your roommate because there isn't total privacy, even with the blinders shut. This also sucks if your roommate had to get up in the middle of the night because the light will wake you up, even with blinders shut. The hotel itself, once you are in your room, was silent and that was wonderful. In the hallway, you could hear every sound in every room, but somehow that big door shut it all out. The rooftop pool was fun to go to -- it's small and shallow, but I loved it. A late afternoon cocktail and a nap on the sofa at the pool and life was good. Just know that the pool is quite a spectacle from the roof of the mall next door and there will be dozens of people at the mall watching you in your swimwear. There is a restaurant directly across the alley (not the Tapas place though) that was really good, but everything nearby shuts down at midnight. So this isn't the location for a night owl. But the rooftop pool is open til midnight and it's really nice to catch one last nightcap up there. The bottom floor of the mall next door (which used to be a bull fighting arena and still looks like one!) has a grocery and lots of restaurants and you have everything at your fingertips, including the subway connected to it. It's about a 15-20 minute walk over to Las ramblas, or a hot 10 minute subway ride. About 8-10 Euro for a cab from the Ramblas area or Harbor. Also nearby is the magic fountain of Montjuic, an easy walk and must-see when the light show is happening one night. You could also watch from the mall roof, but would miss the music. Being farther from Ramblas was a double-edged sword - I like the peace and quiet, but every day had to schlep back and forth in the subway or a cab to all the fun areas. Overall, I have it a 4-star even with all my problems listed above because in comparison to all the other hotels we stayed at in 3 countries and in Barcelona, it was the quietest, most comfortable (but for the smell of fecal sewage on Floor 4), spacious place we found on our trip, particularly compared to the other prices in Barc. I'd stay there again... just not on the floor with the noxious odor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great value!”
Reviews.Author: EuroUSA1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the B-Hotel for four nights this past August and all three couples were very impressed with the rooms, locations and helpful staff. The roof-top pool was awesome with sweeping views of Plaza Espanya below. The metro was less then two blocks away so it was easy to get anywhere in Barcelona. I highly recommend this hotel and would return if visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a Fab view”
Reviews.Author: Tourguiderich
Reviews.Content: Nothing but great things to say about this hotel. The rooms are large and clean, pool is great with a fabulous view, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. I will stay here again when visiting lisbon!

Reviews.Title: “Value and quality should be a team.”
Reviews.Author: Pamlan
Reviews.Content: I was not very pleased with the service and quailty of the hotel. I felt service was rude and the rooms were not very clean. I will stay elsewhere on.my next visit to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Fashionable and functional”
Reviews.Author: nofopo
Reviews.Content: The location is good you can walk almost anywhere. The pool is lovely with a great view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Barcalona!”
Reviews.Author: shaunaw
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the B Hotel for a 5 day trip to Barcalona. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms were spotless, and very nicely furnished with modern, funky minimalist decor. The rooftop pool was an added bonus! Our only complaint was having to constantly log into the WiFi with our iPhones... (it was not possible to stay logged in and you had to enter a password each time). The location was excellent! Right next door to two metro lines that can take you anywhere in the city. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone wishing to visit Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “A well thought out, unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Panchoy
Reviews.Content: Once again the Trip Advisor reviews lived up to their hype. We found the B-Hotel perfect from many points of view. It is in a great location. We were pleasantly surprised at how much there was around the area to do. Having two subway lines within a couple of hundred meters didn't hurt either. Like much of Barcelona, design is just part of the culture. The B-Hotel didn't disappoint there either. Someone really re-thought how a hotel should be set up and designed. The hotel staff all spoke English and were very helpful. The pool was like nothing I have ever seen. It truly had the WOW factor. The only things that weren't up to the high standards of everything else were the internet and shower. The internet was slow (by North American standards) and it was frustrating having to sign on every time. While the bath/shower looked great, it was difficult to control where the water was going from the shower head (it was difficult to adjust). We skipped on breakfast and tended to get something in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fantastic postion and rooftop pool!”
Reviews.Author: Hensels
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the 'B' Hotel, great value for money. We booked 2 rooms one for our teenage girls and this worked well and also very cost effective. Very comfortable and good postion. It has the local and airport bus stops for good access to and from the airport, and plenty of restuarants and shopping near by. We loved the roof top pool perfect for relaxing after a busy day sightseeing! Staff very friendly and helpful. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mamaessex
Reviews.Content: I came to Barcelona with my daughter for a few days for her 18th birthday treat. We chose the hotel because of the pool and it did not disappoint us ( apart from the absolutely appalling piped music which is continually played and which clashes with the music being played on the roof of the nearby shopping centre) . The room was very comfortable, although we did find the light switches rather challenging. Despite being on a very busy junction and our room being at the front we did not notice any traffic noise.The room was clean, the towels large, the shower hot and the beds cosy. I would highly recommend the hotel and would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “B -”
Reviews.Author: amelia b
Reviews.Content: I am someone that books hotels based on the facilities they have to offer. A big one for me is internet access. I will choose a hotel based on this and will often pay more for this reason. So when they're advertised wireless and internet access does not work, it is extremely dissapointing and a waste of my money when i could have stayed at the hotel down the road without internet access for X amount cheaper. So in short, the internet did not work. Not in my room, not at the computer in reception and not at the computers in the business centre. Basically i felt a bit ripped off and frustrated as i needed to do some work. Aside from that... location was fine, rooms were a decent size, bed was very uncomfortable with very basic bedding... though i think that may be a part of the modern appeal... I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alan R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights prior to boarding cruise ship. Hotel well situated in Barcelona at Plaza Espanya. Room was great No 508 on the 5th floor situated at the front, overlooking the Plaza Espanya. No problem with traffic noise. Roof top pool was super with fantastic views and a great place to relax after a days sight seeing, only drawback was not enough sunbeds.The staff were friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. Got the Aerobus from the airport which took about 20mins, only purchase return ticket if returning within 9 days, Hotel is only a few mins walk from the bus stop. We got the 48 hour, hop on hop off bus ticket, there was a bus stop at the Plaza Espanya, especially recommend seeing the Jardin Costa Liobera Cactus Garden, Park Quell and Port Olimpic area. Nearby shopping centre with supermarket and restaurants. Las Rambles was about 25mins walk away. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone - 10/10”
Reviews.Author: Lundy26
Reviews.Content: We have thoroughly enjoyed a stay at the B hotel, the staff were courteous, friendly and very helpful. The room was beautiful and very clean (great shower). Room service was excellent and very affordable. The main feature would be the roof top pool which has a stunning view and the hotel itself is in a perfect location for El Camp Nou, Las Ramblas and the Palace- all within walking distance. Hotel should definitley be more than a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Family Holaiday in the best city of the world.”
Reviews.Author: Eddie B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel lies prefect to all the hot spots ofe the city. A few meters from the entrence is the red and green metro line and the ne arena-shopping-center and five minutes by feet to the National Palace. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “What's there to complain about?!?”
Reviews.Author: Wazzer83
Reviews.Content: Went as a couple in their mid to late twenties. 22€ for taxi from airport or can get coach for cheaper. Greeted on reception and allowed to check in 3 hours early. Only a 2 minute walk from Espanyol metro station which several lines run to. Outside you have tourist buses which take you all around Barcelona. Rooms are modern looking albeit looking a little tired now, but very clean still. Comfy sleep although can't say beds were 5 out of 5. Free Internet works fine (that's how I'm writing this review). TV was a bit fuzzy, but we weren't in much to be bothered. Roof top pool was a pretty cool feature, although it was always crowded and if ur shy be aware that the shopping centre next door overlooks the pool and alot of people staring and taking photos. Didn't bother us much as it's far away enough that you can't see or hear much, but felt strangely invaded of our privacy. All in all a good hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Styley hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kiwitraveller001_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days at the start of August. The rooftop pool is amazing, was a drawcard when I booked and did not disappoint. The location is fantastic, everything you might need is right next door in Placa Espanya, underground access, airport bus, Mies van der Rohe's Barcelona Pavilion a 10min walk away. The rooms were still in good condition. The bathroom was separated from the bedroom by a glass screen with electric blinds that could close. Only thing that could be improved was the free wireless Internet reception in the room, we had to sit on the floor by the door to try and get signal. But to be fair to B Hotel we never brought it up with t staff. All service was great + immediate. Def stay here again, I loved the pool + location : ) Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeCoTyrone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning off November. From the Airport if you catch the Aerobus (7 euro) it will drop you very close to the hotel at the region L'Espanya. It's only a couple of minutes walk to the hotel. The rooms in the hotel are very modern and spacious with large beds and all the mod cons. We were on the 6th floor at the back of the Hotel, which was nice and quiet but not much of a view, not that we cared as we weren't in the room very much. The Hotel has a swimming pool, solarum and a bar on the roof, which was great for some relaxation after all the running about. We only ate breakfast in the Hotel once, as it was quite expensive and you can eat out cheaper. The area the hotel is in is near the national museum and the magic fountains (a must see light show) and right next door to the hotel is a shopping centre with roof top restaurants. The Metro station is right outside the hotel and is approx 4 stops from La Rambla, it only takes about ten minutes. We purchased 2 10 trip passes for the metro, which worked out very well. From a tourist point of view there is lots to do, it's just deciding what suits the individual. We purchased a 2 day ticket for the bus tour, which worked very well on the basis you hop on and off as you please, the 2 day pass is cheaper and if you are there for a few days you will have no problem using it up. Won't dwell on all the sites as there are so many! In summary we had a great holiday and the city is great for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EatOnlyLar
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant stay at B Hotel. The location was very strategic. From the airport, just hop on to a shuttle bus to Plaza Espanya and it is within walking distance to the hotel, very close to some of the main attractions too. The hotel has a swimming pool on the top floor. Although it was quite small, the view from the pool was excellent. Service was good and we like the modern design of our room, and it was very spacious too. We would definitely stay in this hotel again! Our complete review can be found at our food blog here. http://www.eatonlylar.com/spanish-food/restaurant-elche

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Barcelona and we needed a hotel for family of six to stay one night before going on Norwegian Epic for a cruise. Based entirely on the reviews on Tripadvisor I booked this one and we were all very pleased we did. Having followed the advice of another reviewer, we took the number 1 bus from the airport at a bargain 1.46 Euro each, got off at the Plaza de Espanya (it shows the next stop on a scrolling display in the bus and look out for the two massive columns in the square - you can't miss them). The hotel is clean and welcoming and, since we were early, would have allowed us to dump our bags and go off for the day. Fortunately, one of our three rooms was ready so we dropped all the luggage and wondered what we'd do next. We are the world's worst sightseers and everyone had told us that Barcelona was a city for sightseeing so we knew we had to do something. I asked at reception what they suggested we do. We were tired as we had had a 3am start so really didn't want to amble along pretending we were enjoying ourselves. They suggested the open top tour bus. I initially thought 'how touristy' but, once I had got over the fact that that was exactly what we were, we went for it. One of the stops was right across the square, you could hop on and off whenever you liked. It was about 100 Euros for all of us but suited us well. We saw all we knew we needed to see in Barcelona (although the blue section of the route at the north was a little tedious, but needed to be done to see Gaudi's cathedral which is a must). The pool was very welcome at the end of the day and was a great experience. We ate out that night at a restaurant just up from the hotel. It wasn't particularly Spanish but very good food and by now we wanted something close and easy. We did previously take a wander to find a cheap and cheerful restaurant but I cannot face the ones that have a photograph of the food outside as they are one step too far in the wrong direction. Fabulous night's sleep but, boy, Barcelona is a happening place as the traffic was busy all night. Not enough to keep me awake but I did hear it occasionally. With reference to other comments here on Tripadvisor: 1) Yes, we did have to get the children to show us how the lights work. 2) The breakfast for us was included as I had booked so far in advance. It was perfectly good and, if you're on a tight budget maybe going out and finding a croissant and a coffee elsewhere is your thing. Personally, I like to just go downstairs to have breakfast and pay the extra 7 Euros! The staff were delightful and always full of advice and interested in your wellbeing. All in all, a great start to our holiday and I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. My wife's sister's family (who were joining us for the cruise) stayed in a hotel in Las Ramblas. It was more expensive and in a very noisy, busy part of the city. We're glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, good value, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: OpheliaLondon
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. For some the location will not be ideal because it is a 15-20 min walk to the Gothic area however we found the location ideal as we enjoyed walking off dinner after our meal. It is also more peaceful than staying near to the Ramblas. There is also a full days attractions to be found in the immediate hotel area - the magic fountain is 2 minutes walk away as are the art museum and botanical gardens, also a shopping centre. The rooftop pool was very good. My only criticism of the hotel was that the wifi in the corner rooms was fairly wonky. Otherwise we had a very pleasant stay. Rooms are surprisingly large, also clean and modern. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: TwoSweds
Reviews.Content: I liked it. Very good location, we could walk down town (or take subway just outside door) and there was plenty of restaurants and shops around. Nice big rooms, Personally I would have hired a more qualified handyman to make the bathroom but it looked ok and worked good. We got one nigth for free when booking 5 nigths so I was very happy with the price. Staff was friendly. Absolutely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: cannylad1973
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally placed if you arrive in BCN at the airport (El Prat) and use the Aerobus. Get off the bus at Plaza Espana and the hotel is a 5 min walk on the left side of the Gran Via just past the old bullring (now shops and offices). The hotel itself is modern-chic, clean and comfortable. Our room was on the 5th floor overlooking the very busy Gran Via which cuts through the centre of the city. However, the rooms are very well soundproofed and the constant traffic didn't cause any problems. The room had full air-con/heating. The bathroom was very clean and quite spacious with a good selection of complimentary 'smellies'. Weather permitting, there is also a lovely rooftop pool. The hotel has a bar on the ground floor where prices are reasonable. The restaurant is on the lower ground floor. We had breakfast here which, though not cheap at €12, was ample. If you're on a room-only basis, best to walk down the Gran Via where there are plenty of cafes etc. Just down the Gran Via on the same side of the hotel is a lovely bar/restaurant 'Gallicia' where you can have Menu Del Dia for €9-10. This is a 3 course meal including bread with either wine/beer/water. To get to the heart of BCN - Plaza Catalunya, is about a 15 min walk or take the Metro at Plaza Espana which is 3 mins from the hotel. Its a short ride to Plaza Espana (3 stops).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Modern Hotel With Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: dav504
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the B Hotel quite a few times. It's a cool stylish boutique hotel with larger than average rooms, which while modern, are perhaps a little too stark and sterile looking. My favorite part is the rooftop pool and lounge area. While the pool is small, it is very stylish and perfect for cooling off while looking out at the city. The hotel is right next to the convention center (the Metro is Place Espana), and the neighborhood is in an attractive residential part of town, away from the touristy hub, but still close enough to the city center (Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas, which is a 10 minute bike ride away, or two metro stops). Compared to other comparable boutique hotels, the rates are very inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good looking Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ErtaiPT
Reviews.Content: The Hotel looks modern, service was good, friendly staff and I had a good view of Plaça d'Espanya. The room looked clean with a cool glassy bathroom with 'view'. Very good location, metro station right across the street and you can walk to the magic fountain and nearby spots. I had a little problem with the shower, but after reporting the problem, they fixed it quickly. The rooftop pool offers great views while bathing!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Annmariel1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a weekend trip to Barcelona. It is on a perfect bus route to and from the airport and the metro station is right outside. The hotel itself was perfect for what we wanted. the room was big enough, however i would have preferred a view... our window opened up onto the shutters that is part of the hotel front... it was a shame! the pool on the roof is perfect for those hot summer days! We didnt have breakfast here as it was €13 each per day - there is a perfectly good restaurant next door that you can get a croissant and coffee for €3 each!! would definatly stay here again and would recommend it to anyone wanting to see the sights.. the only downside is the beach is a bit far - 2 metro's away but only 10mins on each!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DannyDollars
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, cool quirky room and modern-chic bathroom - little dark but who cares! Roof top pool by far is the selling point for this hotel, it's actually bigger than it looks on the pics so you can do some (corner) lengths. But better for just lounging and looking over the side onto the hustle of the busy Placa de Espanya below. There's a great shopping centre right next door with loads of nices cafes so do not worry about buying into the breakfast (you can have a decent cup of coffee, orange juice and pastry each for around €11 for both) Staff were always very friendly and helpful. Will def stay here again and recommend to anyone. Oh, and it's good value too...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HW-K1924
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend this hotel; it's very modern and contemporary and offers a friendly service and value for money. The rooftop terrace/pool is amazing with views across the city. I can honestly say i have no negative feedback on this hotel as i couldn't fault it. I will certainly be returning to the B Hotel Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: SKandSK
Reviews.Content: We had a gorgeous room on the 6th floor, with a lovely view on the the statue and the mountain. The hotel is close to the metro, therefore very convenient! The staff is very helpful, so feel free to ask them for restaurants and directions. Barcelona is great, and we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: rhodry4
Reviews.Content: The staff were all really courteous and friendly upon our arrival. We had a top notch experience in terms of customer service. One of the receptionists was even kind enough to help take a picture of us in the hotel lobby, near the bar area. The double room we has was excellent as well. Our view wasn't much to shout about, but that didn't matter as it isn't important and we left the curtains closed. The double bed was comfortable and massive and perfect for a couple on holiday! No complaints about the bathroom facilites at all. One very minor point to note is the lack of coffee-making facilites in the room, however that's not actually important at all and I would not rate this hotel any less because of it. The hotel has a great location. There's a cool-looking shopping mall right beside the hotel and several big attractions are in the area as well. The walk into the centre of town isn't long, possibly around 20 minutes. For those preferring public transportation, there's a metro station right outside the hotel which can connect to anywhere easily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice swimming pool, good breakfast but too modern for its own good”
Reviews.Author: Bilsatan
Reviews.Content: Situated on the Placa Espanya and close to the metro, a covenient place to stay for some I guess, even if I prefer the centre or the beach. If you plan on walking to the city, be aware that some of the neighborhoods you may pass are not the safest. The hotel is very modernistic - perhaps too much? They actually provide you with a user manual to operate the lighting, and the blinds in the bathroom. The blinds are needed to block the view from the main room to the bathroom. There is no ironing possibilities. The hair dryer is difficult to use because of the design (the length of the cord). Free wireless internet is a huge plus, as is the safe in each room. The breakfast is very good, and open until 1100. The air condition is quite silent, and very effective. Sound proofing is not excellent, but I have experienced worse. The road workers outside did wake me up every morning, though. The best thing about the hotel is the semi-infinity pool on the roof. To shallow to swim properly in, but excellent for relaxation. There is a small bar there as well, but avoid the pre-mixed Mojito. The pool (and bar) closes at midnight. A nice place to stay if you are attending a conference or an exhibition close by. As a tourist, I would go for the city centre or the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBeachbum_01
Reviews.Content: B hotel is next to the Arenas shopping mall and movie complex.....and the Plaza Espana Metro stop. Found it easy to get around town....but yet removed from the Las Ramblas tourist environment. Rooftop pool/bar is great for relaxing and the views....but pool water is a bit chilly for my taste. Rooms are modern/minimalistic.....tub/shower can splash water onto slick marble floor which can get slippery. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: prisl
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with our stay at this hotel. The staff was always very helpful and the rooms were nice and clean. The view from the roof top was amazing and the hotel is very well situated from the main attractions in Barcelona as well as being close to the train/subway station. The only negative aspect was that the rooms are not totally soundproof as you can hear people come and go in the corridors, especially in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, we'll come back.”
Reviews.Author: barby_travels
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed there 4 nights. It was great, the bed is huge and our room was very quiet. I loved the swimming pool on the roof, always went there early in the morning and late in the afternoon. The light panel is terrible. You either keep all the lights on or off. It took me 3 days to understand how to turn the light in the bathroom on. That could be improved. You can easily get to the hotel from the airport with the bus number 46 for 1.45 euro. Breakfast is 13 euro. We didn't eat in as there is plenty of places around the hotel. The shopping mall Las Arenas the Barcelona opens at 10am and closes at 10pm. If you want to get your breakfast there try to wake up late. Otherwise there are other restaurants around. I would not recommend Tapa Tapa, we found the food mediocre and quite pricey. The metro station is 5 minutes walking distance. We usually walked to the city center in the morning (20 minutes or so) and came back by commuting in the afternoon. The staff is very friendly and they speak good English too. If we go back to Barcelona we'll stay there again, I really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: MissMartinih
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a couple of friends and we loved it. The rooms are large, clean and contemporary and the rooftop terrace and pool are cool and have great views. I've stayed in many hotels in Barcelona and this one is just fantastic value for money ;)

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice!”
Reviews.Author: Andreajaja
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 23jun-26jun2011. A day before arrival I requested a twin bedded room in a quiet location....and that's what we got. No view either, but very quiet. From the airport to Plaza Espanya we took the regular bus 46 (eur1.45 pp) wich has Plaza Espanya as the final destination...so nobody can go wrong here! You can also take the Aero-Bus, for eur5.30 pp it will take you there also (will save you about 10-15min). Final destination of this bus is Plaza Catalunya. If you arrive early at BCN Airport, you can buy a T10 ticket at the Tabacco shop or at the entrance of the trainstation (Renfe). This T10 ticket (wich you can use with more people) costs eur8.25 for 10x trips with metro or bus. Please note...T10 not valid on the Aero-Bus only for regular buses. Its a great and cheap way for exploring Barcelona...and so easy! Location from B-hotel worked perfect for us. Next to Las Arenas shopping mall.
