On the groundfloor of this mall you can find several breakfast/coffee places. We loved the bakery called "Enriche", good coffee and fantastic croissants and sandwiches. We didn't take the breakfast in the hotel (eur14). Please note...if you arrive at the hotel you can get a eur5 pp discount for breakfast..but ONLY when you arrange this at check-in!! Small children will pay half the price from the adults. Several restaurants close to the hotel (we liked Tapa Tapa) and with the metro you are 3 stops away from Plaza Catalunya&Ramblas area. The big bonus is the swimmingpool! It's great to jump in a pool after a long day of sightseeing in the busy and hot city. It was also nice to have a drink there with some nibbles, before going to dinner. The Negatives: Its difficult to get in the (deep) bath (very high step) and I can imagine that this would be a problem for older people or anyone who has physical problems. As the shower is also in the bath, this could be a problem too. It was not possible to leave a small bed lamp turned on during the night...its all on or all off. So, we had to leave the bathroom light on during the night...no big deal. No rooms available in this hotel for a family of four people! The maximum in one room is 3people. This time I stayed here with my daughter, but as there are no inter-connecting rooms either, I would have to stay in another hotel if I want to come back to Barcelona with the rest of my family. Two separate rooms is no option for us as we have small children.

Reviews.Title: “Not gay friendly!”
Reviews.Author: BrightonFiona
Reviews.Content: One of the reason we booked this hotel was that it was stated as 'gay-friendly' (http://www.barcelona.com/hotels/b_hotel). We booked a double room direct over the hotel website. On arriving the receptionist asked if I had meant to book a double room. I said that we had and then she went on to say that they only had twin rooms! We said we weren't very happy with that and they told us there was nothing they could do about it as they were fully booked that night. They said that they might be able to move the two beds together the following day. We pointed out that they were fully booked and with that one of the bookings, which we had made 3 weeks previously, was ours! Eventually they agreed to give us a double room which was immediately available so was this just homophobic behaviour? I can cope with homophobic behaviour having had to for most of my life, however, we booked into a hotel that is showing on a Barcelona website as 'gay-friendly'!!! It couldn't have been more unpleasant and ruined the start of a four day holiday. One of the receptionists who had been most unpleasant to us on arrival then couldn't have been more pleasant when we went to book out. Was she just pleased to see us go? What a pity. I am very respectful of people's views and beliefs and that is why we booked into a 'gay-friendly' hotel. Why state it if you aren't though?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: howardek
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights and loved this hotel. Staff were helpful and friendly. Area was nice and quiet; about 30 min walk to the city centre. You could get the metro a couple of stops to the centre either, the stop was across the road from the hotel and it was only 1.45eur for a single journey. The pool on the roof was lovely and had a fantastic view. Rooms were comfortable and our double bed was massive. Hotel was maybe a little pricey but was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my god! What a great resort”
Reviews.Author: lancecampbell64
Reviews.Content: This place rocks. Everything about our expeience was awsome! The staff was amazing. There was nothing we needed. That they dd not attend to. The location and the place was so rich in everything

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with stunning rooftop view!”
Reviews.Author: janita23
Reviews.Content: B is for Beautiful!! Quite possibly one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Very modern and lovely ambience when you come out of the elevator (lights come on in a warm way). Only thing here is when you do step out, there is a grass-like smell which some people may not like. Internet Wi-Fi access was a tad too slow for our liking. Beds were comfortable, no loud noise, the view was off the main street, I think it was called Gran Via, but if you look towards Placa Espanya, it's a better one so if you can, ask for a view of the front of the hotel. Very close in proximity to Espanya station and the new shopping mall. Go to the top of the mall and you can see your friends at the hotel sitting by the rooftop pool! I'd say the pool is a tad bit small though but nevertheless, view is wonderful. I was a bit disappointed that we didn't have complimentary water bottles or shower caps. Safe deposit box was easy to operate but beware of the "battery low" sign. The bathroom and bedroom are separated by a sheet of glass but they have a blind that can be operated in the bathroom only. Great idea!! Would avoid breakfast though as there wasn't much on offer for how much they were asking. My tip would be to get some supplies from the supermarket at the new mall or visit a beautiful bakery called Enrich in the same shopping mall - best croissants ever! Getting a bit off-track here, but I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in the end”
Reviews.Author: Foxyficat
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here on honeymoon. My initial impression was disappointment. Despite booking some time ago and being in communication with the hotel only days before regarding booking tickets etc, when we arrived they had no room available for us so we had to wait in the bar area for over half an hour, with no offer of a drink, until a room was found. The room was on the "executive" floor opposite the lift and was rather noisy. It was smaller than i anticipated from the description and the independant photos. We did ask about upgrading but was told it wasnt worth it. Other than that it was fine. We had a bottle of cava on the house for being on honeymoon. Bed was comfy, bathroom was nice but not much privacy so i wouldnt want to have shared with someone i didnt know. There was a small bar and a pool on the roof top which was nice and had good views. We didnt eat breakfast here as there were many places around to eat an we didnt want to be tied down by time. There is a shopping centre very near with lots of food places. One in particular (Enrique Tomas) we went to twice for an early lunch and would thoroughly recommend. The metro is only a few minutes away so access to all the sights are easy, and the bus tours have a stop nearby too. The staff at the hotel were helpful and most spoke good english. Im not sure I would go back, but I would certainly recommend it as a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJH008
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 3 nights in Barcelona and had a wonderful experience at this hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 11am and were expecting to have to come back later to chck in but out room was already waiting for us. Best of all we got a complimentary upgrade! The room was absolutely enormous with a very comfortable king size bed. The hotel is very modern and everything looked very new. The only issue we had was with the bath - it leaked water all over the floor everytime we showered so had to get new towels each day. It was also a bit noisy in the room because we were overlooking Place Espanya but didn't bother us too much. However if you're looking for a quiet room this might not be the place for you. The terrace and pool on the roof is really great and we found ourselves wishing it would warm up so we could swim. There is also a bar on the roof where you can order beers. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel so I'm not sure whether it was any good. Checkout time is only 12pm so if (like us) you're not early risers, this is a definite plus. And we could leave our bags at the hotel once we'd checked out so were able to enjoy our last day in Barcelona. The hotel is not located right in the center of Barcelona but we preferred it that way. The EuroBus drops you in Place Espanya and only costs 5.30 euros one was so it's very convenient for the airport. There is also a metro stop about 30m from the hotel so it's so easy to get around. We bought a travel card for 4 day for 16 euros which made our lives easier but you can also but a book of 10 trips on the metro for 7 euros if you would prefer to walk more. WE found the metro to be extremely reliable and it stays open until 2am on a Friday and all night on a Saturday!! I'd definitely recommend this hotel if you're looking for something convenient, clean, modern and with good service!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Amazing pool and veiw”
Reviews.Author: europefein
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in Barcelona on Recomendations from a friend. Although it was a little far to walk into gran via and la ramblas the metro is about 20 mts away and its so easy to get to the main bits. The tour bus leaves not far from the hotel and the water fountain that is a must see is only about a 15 min walk away. The view from the pool was amazing, the front desk was very efficient. One night the maids forgot to replace our towels but that was easily fixed. The breakfast is average and there are so many pastry shops around that are very yummy for breakfast. I thought it did pretty well for only being a 3 star resort. Being Barcelona there are a lot of sirens so you might want a back room. It was also one of the only hotels that had about 3 english speaking chanels including a movie chanel. But overall we had a pretty good stay here and i would recomend it. also just make sure you get a room away from where the maids go in and out of they can be a bit noisy! If clubbing is what you are going to Barcelona for then you are better off staying in Las remblas or near port olympic.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jstjarnstrom
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel at Plaza Espanya. Modern interior design with a cute little roof top pool and bar that we unfortunately only got to use one day because of the weather. Easy to get from and to the airport with Aerobus that stopped just a few hundred meters from the hotel. It was also right next to the metro which will take you pretty much anywhere in Barcelona. The room was pretty and very modern. Only bad thing about it was probably the small bathtub, the confusing (yet pretty cool) lighting system, and that the bed was quite hard. Other than that everything was perfect. There are also a big shopping mall right next to the hotel an quite a few restaurants even though you might want to go into mote of the 'city center' (i.e. Las Ramblas and Plaza Real) for more choices and people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: PsPalmerio
Reviews.Content: B-hotel is one the most interesting hotel that I ever gone. Modern, beautiful, friendly and with very good rooms. The people are amazing, the breakfast is fantastic and the localization very good. And more than this: the price is reduced for evetything that it has. The swiming pool in the top has a beautiful of Barcelone. Consider it as a good option. Paulo Palmerio

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: DrGowski
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed at BHotel after a long trip on the train from Paris and we were delighted with the value we received for our money. This hotel is in a great location looking over plaza espanya & walking distance (without too much luggage) from Sants train station. My favourite part of this hotel is the swimming pool on the roof where you can get a great jug of Sangria! I will come back to Barcelona soon and more and likely being staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: myhtos Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: B Hotel is a perfect place to stay when visiting Barcelona. My wife and I was in Barcelona for a long weekend, friday to thursday, late march. Barcelona was the meetingpoint for us and another couple who flew in from another part of the world. The main reason for our stay was a concert at Palau St. Jordi (Roger Waters ,The Wall) and the hotel has a perfect location. It is also a perfect place for starting tours around Barcelona. Shopping. The nearest building is the newest shoppingcenter in Barcelona. After a long day in the streets of Barcelona the rooftop terrace is exelent for relaxing. Nice rooms, god beds, god breakfast and a obliging staff. Thank you for making a plesent stay in Barcelona. Svein, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in excellent price”
Reviews.Author: nsaroul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights in B-hotel (February 22-26, 2011). At first we were a little bit disappointed because of massive restoration work in Arena de Toros, which is just next to the hotel. You have to walk around the block to get to the metro, and this is a bit disturbing.The sttaff was very helpful and polite. We asked for a quiet room and got one, but with no view. The room was very modern and clean. The breakfast was not very rich, but it was adequate. One night we had some tapas in the lobby, well cooked and well priced. About the location: if you don't mind using the Metro, whose stop is nearby, it is 3 stops from the center, else it is a full 20 min walk. So, it is surely not centrally located, but neither far away.It is in perfect location to visit the Contemporary Art Museum, the Spanish Village and the famous Plaza Espanya fountain is just 2 min away. About the price: We took the offer "pay 3, stay 4" and paid less than 200 euros for 4 nights, breakfast included. For this hotel, we believe it is a very satisfactory price. We would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great breakfast & not in the hubub !!”
Reviews.Author: vhoney
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for the Barcelona marathon. Perfect location for the expo & the start of the race, but a 10min walk to Las Ramblas if that is the place you're seeking. (Please note there are so many more interesting places than the touristic Ramblas if you're willing to find them). Hotel was excellent - very clean, excellent facilities - pool (needed after 26.2miles, even in March !), & an excellent breakfast spread. Staff also went that extra mile for my fiance's birthday with cava & cake at last minute. During our stay there was building work going on right next to the hotel. It was quite noisy together with the main road the hotel is on. But this was only when we needed to open the window. Otherwise it was fine & I can't think it will go on much longer. Construction looked nearly completed - they were just working on the subway. Would definitely visit this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: PensionersWales
Reviews.Content: Lovely, modern hotel with beautiful rooms and bathrooms. Free wi-fi, friendly staff and bountiful buffet breakfast. Very conveniently situated for Metro and airport bus. Stunning rooftop pool and terrace with panoramic views over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: andyb949
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel and would recommend it, but I was a little disappointed for a few reasons. Firstly, there's a massive building site right outside the door at the moment. It means you have to take a five minute detour just to get to the metro station just across the road, and I also didn't appreciate the work starting up at 9am on a Sunday. Second, like all hotels with very modern designs they tend to age quite quickly, and the repairs are never carried out to the same standard as the original build. So while the hotel is very clean, it is showing quite a lot of wear in places. Third, there's no restaurant in the hotel, and not many good ones in the immediate vicinity. Breakfast is expensive as well, so I didn't bother with it. Fourth, the location is fine, but it is a good 20 minute walk or so to get to the city centre. But the staff are great, the hotel is quite nice, my room was spacious enough. If you want something modern and away from the hustle and bustle of La Ramblas then it's worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “great modern hotel with lovely staff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: tagaray
Reviews.Content: We really loved how innovative and crisp the design of this hotel was and it was also very comfortable and clean. Convenient parking in the lower level and a convenient location for metro access and interesting city sites. The pool area on the roof is spectacular. Too bad I was there in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable hotel with good transport links.”
Reviews.Author: AlisonTBirmingham_UK
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in this hotel with my boyfriend and found it to be a clean and comfortable base for exploring Barcelona. I found the room a bit too "modern" for my liking, as it was quite dark and the key and lighting system was a bit fiddly but it was clean with a really comfortable bed. The main downside of the hotel is it's location, as it is a way from the centre of the city. We did walk to Plaza de Catanlunya/Las Ramblas a couple of times. It was a good 30mins walk which is fine, but as the city isn't that compact it meant we ended up doing loads more walking on top of that. Having said that the hotel is right by a metro so it's easy to get around the city that way and I think staying near Las Ramblas is over-rated. But I would definitely recommend getting a T-10 ticket and using the metro if staying in this hotel! We didn't bother with the breakfast because the prices were so high (14 euros per person per day!) but found a good cafe (Bens) over the road. It was far too cold to use the swimming pool this time of year but I think it would be great in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Really good city hotel, but a bit far from La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Illan-and-Stef
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and arrived to chilled champagne (we had mentioned we were on honeymoon when booking). Room was modern, spacious bathroom, very clean sheets and towels, excellent buffet breakfast (book more than 3 for a discount), computers with internet, excellent service from staff, plus a mini fridge and safe in the room were very handy. Only let down was location - although its very close to train and bus - we didn't easily find places to eat nearby, although did find out on our last night that there's a shopping / restaurant area just a block around the corner. Also there was construction happening on the footpath which blocked access to the main intersection, so we had to walk all the way around the other side of the road to access the train / bus. Overall B-Hotel was really nice to stay in, we felt it was good value compared to paying the same for somewhere closer to La Rambla but not as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lazo2310
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the coolest hotels i have stayed in. Great location, Great price and very easy to get to and from the airport or city centre by bus or metro. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bryanlett
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in the excellent hotel! we were searching for an affordable hotel that was clean and in a good location and this hotel delivered! the staff were extremely friendly on arrival and they all spoke perfect English. They were able to direct us to all the major sights and highlighted to us what we must see, even some sights which we had overlooked in our own research! The room was spacious and the bed was massive! Modern layout with interesting lighting! The breakfast buffet offered a large selection of food. the excellent metro service in the city meant that we were not far from anywhere in the city. also very close to where the airport bus stops. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikegscot
Reviews.Content: Just back from trip to Barcelona mainly to catch Barca v Malaga at the footie with some friends.We had a wonderful time as the hotel is perfectly placed for the city centre or the nou camp.Rooms are very modern and clean couldn't have asked for better.Breakfast has a wide choice and was part of our deal. Staff very friendly and the city is gorgeous.The metro is right outside the hotel, great for getting around the city.T10 ticket is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ayeshabakht
Reviews.Content: I arranged a 2 day conference from London and I had a lot of communication from the team at the B Hotel. Our 2 day conference went without any hitches, everything I arranged with them was executed smoothly and successfully and as arranged. The bedrooms were great and very clean and modern and exceptionally spacious considering the cost of the room! My colleagues all commented how great the location and the standard of the hotel is. The staff were very helpful especially Josep (thank you Josep for making everything easy)!! I would highly recommend this hotel for business or for pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED IN ALL ASPECTS”
Reviews.Author: sportscoach55
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home in freezing Northern Ireland... Staying at the B-Hotel in Barcelona was one of the greatest value for money vacations I have ever had.... The hotel is situated adjacent to the bull fighting arena, which is about 20 minutes from the airport....... Firstly, I was greeted with a smiling face by a young lady who spoke perfect English.... The rooms are very modern ... very clean and very comfortable..... We had an excellent breakfast every morning with bacon scrambled egg as well as the continental breakfast and was made to feel very welcome by all the staff.... The roof-top pool is an added feature.... although a little too chilly to make full use of ..... I did have a little paddle..... brrrr. The hotel is exceptionally well situated to all of the activities that Barcelona has to offer.... don't miss La Ramblas..... with the St Josephs market in middle of it..... the really unusual park in the north of the city..... and I need say no more than "Nou camp" In the words of that famous film actor................... "I WILL BE BACK" !!!! P.S. Make sure you purchase a four day metro ticket (21 euro) .... it just makes getting from place to place in Barcelona so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Construction site outside could be a problem”
Reviews.Author: Bomber-K
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is so close to the Pl. Espanya metro station, the construction site immediately outside the front door of the hotel made it a little bit difficult to access, no big deal. People started working around 7am in the morning, and it made me woke up till then, so, not the best hotel if you enjoy night out and sleep late a bit. A little bit difficult to find a decent spanish restaurant around, and we had to go back to La Rambla for meal one night. A little bit disappointed on the state of the room as the woodern floor have many scratches.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, nice cool room and good location”
Reviews.Author: parky24
Reviews.Content: We decided to go away for New Year and picked Barcelona for easy direct flights and reasonably priced hotel for the time of year. The hotel was easy to find and a great location. Its a 5 min walked to Espanya Metro station which is really close to Fira Conference Centre and Montjuic. Although there were roadworks which meant you had to go the long way round to Espanya but thats not the hotel's fault. We used the Metro a lot as its convenient and cheaper than a taxi. We walked once from Las Ramblas which took about 25 mins. Our room was big and spacious, bit weird at first with all the trendy lights and a glass windowed bathroom but with blinds which you can close. The bed was really comfy and quiet - I heard no outside traffic and no noise for other rooms or corridors. The only little thing I would make a comment about was the lack of shower gel, shampoo and conditioner - due to the restrictions on airlines these days it makes it easier not to take your own for a 3 day break. Also, I think an ipod dock or something wouldn't have gone a miss. For a trendy hotel like this I think its a nice little touch instead of just a TV. The staff were ok, one lady called Rocio (I think) was really helpful and one of the bar staff was really nice too. Apart from that minor with shampoo etc it was really nice - I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, clean and Functional but soul less”
Reviews.Author: yuriko
Reviews.Content: Hotel was within 20 mins drive of el prat airport, cost 25 euros in taxi - very reasonable I thought. The hotel is very modern, within 20 mins walking distance of La Rambla. The nearest metro is jus across the road. GranVia is a very busy, noisy road, and while we were there the pavement outside the hotel was being dug up, and re paved, so the noise was pretty intrusive. Breakfast is extra at 13 euros, and only a buffet, so I would advise a short walk down the road to one of the many cafes, or if you are missing your starbucks fix, hop on the metro to the Universitat stop. The rooms are clean, and functional. Room service was quick and reasonably priced. I found the beds to be far too hard, and suffered with back ache after the second night. The temparture in the room varies wildly, from very cold at night to overly warm in the morning. Its not the sort of room you feel you can relax in, more a base to sleep and explore from. I wouldnt stay here again, as there are so many more hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Cooool hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2ravel
Reviews.Content: Just 1 stop from the Airport by the Airport bus. A bit a way from the central but only few mins away so no probs there, we walk most of the time anyway. The hotel is modern, big room with big glass window, the swimming pool is amazing. Bathroom is great too! Free wifi and there's a computers to use too. Staff is very friendly and helpful, I love this hotel so much, very sad to leave. Very recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: azyb
Reviews.Content: Trust all the good reviews - hotel is fab. Great location, really modern and great value for money. The only negative is that there are no irons in the hotel for you to borrow at all (this was a first for me!) so you have to pay to have them done which is very expensive! At least six euros an item!! Other than that I can't fault the place. I paid £58 per night and I would say that the room is easily worth £100 - 120, based on other European hotels I have visited. Oh and watch out for pickpockets when you are out and about... it's true what they say, so take care!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - excellent caring staff”
Reviews.Author: trip2010_10
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the B-Hotel. What makes it special is the attention and high quality of service offered. The rooms are comfortable, clean and stylish. I most certainly would return to this hotel and definitely recommend it to colleagues and friends. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottTravellingScott
Reviews.Content: This is a truely great hotel!! Stayed here for 3 nights in June! The rooms are top quality, very large and spacious and are more like the quality of 5 star room than 3 stars room! A modern hotel! I like all the fixtures and fittings in it! lovely hotel! Phone the hotel up to try and get a better deal than is quoted on their website! They are happy to help! Great location, right next to a lot of bus routes including the tourist buses! Had a great time at this hotel! There is a swimming pool on the roof, which I didnt get to try out sadly! I would highly recommend that you stay here when in Barca! A great nights sleep will be had as well! Very well priced for the quality and area!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get - disappointed overall.”
Reviews.Author: cpstu
Reviews.Content: We paid a lot for this hotel and therefore expected a luxury experience. Yes the roof terrace is lovely but in late October you can't use the pool - it felt like we were paying extra for that. The room was spacious, nice view and the bathroom quirky but it felt like nothing had been done since the hotel was first opened ie a bit scratched, the water leaked onto the floor of the room from the bathroom, air con temperamental. We have no problem with small things like that if we didn't pay premium prices! Finally it must be called B-Hotel because the the room decor was various shades of brown - not very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fb252
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price you pay. The design and atmosphere of the hotel are thought in detail. Rooms are spacious. Ask for a room facing Espana Square for a spacial panorama. You environment, very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, amazing pool”
Reviews.Author: thunderkiss69
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for couples. Room is very clean, spacious, comfortable and quiet, with a huge bed. The bathroom has a good shower and tub, but its glass walls make it hard to get some privacy. Breakfast is great, served in a very beautiful room with huge windows with a view. The pool is awesome, with an amazing view to Montjuic and cool ambient music. Bar prices are very reasonable, specially for a hotel. There are not many eating or shopping options in the area, but the subway station is across the street and in 5 minutes you're in Plaza Catalunya station. Staff at the front desk was not very helpful when I asked about nearby restaurants and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Super Trendy with Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: freshfromthelab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon trip. The hotel was very easy to get to from the airport and we loved the design concept. The front desk staff was super welcoming and very helpful, also spoke excellent english. They knew that it was our honeymoon and sent up a bottle of cava! The rooftop pool and terrace were amazing! The location was great for checking out Montjuic, MNAC, and the Magic Fountain. We had a wonderful stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: xevi11
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, well located right next to Placa Espanya, with a very efficient recepción.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 19Nicos29
Reviews.Content: I stayed only 1 night here at the B hotel in Barcelona. Personnel is friendly, place looks clean and rooms are great. Best value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel BIG TIME!!!”
Reviews.Author: LovesDogs3000
Reviews.Content: October 2010 Here is a copy of the message I sent to Sylvia, the B Hotel Barcelona Spain, hotel manager: Sylvia, I stayed one night at the B Hotel in Barcelona thinking it was similar to your Jazz Hotel. I was mistaken. Upon entering I found the lobby unclean with ragged upholstery, a wooden walkway in need of cleaning and more. Then I was given a $245. per night corner Superior room with torn curtains. (someone had attempted to repair shire curtains with black thread) The bathtub shower configuration sprayed water all over the sides of the tub because of poor design. The lighting was verying confusing. Some lamps turned on with floor foot buttons and others from the master switch which had a confusing design of having to keep a room key in a slot. The carpet was dirty as well. If I had booked more than one night I would have turned arounnd and left after seeing the lobby's appearance. I was very disappointed. I will never stay at youur hotell again and I will tell everyone I know to stay away. The video sex rental clearly visable across the street seemed to send another warning of "Stay away". I will post this review on www.tripadvisor.com Close your hotel,, repair it or lower the prices. You choose. David Sebastian Long Beach, California

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor scored again-A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harv52
Reviews.Content: Once again we trusted tripadvisor to find us a good hotel and were not disapointed. We walked straight out of the airport, straight onto the aerobus and off at the first stop. Yes, its about 30 mins walk from las ramblas but believe me you do not want to be that close to that area! The rooms were all clean, modern and the pool on the roof was an added bonus after a day sightseeing. Staff were very friendly and couldnt be more helpful. A word of warning though! We read all the warnings regarding pickpockets and took extra special care. However my front pocket was still picked on a virtually empty tube train without me hardly noticing. We were also followed through a busy park by someone who I was sure was looking for a bag snatch. So be warned petty crime in barcelona is rife and you need to keep your wits about you at all times!!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Christophe987654321
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a wonderful shopping trip to Barcelona and had a perfect stay a B Hotel. Although the hotel is not situated in de center of the city, a taxi ride will only cost you 5-8 euros. The hotel is well maintained, clean, trendy, and has a wonderful super friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are really nice, spacious and bright, especially the corner rooms. Comfortable beds for a noise free sleep. After a long day of shopping it 's great to have a swim on top of the roof overseeing the Placa Espana. It's worth every euro and I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “B-ecause it's worth it”
Reviews.Author: Rousers
Reviews.Content: Modern, contemporary, minimalist hotel in a good location. For those familiar with the Hoxton (London, UK), it’s similar in style but much bigger. The rooftop pool was a welcome bonus after a hard days’ sightseeing; it’s not big enough to swim lengths in, but just the tonic for a quick dip after a hard days’ sightseeing, helped by a reasonably-priced bar too (certainly better than crashing out in your room). Location-wise, it’s really good. Just off the Plaza Espanya and, while a glance at a map might make you think it’s far from the centre it’s not. There’s a metro station virtually outside, giving access to multiple lines (the ones you want for most of the sites). If you want to stretch your legs, it’s about 30mins walk to La Rambla (it’s a nice area, down a wide avenue). Plus there’s a “bicing” station virtually outside (this is the public bicycle hire similar to what they have in Paris and London). There are also plenty of busses. First stop (I think) for the airport coach is Plaza Espanya, You can also get the local bus (number 46, I think), which is cheaper and only a little slower (by 10mins maybe).

Reviews.Title: “I will go there next time, too”
Reviews.Author: tundina
Reviews.Content: I can just recommend this hotel. We had a very nice price - last minute booked the same day of travel. You can get to the hotel by buy from the airport (do not need to take the Aerobus for 5euros, just a regular one for 1.40) in 20 min. Therefore it was easy to catch this bus in the morning when we left the hotel early in the morning. It is on the Placa Espanya which is well supported by metro and bus lines to get to the city center, however, if you want to go up to Monte Juic is is a small bus ride, too. The hotel was very clean. We did not have breakfast there, but walked to the market every morning, so we could taste local food with the locals. It was just 5 min far from the hotel. It is also easy to arrive to the football stadium from the hotel, there is a direct bus line to get there. We did not ask for the room with the panoramic windows, but we still got a room from which we had a wonderful view to the Museum of Catalunya and the waterfall. It was a very nice hotel for cheap, last minute price and very good location to the center.

Reviews.Title: “This was an excellent pick for our stay in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Mags072
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the B-Hotel. It was very clean. The rooms were nice and modern and very comfortable. The pool on the top floor had a great view and was an added bonus to our vacation. Although some say that it's a farther away from the city center we thought this was an excellent location considering the metro system in Barcelona is very efficient and everything is just a stop away. I am glad we stayed farther away from Las Ramblas because we had a nicer hotel for a better value. Overall, this was an excellent pick. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend this to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with good links to metro and in nice area”
Reviews.Author: handleyr
Reviews.Content: We stopped for 3 nights, up on arrival we were given a free upgrade on our room. We were offered the full breakfast for €10 each per night but we didn't bother as there are some nice cafes just down the road where you can get something for far cheaper. The room was huge, very modern and had a great view over looking Plaza Espanya. You do get a little bit of traffic noise but nothing that will stop you from sleeping. The air con in the room is great and really cools the place down when its really hot. The bed was one of the comfiest i have ever stayed in at a hotel. As everyone seems to mention the roof top pool is good to relax by after a hard days sight seeing, we had no problem getting a sun bed at about 5ish each night, and the bar prices are reasonable compared to other places in the city. Beware the pool is freezing but you get brilliant views of Plaza Espanya, you can just sit there and watch the world go by. The hotel is really close to Espanya metro station so very easy to get to and from. Plaza Espanya is a nice place, at night its worth going to the magic fountains just across the road, it got really busy when we were there but well worth it! I would have any concerns returning to this hotel, the staff were very helpful, rooms really big and nicely decorated, it was great for our little break!

Reviews.Title: “Fab funky hotel with gorgeous rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: kate_dafnis
Reviews.Content: LOVED B Hotel - it's a little further out of the centre of Barcelona than we usually stay but its right by Espana metro stop which is a 5 - 10 minute ride to La Ramblas - alternatively its about a 25 minute walk. Having said that we loved the contemporary style, massive comfy beds and stylish little rooftop pool. Breakfast was an extra 10 Euros if you bought when you arrived at the hotel (14 if pre-booked) but the selection available was great and its easier than walking out to find somewhere every morning. Barca Sants train station was a 5 minute cab ride and only 10 mins to the airport. Will definitely be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Roof top swimmingpool does the trick!”
Reviews.Author: eaglebayCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at B-hotel for 3 nights in august (don't go in august unless you like it really hot!). B-hotel is just next to Plaza Espanya and be sure you go and see the music-colour fountain from thursday-sunday 9-11 pm .... very beautiful! The B-hotel is very modern in its design. A special feature is that you can see the bathtub through a window in the bedroom!! The breakfast buffet was very good and the lady in charge very effective! The roof top swimming pool is smallish but big enough though. Very nice when the weather is as hot as in august. Unfortunately there was some road-construction-work when we were there ..... made it a bit noisy on the roof! Would stay a B-hotel another time!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and confortable”
Reviews.Author: lmorandini
Reviews.Content: If you appreciate modern design, chill-out music, good breakfast and a location at a transportation hub in Barcelona, B-Hotel should be your choice. Pros: the roof swimming pool and bar is small but the view is excellent, the Magic fountain and the Barcelona fair are close by, the breakfast is rather good (real freshly squashed orange juice!), the room comfortable (not large, though), Internet is free an very fast, (comes both as wired and wireless), Cons: traffic noise, which forced us to sleep with windows closed (the tick windows made for a very good acoustic insulation and we had a quiet sleep), the breakfast is extra, but the clerk at the reception made a nice discount and we went for it... and did not regret the choice.

Reviews.Title: “A "do it yourself" hotel”
Reviews.Author: sn_murphy
Reviews.Content: The room is decorated in the minimalist style, small and sparse but clean. It took some time to figure out how to operate the lights and shower. The best feature was the location. It is near Montjuic and a subway station. And free Wi-Fi and internet access is available. Even so, this hotel could use a refresher course on customer service. The beds were comfortable. Our room did not have an alarm clock or iron. My friend was told that she only had one hour to use the iron. Although the telephone contains a button to check voice mail, staff informed me that the callers cannot actually leave voice mail messages. A lit voice mail button only informs you that someone has called your room! We asked the clerk (Cecilia/Cecily?) to make dinner reservations at a particular restaurant for us because we were attending a day-long tour. She left a note for us stating that the restaurant, Inopia, did not require reservations. We took a taxi to the restuarant and learned that the name had been changed to "Lolita," and that the restuarant was not accepting any additional diners that night. Makes us wonder whether she even called the restaurant at all because she never mentioned the name change.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality, value and location - Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Power_E
Reviews.Content: I would really recommend this hotel - great value and really high quality. Came across this hotel randomly through Expedia as I was booking a last minute city break to Barcelona! I've never been before. I quickly checked Trip Advisor and all the reviews were great, and then checked the B Hotel website - where I discovered it was actually cheaper to book through their own website than Expedia! We got a 98euros a night rate, so for 3 nights came to £80 a night. The hotel is in a great location, just off Plaza Espanya. The metro is right across the street, from which you can get anywhere in the city! You can also easily walk to the main tourist areas, like Las Ramblas, in about 20 minutes along Gran Via de Le Corts Catalanes. If you want to explore Mont Juic and the Olympic Stadium, you just walk right out the hotel and across the Plaza, it's only 5 mins walk away. The 'Aerobus' to and from the Airport stop right on Plaza Espanya across the plaza. Also the open top tour buses pick up and stop again just across the Plaza. The hotel itself is exceptionally clean, modern, and tidy. The hotel staff speak perfect English and are extremely helpful and kind. We seemed to be upgraded to their 'Executive' rooms on the 7th Floor. The room was large, air-conditioned, with a balcony, mini-bar, TV and ensuite bathroom. We were in a regular B-Room as opposed to a B-Corner Room. Although the Plaza is busy with traffic, the rooms are practically sound proof. Light sleepers need not worry! The roof pool is fantastic, with views right out across the city. They give you towels in recepion. And there's also a bar, where you can order any food or drink, cocktails, pizzas etc. There is also a bar in the foyer, and a breakfast room on the first floor - although we didn't opt to have breakfast here. On a side note - I'd hugely recommend the restaurant Cervecería Catalana on C/ Mallorca, 236. It's a 10 minute metro ride away. We had this recommended, and loved it so much we went there 2 nights out of the 3 we stayed in Barca. Read the reviews on this site to find out why. Amazing tapas, bafflingly cheap, brilliant atmosphere. Exactly everything you'd want in an authentic Spanish tapas restaurant. You can't book, but we never waited more than 30 mins for a table - And it's lovely standing out in the street with a glass of wine whilst you wait :) Anyway - I'm really impressed with the rate we got on this hotel - i've stayed in much lower quality hotels and paid a lot more for them. So if you want to be assured of a really good quality, good value, hotel then I highly recommend B Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant clean modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Pabl099
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the B-Hotel was for a week in August. I wasn’t sure my girlfriend would like our choice because our last two hotels were charming, quiet, old style places. The kind you fall in love with and enjoy almost as much as the holiday itself. So the B-Hotel with its modern décor, fancy lighting and sky edge rooftop pool - would she like it? She loved it!! We all did! Along with my two children we found the B-Hotel an ideal base to explore Barcelona. Out from the bustle of the centre but only a few minutes walk from great transport links the hotel offered clean comfortable rooms. The rooftop pool is a great place to relax till dark after a hard day walking. Drink prices and room service weren’t any more expensive than restaurants nearby. We would return to the B-Hotel if ever in Barcelona again. Do visit Bens bakery across the road for breakfast one day. Lovely little place.

Reviews.Title: “B for brill!”
Reviews.Author: AK1972
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at the B Hotel and it was perfect! The hotel is in a great location just of Pl Espanya which has a Metro stop and loads of bus stops to link you to the city centre which is about 15 min walk or 5 minutes on a bus or metro,we got the 46 bus from the airport which worked out at 60p as we used a T10 travel card instead of £5.50 for the aero bus and stops at the same stops and takes about 10 minutes more The hotel is also only 2 minutes from the magic fountains The hotel is done in a real modern style and the roof top pool was perfect for cooling dip after a hard days sightseeing -the only small complaint is they could do with with a few more sunbeds

Reviews.Title: “WORTH THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: KATERINA-CYPRUS
Reviews.Content: B Hotel is not right in the center of Barcelona but that is better because Barcelina can be very loud and noisy, especially at night. The staff wasd very helpful and knew everything that we asked they even kept our luggage for five days because we didi not want to take all our luggage to Mallorka. Price is very good. Next to a metro station, aerobus sto and bus stop. I wouls recommend it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop pool is a must.”
Reviews.Author: nickfoster53
Reviews.Content: My only complaint was the rooftop was so great, I never wanted to leave the hotel! Seriously, it's a little ways a away from everything, but you can take the subway a block away which is really easy to use. Super modern hotel. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel offering good value at...”
Reviews.Author: QjawOnTour
Reviews.Content: Clean modern hotel offering good value at a practical location. Everything within reach through Barça's efficient metro systems just a few steps away at pl Espanya. Great starting point for walks down Gran via to pl Catalunya (15) min, or to the magic fountain towards the university area and the hill above the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with great transportation options”
Reviews.Author: LeaTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely modern and minimalistic. I stayed at the hotel for four nights in total shouldering a trip that I took into the Pyrennees and Costa Brava. The use of technology within the hotel with the sensor lighting is quite amazing and state of the art. Have not encountered this anywhere in my travels. Metro station and Aerobus were so close for transportation options - I could be in Placa Catalunya, Barri Gotic, or Placa Sant Jaume in a matter of minutes. It was nice being able to walk so close to Montjuic and view the evening fountain shows. I would also recommend not getting a room overlooking Placa Espana because it does tend to get noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, great service, loved the roof top”
Reviews.Author: pullogaroua
Reviews.Content: I organized a group trip to Barcelona and stayed at the B-Hotel with 9 friends in five rooms for four days. From the very first contact the staff of the hotel was positvely falling over themselves to please us. I have rarely encountered such unanimously eager friendliness and helpfulness at any hotel. The rooms are very stylish and quite comfortable, the bathrooms are very, very nice and hanging out on the roofdeck was a highpoint of our stay. Although the location is slightly off the beaten path it is hardly remote and very easy to get to and from by taxi or Metro. The price was VERY reasonable, considering how nice the hotel is, and a MUCH better deal than any of the places I looked at near Las Ramblas or Plaza de Catalunya. I would love to stay at the hotel again and would recommend it enthusiastically to just about anyone (unless you want serious luxury or have to be right in the middle of things).

Reviews.Title: “Modern, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wombat27
Reviews.Content: Good location. It's not in the heart of the touristy areas, but I quite liked that. It's close to Espanya Metro station, which is very convenient for getting to see the main attractions. We had a room facing the back, so couldn't hear any outside noise. The building next door seems to have been finished, but I imagine there will still be roadworks. Was quiet at the weekend though. Good value, attractive room. Not a bad size for a hotel in a major European city. The bathrooms are not particularly soundproofed! Entertaining blind next to the shower... Pool was lovely. Don't expect an olympic size though - just enough to cool off after a day's hard sightseeing. Reception staff were really helpful and spoke good English. There's wifi and a computer that you can use in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Prolix50
Reviews.Content: I chose the B-hotel because I just had one day in Barcelona between flights, and being right by the Plaza de Espana it's the first stop for the airport bus (or take the 46 bus and save about 4 euros each way for about 10 minutes more) with very good metro connections to the rest of the city. Check-in was very friendly and they upgraded me to a superior (i.e., larger) room. Rooms were very modern and minimalist. Many complain about the lighting, and I agree it's unnecessarily complicated, but if you fiddle with it a few minutes you'll get the hang of it. The rooftop lounge/pool area was great, although more loungers were needed. The lobby looked worn, and has a computer for internet access, but no printer. My only complaint is the noise. My room was on the second floor on the Grand Via side, and street noise could be heard all night long, from the cars coming out of the tunnel passing under the plaza and on the side streets, and when those were quiet for a while people could still be heard sometimes on the street. It's supposed to be soundproofed and check-in said it nosie wasn't a problem, but I have to disagree. I'm a fairly light sleeper to begin with and barely slept all night even after a sleeping pill. They have some interior rooms that I suggest you ask for if you're not used to that level of street noise. The windows have this metal sheeting over anyway (look at photos of the exterior to understand), so you really won't be missing a view. Because of the noise I can't recommend the hotel, although if you're used to that, you'll probably like it. Price was about 75 Euros through Orbitz - reduced a few weeks before my stay during slow European vacation times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Roof pool invaluable. Good transport links.”
Reviews.Author: UkLobster
Reviews.Content: Busy location close to Magic Fountain and Montjuic. Good transport links to everywhere. Rooms clean, large, comfortable. Unusual bathroom arrangements - not much privacy but kind of fun. very nice discrete staff. Roof pool is small and a funny shape but essential in the summer. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “could do better”
Reviews.Author: vivoIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed there just last week, very bad location, toilets not practical you could hear everything clearly even with the two doors shut but my two biggest complaints were that there was not half enough sun loungers at the pool, could have done with about 12 more also we ran outof toiled roll everyday and had to resort to taking it from the downstairs toilet

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: priko
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is good, typically a 10-15 minute cab ride away from most of Barcelona's attractions. We did not use public transportation, but as far as I can tell I assume it is well connected The hotel had been built recently and gives a modern and clean impression. Reception staff was very friendly throughout our stay. The rooms have a decent size. The decoration is modern. Bathroom well done with separate toilet. Overall a pleasant stay. I would characterize the hotel as a modern, clean hotel with a very good standard of rooms, service and value for money. Some of the finishings/furniture may come across as a little bit cheap, but then I would always prefer such a modern and moderate hotel over those typical Grand Hotels that are overpriced, old-style and haven't seen a proper refurbishment in 30 years. I would stay again here, but next time I will stay at the W Hotel because I heard a lot of good things about it

Reviews.Title: “Bhotel:D-I-V-I-N-E”
Reviews.Author: anile
Reviews.Content: I just came back from holiday in barcelona with my husband. We stayed @ the B-hotel for 10 nights.Everything was great!!!!The rooms are spacious and very clean as well as all the areas in the hotel. The staff is very helpful AND they speak english.The hotel's location is very good if u wanna use metro, bus etc. But if u want to be in the very centre of the town, this is not it. However it is a half hour walk to the las ramblas. The rooms that are facing the big and bussy avenue (Gran Via) have some noise and someone may have trouble sleeping. This was not a problem for us though.The pillows are so soft and the hole atmosphere in the room is so great that u can fall asleep in no time, especially after a day in barcelona which has soooooo may things to see!!!!!!!I would definetely go back to Barcelona and B-hotel !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Way better than 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: Seaforth35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 2 hotels during our stay in Barcelona, B and Soho, and B was the best. Our room was very large with a cool bathroom but what really made this hotel stand out was the roof-top pool and bar. The roof top had a real buzz about it and we really liked heading up there some sun and a glass of Cava after a days sight seeing. The hotel is really close to the metro making it quick and easy to get about. We loved Barcelona and plan to visit again soon, when we do, we'll be booking B-Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...holiday fantastic”
Reviews.Author: KatieEDI
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with our choice of hotel for 5 nights in Barcelona. Very reasonably priced for a modern, good quality hotel. The roof top pool and terrace was perfect for relaxing after a day of touring the city. Good prices at the hotel bar - 3 euros for a San Miguel, 5 euros for half litre of sangria. We got the Aerobus from the airport (5 euros one way), the first stop is the Placa Espanya, then it's just a 100m walk round the roundabout to the hotel. Good location (just the right distance out of town), and the metro is at the end of the street. The 'Magic Fountain' and is also just across the road, definitely worth a visit one evening. Didn't have breakfast or evening meal in the hotel. Had some snacks at the poolside which where nice enough. Had breakfast at bens (directly on the opposite side of the street)...goregeous pastries and baguettes. We tended to head into town for our evening meals - the best place we found was La Crema Canela, in the Barri Gotic. The only downside is the construction work in the building next door. However it didn't disturb our sleep or affect our holiday (and it wouldn't stop me from going back there).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DCRovler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the B-Hotel and very much enjoyed it's location and amenities. Babacar checked us in late in the evening and sent us to a room on the executive floor that met our advance requests and exceeded our expectations. Daniella at the front desk was a font of information and a joy to deal with during the rest of our stay. This hotel features high-tech rooms with free wi-fi access, room safe and mini-bar refrigerator. We also didn't hear our neighbors. The bathroom features a glass wall adjacent to the bedroom but with shade adjustment buttons by the sink. Great location--1.5 blocks from the Espanya Metro stop; 2 blocks from bus to/from the airport; 2 blocks from a hop-on-hop-off tourist bus stop; €7-8 cab ride from La Rambla or Port Olympic--and great views of Plaça d'Espanya and Montjuic hill from the rooftop infinity pool and from the small room balcony. The only (minor) issues we had was with the "king" bed which was uncomfortable where the 2 twin mattresses met, and the cool-looking but odd-textured bed spread. I strongly suggest searching the site for current specials. For €89 we got the room, breakfast every morning (a €17 per person value) and a welcome non-alcoholic (and underwhelming) drink. Our stay was a very good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel. Rooftop pool won me over.”
Reviews.Author: Eboltz
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 nights at the B-Hotel. Location was perfect. Very close to the metro and easy to get to all the main tourist sites. The breakfast buffet had a nice selection of food and allowed us to fill up for the day. The rooftop pool was fantastic to relax by at the end of a long day. Great cocktails at the bar! I thought it could have been cleaner. There was no coffee machine or kettle in the room. The fluorescent lighting in the room was awful. Very hard to apply makeup in that lighting. It was slightly noisy with the nearby construction and the metro running close by. We booked a king size bed which ended up being two beds pushed together. It made for a very uncomfortable sleep. Overall, a basic hotel which is of good value. Great for young people. I would probably stay there again just to sit by the rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “Raising the Benchmark”
Reviews.Author: Pro89
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The modern minimalist design of the hotel, gave it a really snazzy look. Located by Espanya Metro Station, the hotel was perfectly placed for exploration around Barcelona. The staff on reception were all incredibly well mannered and helpful, always smiling and willing to go the extra mile. Check in was a breeze, which was great considering our flight was delayed, and the rooms were great. Bed and pillows are extremely comfortable and the room sizes are large and comfortable. You even get a modern settee in each room! The bathroom is really modern, have sliding doors and a see through shower. The only complaints are the loud sliding bathroom doors that don’t fully close and the tiny LCD television that was very temperamental. The hotel pool was absolutely wicked. My mates and I still used it despite it being freezing, much to the amusement of the maid. I will definitely go back to this hotel when revisit Barcelona, arguably the best city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay...”
Reviews.Author: Smooth23
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a very nice experience in BCN. The value for the rate we got was unbelievable. The rate was about 80€ for a double room. The bathroom was clean, the bed was spacious and comfortable. The view from the roof top pool was amazing. Great cocktails were available as well. The connectivity via Metro from Placa Espanya is also perfect. Nice Hotel stuff is also appreciable.

Reviews.Title: “Cool design hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olzon
Reviews.Content: The room was not very big, but the design was very nice. We loved the roof terrace with pool. The breakfast was good and the staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for a Barcelona vacation”
Reviews.Author: MississaugaWanderers
Reviews.Content: We decided to tack on a few days in Barcelona following a cruise, and chose to stay at B-Hotel We arrived at 9:00 Am, and since the room wasn't ready, the friendly staff checked our bags, and did all the paperwork for check-in to save time later in the day. They then got out a map and helped plan our day. They were very helpful and friendly throughout our stay, and all spoke English quite well. The hotel is well located, close to transit and all the attractions of Montjuic. Getting anywhere is easy on the very efficient (and cheap) transit system. Breakfast is very good, and, the rooftop bar and pool are a great place to relax in the afternoon after a busy day of sightseeing. The rooms are fairly large, clean, and modern. The lighting controls are a little complicated, but that's the only issue we had in this very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Going back to Barcelona this would B the place”
Reviews.Author: Sylvie-chouchoune
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be there for 7 nigths, unfortunately for us they only have 5 nigths, we LOVED this hotel, an amazing staffs, who provided us with card of the city, explain to us everything we needed to know, the lady ( front desk) book for us a Flamenco show that we really liked, always as we were leaving or coming back were greeting us, we always feel that we were welcome back.....We love the space in the room with the view of the Plaza Espagne in was good because we could open the door , we did not feel trap.....the bathroom is amazing, but surprise when I see the privacy, because on some reviews peoples were complaining about that, and you have the windows that close and 2 doors, how much privacy does people wants. It is across the street of the Metro, and very good system in Spain, a police station in front, lots of restaurant near and always 3 to 4 stop of metro to everythings you have to see in Barcelona.The pool view is amazing, and every morning we have seen a man cleaning the pool, so a great roof to be to relax before or after a day.....My husband and I have buy on La Rambla 2 paintings that we loved as a souvenir of our trip, we had plan a wall in the house that we put pictures an souvenirs on it. My husband forgot the pictures....What an amazing, again services did we received from all of the peoples at the B- Hotel, sending e-mail, because in Canada the were charging us 190.00$ to pick up the pictures an bring in back to us, again with the help of the staffs the bubble our pictures put it in a box an mail it to us for 14.00$. We were so happy, cause those pictures really had a sentimental value for us, Thank you the B-Hotel peoples for their kindnest and support for sending those pictures to us. We would and will recommend this hotel to our friends for the great hotel, pool obviously, and the great service the provide in and after the trip. Thank you, Sylvie and Joe.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueLagoon99
Reviews.Content: Duration: 3 nights Love this hotel, it's about a good 25-30 minutes almost level walk into plaza catalunya or 5 minutes level walk to the metro Espanya then about 3 or 4 stops into La Rambla. The weather was nice so we did a bit of walking as well as catching the Metro. We arrived around 11pm from the airport and it was hardly welcoming when we stepped out of the taxi, the area was dark and the entrance to the hotel was sort of hidden but once we stepped inside, it was a very nice first impression. Snazzy and modern ableit a bit small and compact.. nice. Next day, pleasant surprise, the area looked clean, safe and sound to walk into town. There were some works going in the building next door but we havent heard much noise going on. Free Internet on the lounge and business/dining area. We didnt have breakfast as we opted for inexpensive basic breakfasts (coffee or orange juice plus croissants) in the surrounding area. There was a modern funky rooftop swimming pool which we did not have the time to use. Reception service was good and helpful especially when our luggage was a day late. While our room was modern and clean, the computerised buttons for lights, dimmers, blinds did take a bit of trail and error to work out (there was a brochure on how to use them but who on holidays is going to sit down and read thru!) so by the time we learnt to use them all, we were on our last day! We caught the airport bus from the bus stop about a few minutes walk from the hotel on the roundabout just adjacent to the hotel, very convenient. Also we used the HOHO bus from the same roundabout. We caught the train to Monserrat from the Metro at Espanya. i would definitely go back to this hotel again, provided they keep the competitive room rate we had.

Reviews.Title: “B-Hotel, Barcelona Baby!”
Reviews.Author: darrencotta
Reviews.Content: My partner and me booked this hotel online in Feb 2010 after looking at many over the course of a few days as it came across as quite modern and pretty reasonable. It's quite confusing at first as there doesn't appear to be a door to enter until the big wooden lump of wood slides open and in you go. Checking in was quite painless, they take your passport and ask for a copy of your Visa/Master Card in case you run a bill up during your stay which is all pretty standard stuff. The people on the front desk are very helpful and polite, they will recommend things to you if you require. Like most cities we found quite early on its always best to go where the locals go, avoid the tourist traps and that will save you quite a few euros...we found some great resturants and bars in back streets which were amazing quality along with the price. If you decide have a beer in the more popular parts of Barcelona you can expect to pay £10 for two pints of lager...find a locals bar and you can get bottled beer for under £2 a bottle. Right back to the Hotel review, the rooftop has a bar and swimming pool along with a great view of Playa del Espanya...the pool is great for a dip in the summer but forget swimming in it. The lighting in the room takes a lot of getting used to but is quite fun to mess around with. The shower has a window blind which you can control for privacy, towels can be changed as much as you want. The room also contains a minibar which we found very expensive. There is a shop across the road that sells beers/wine etc for a decent price and you can bring that back to the room if required. There is WI-FI in the room which my laptop picked up quite easily which was very handy for checking out resturants/bars and things to do in Barca before you set off. The hotel is situated 3 mins walk to the nearest Metro (Espanya) therefore making everything very accessable, also you can pick up the Aero Bus close by which will take you directly to the Airport. We both loved this hotel and city so much we are planning another trip in August of this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: laradorren
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with nice design. We've spent there 3 nights and I would definitely come back there during my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: AndreBessa
Reviews.Content: Perfect Stay, nice location next to the subway station and several bus stations. very nice breakfast and the roof was perfect to relax. nice value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain in BCN !”
Reviews.Author: Honkefar
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with good location just across the street from a subway station where you can take the train and be in the very center in only a few minutes ! Great servicem people at the front desk knows where to go, just ask ! We even got a free upgrade to a superior room even if we only had a prepaid price which was a very good deal. Found it on the hotels homepage. Did not have breakfast, which was ok, as you can buy it cheaper in numerous cafe as you hit the streets of BCN. If you are a light sleeper you might request a romm on the sides of the building, as you can hear som e of the massive traffic outside at night ! The roof terrace with swimming pool is great for relaxing after trawling the streets of this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CEBManchester
Reviews.Content: The B Hotel is a great choice of hotel in Barcelona. Approx 15 minutes by the Aerobus from the Airport, at 8 Euro per person for a return trip don't waste money on a taxi as the bus stops less than a minute away from the hotel. We arrived about 2 hours before check-in & a room was available for us. The rooms are very modern, spacious, clean & have everything you need including a lovely powerful, hot shower & small balcony. The rooftop pool really made the trip for us, it was lovely to relax in the pool & then on the terrace after a day sightseeing. There is a stop for the tourist buses about 1 minute away & La Rambla is about a 15 min walk away. The magic fountains are also a 2 minute walk away. All in all we couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough, we would definitely stay there if we visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in BCN”
Reviews.Author: SwimBikeRunGirl
Reviews.Content: Great location near the train system and nice spacious rooms. The staff are super friendly and helpful, and most of all respectful. My only trouble was that we asked for a king bed but the hotel gave us two twin beds joined together - not exactly super comfortable. The controls for the room are a bit tricky to figure out but it's part of the fun I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: bzboyandy
Reviews.Content: We very much liked the the shear modern and cleanliness of this hotel. The location at first seemed to be out of the way, however we very quickly learned that we were just a block away from the metro tunnels. Also we were two blocks away from the double decked tour bus, which took us all over the city. I will be sure to write another review about this bus, I promise. Back to the room. This is an green hotel. So it is encouraged to use your towels for a couple days, if your green like us. This saves water. Also, as you walk down the halls, the lights basically follow you, and become dim as you pass. In the room, you can not leave your lights on because it takes your key card to actually turn them on. As you leave with your key card, things go dim. One night we ordered room service. This is a first for me, but the bill was actually the price of the food. There was no 'delivery fee' or gratuity added. So it is upon you to tip the server. Which of course we did, but it was just a shock to me not to see a hidden charge. Typical European hotels have two double beds. Our first night, we had this. As far as I am concerned, this is a no no when vacationing with you honey. So, we asked for a different room. To my wondering eyes, the beds actually zipped together. A key to sleeping though, the decorative bed spread is not comfortable at all. So find the extra blankets in the closet, they are nice and soft. Do not miss the rooftop pool / deck. There is an edgeless pool that over looks the central fountain of the nearby intersection. It just takes moments to be relaxed from the exploration of the day. There are plenty of tables and chairs so you can bring up a coffee and paper in the morning or bottle of wine for the evening. As mentioned the location is great. There are many sights if you turn right out of the front door, and if you turn left many shops, bakeries and restaurants. Which I will be writing about. DO ask your hotel desk team where to eat, they did not let us down.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and quality”
Reviews.Author: 123travels
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights. Very convenient location in Placa d'Espanya - metro station is just around the corner and so is the train station. Lots of buses stop at this Placa and Airport buses pass by every 5-10 minutes. The airport to/from this hotel is about a 25 minute bus ride on the Airport bus. A walk to the old town / Las Ramblas is about 15-20 minutes...therefore location is great. Hotel itself is much better than some of the 4 star hotels I stayed at in Europe - modern design, big rooms for European standards, LCD's, hairdryers, closet space, and very clean. A couple of negatives is the shower...for some reason they only cover the tub/shower with half a plane of glass. When you take a shower at full blast, some water may spray onto the floor...not a major problem to deter you from staying at this hotel. Doors closing are pretty loud but if guests slowly close the doors, it's not much of a problem. Breakfast is very good - hot food, cold cuts, bread, yogurt, fresh juices, fruits and pastries. Good selection of food (as long as you're not picky) and great value if breakfast is included in the rate. Reception staff very friendly and helpful...they all speak decent English. Also have a roof-top pool and good view of Placa d'Espanya. Could easily walk to their National Museum (probably 10 minutes) and another 10 minutes will get you to the Olympic Park/Barcelona Stadium. I would stay here again for sure. Note: they were constructing/renovating Barcelona Arena just next door so some construction going on; however, they usually don't start until 8 or 9am so it was fine. Probably take another year or so to complete.

Reviews.Title: “Very funky hotel - perfect location for a relaxing city break”
Reviews.Author: WhaleBay
Reviews.Content: There's very little to fault in this hotel - the hotel is cool, the rooms are very modern and the service is great. Most of all, there is a great selection for breakfast which is served to a very reasonable 11am which is great for a leisurely weekend. And then there is the rooftop pool which overlooks the Pla Espanya which is great in the evening sun. The hotel is on the route of the Aerobus from Barcelona Airport with the stop across the Pla Espanya. There is a metro station on your doorstep which means you have easy access to anywhere in Barcelona at very little cost. And we walked from the hotel to the port/La Ramblas and to Pla Catalunya which is not a million miles. So there is no need to stay in La Ramblas...seriously!! All in all, this hotel was excellent and by booking ahead you can get a great rate. One little thing was the ambulance sirens at night but I'd expect that anywhere in Barcelona but not a big distraction.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: filipefreitas
Reviews.Content: I fill the "metro", the bar/restaurant as no food enougth for people in the hotel. I ask to change to another hotel of the chain and they tell me that is not possible because i paid in advance. So, i´l never pay in advance for any hotel in spain. They wait 4 days to tell something, wayting for the last day, on check out... The hotel is far way from ramblas and other interesting places. I do not recomend it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: camshty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at B Hotel for two nights. The hotel was modern, clean, and very good value for money. Good location for Barcelona centre. The breakfast selection was the best for any hotel I have ever stayed in, and I travel continuously for work. We will definitely stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: stan8389
Reviews.Content: arrived early and checked in straight away even though we new we may have to wait until 3pm as per e mail confirmation we received. Room was excellent over looked plaza espanya, was really modern and contemporary far exceeded our expectations for what he had paid for the room. the lights in the room took a while to fathom out but got there eventually. compared to what we paid for the hotel cant believe how expensive barcelona is, even for 2 pizzas 2 beers and 2 coffees it was 40 euro. Stick to menu del dias set price and you get great value for money. cant recommend la barca del salamanca enough in the port olimpico.....the place was a hive of activity the food was excellent and service just as good, the atmosphere was fantastic. blue and red bus tour was great too, good to do on first day then you get an idea of the size of the city and things you want to go back and see in more detail. Sagrada Familia a must......the place is something else all in all cant recommend barcelona and the B - Hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “JUST AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: giorgia21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great! I couldn't find anything that I don't like in this hotel. Very clean, very stylish and just 2 minutes walk from Plaza de Espana and the shuttle bus to the airport just round the corner. Staff is very helpful and friendly I would recommend this hotel to everybody. Don't miss that cool swimming pool on the roof just incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: V12TwinTurbo
Reviews.Content: This was a final part of our tremendous honeymoon! It was the best trip of my entire life! We had been stayed B Hotel for 1 day. Very modern, clean and comfortable rooms with nice bad. Stuff is very friendly and helpful. Hotel very good placed. Metro station is very close to hotel. This hotel has a swimming pool at the roof and you can swim and look at Placa d’Espanya. It is fun! Separate word deserves breakfast. Oh, it's fantastic! Many different meal to choose (including hot and roasted), freshly squeezed juices. And all of it very tasty! I would like to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelingbiz
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this hotel. The airport bus stops just in front of the hotel, free wifi, staff is friendly but the best feature was the roof top pool! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Crosbie
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in Barcelona and stayed in B Hotel. It's right beside Placa Espanya which is the first stop for the Aerobus and connects directly with Placa Catalunya directly via Metro. I originally booked a standard room but was upgraded to Superior by Jan at the front desk. The room had a modern style with lots of light which was made even better by the full moon that weekend.

Reviews.Title: “My Award for Great Service and Extra Mile even in difficult period and circumstances”
Reviews.Author: glokal
Reviews.Content: During the Mobile World Congress MWC we had an Alumni Gathering-Meeting from all around the world from prestigious French, USA, Italian, UK, etc Alumni Associations and Clubs. Despite that this meeting was an informal spontaneous meeting of Alumni attending the MWC and that we kindly ask the Hotel only just 2 days (!) before the MWC for a venue to meet there, the whole Conference-Events team lead by Cecilia delivered highest service and dedication to make everything special and customised to our needs (they exceded). We had a great evening; our Alumni were so delighted that among the business cards they collected from professional Alumni attending MWC they also kindly asked for the B-Hotel Conference-Events Team business card to consider organising their next company events and meetings at the B-Hotel. Definitely I will personally count on them for any coming event in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
