Reviews.Author: Talula
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Thomas cook got an excellent price. We chose the hotel because it is close to where my husbands son lives. We found the reception staff all very good & welcoming. We requested an early morning taxi & wake up call, and that was carried out with no problem. The room was very comfortable,clean,and warm & I soon came to grips with the light controls etc ( clue ......the bathroom blind switch is in the bathroom near the sink!). View from window/balcony very nice (room 701). Never bothered with t.v as we were on a break!. We went to the bar area a couple of times, it is hard to get a member of bar staff at times, but we just asked at reception and someone appeared straight away.. no problem. We enjoyed a few bottles of wine there with free nuts & crisps. We never tried the breakfast, only food we had was a baguette at the bar which was nice & fresh. The pool area was lovely not a big pool but good enough for cooling down, no one about as the time of year, but I can imagine it being popular when really hot. The hotel is situated close enough to walk for the airport bus (if you land at BCN airport), unfortunatley we arrived at Girona hence the taxi. If you are on an early morning flight and getting the taxi beware as our taxi got stuck in the rush hour traffic so cost us double going back to staion. Because we were visiting family, the hotel was in a perfect place for us we never used public transport to get around, when we went anywhere we just walked as thats what we like to do anyway. We would not hesitate going back to stay, as it suited all our requirements. Would like a kettle in room as my husband likes his tea, but there is room service so no big problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pepole that make your staying even more comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pspodnik
Reviews.Content: I was there with a group of professionals to spend a week in BCN. A bit off side location didn't collidate in everyday business. It is very well communicated area. Thou the façade rooms tend no to be very quiet to very sensible dreamers. I agree with most of the reviews here, it requires some renewal but, it's the ambience that makes it fell comfortable.And above all the staff! These people can make your staying most comfortable and joyful, just ask them for what you need...:)

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, ok location, great service... definitely a go...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMx
Reviews.Content: Me and a buch of friends decided to go to Bcn for NYE... we were a party of four and a friend of mine decided to stay at B-hotel... I usually stay in other hotels more centrally located, I mean, closer to Passeig de Gracia or Eixample, but we got a really good deal paying about 100 eur a night on holidays, which is absolutely cheap for Barcelona... Location: First of all, location was not that bad at the end... it is right on Plaza Espanya, which is very efficiently connected with metro and buses... also, the aerobus (5 Eur, single ride) from the aerport drops you 2 minutes away from the hotel door... so it is great location if you are planning on watching the city and using the metro... if decide to walk, P. Gracia is about 25 minute walk on Gran via, which is a nice area to walk.. the area is safe and the hotel is sound-proof, so no major deal about the noise.. Service: The service was excellent and warm at all times.. they have a lot of people from different countries working there and all of them were friendly and accomodating... Room: The room was definitely stylish and modern... the size was big enough... we had a double with 2 twin beds together... the bathroom is nice and the beds were really comfortable... we also loved the pillows... beware that the bathroom has sliding doors, so no isolating is possible and it could be an issue for some people regarding toilet privacy... Problems: At the time of our stay, they had serious issues with the air/con... our room was extremely hot during the day, so we had to have the window open... they fixed it the last day... overall, my experience was really good and I would really recommend it to all the travellers, specially considering the hotel prices in Bcn...

Reviews.Title: “Helpful,friendly and courteous staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: rorysull
Reviews.Content: Central location with stylish features! The only negative aspect of my week ends stay was that the temp through out the hotel was so high!!

Reviews.Title: “tasteful modern comfort combined with traditional Spanish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ClaireFairhaven
Reviews.Content: A very new, very modern hotel with minimalist, very tasteful decor in the rooms and the common areas. The young and energetic staff is very helful in a warm and unstuffy way and speaks perfect english. They gave us excellent tips for restaurants and shopping areas, helped with bookings and got a few things we brought to their attention fixed in no time. The hotel has a bar with an amazing collection of Spanish wines and some good tapas. Breakfast is a buffet with a good assortment of (mostly Spanish) goodies, including a good variety of fresh juices and fresh fruit. There is free access to WiFi throughout the hotel. Ideal for a business trip, but would be pleasant for a private trip too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: DVassallo
Reviews.Content: Very nice and modern rooms, if somewhat small. The hotel is located near the magic fountains, and it is a short walk to Las Ramblas. There is a metro stop just round the corner, at Placa d'Espanya.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable and clean hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: babykong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the B-Hotel last week for four nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It was our first time in Barcelona and when booking the hotel I didn't really have any idea where we were staying (in terms of proximity to tourist attractions) and was swayed more by the price of the hotel and some of the other reviews on here. But I feel we struck gold! B-Hotel is in an excellent location. Some people claim it's too far from the hub of Barcelona, but that's nonsense - it's four stops on the metro from Placa d'Espanya (the metro / train station is just across the road from the hotel) to Placa de Catalunya. The hotel is also situated within walking distance of Montjuic. The reception area of the hotel is open and informal, with the bar to the right. Check-in was quick and easy, as was checking-out. Breakfast was offered to us at €10 each per day. I thought this was excessive and opted to eat out which was a lot cheaper. The room itself looks amazing - very stylish - but also comfortable. Both the bathroom and bedroom were spacious and clean. The room contained a safe and mini-bar. And yes the light switches did take a bit of getting used to, but we soon worked it out! The doors to the bathroom and toilet do not totally shut. There is a gap of around an inch and no locks on the doors. Not a problem for us, but some people may not like it. The bathroom contains (a very deep and slim) bath with a powerful shower. The shower was fantastic, but there is no shower curtain, just a wall of glass which wasn't sufficient enough to stop water from ending up on the bathroom floor. But this is a minor gripe which was easily dealt with a wipe of a towel. I should also point out that although the bathroom was very well lit, the toilet lighting was very poor. Why?! B-Hotel is a fabulous base that fits in perfectly with the ambience of Barcelona. I would stay here again, but if I could change one thing I would ask for an English speaking movie channel. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: vacation9778
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the B Hotel for 7 nights in Oct 09. Overall, the hotel served it's purpose. It was clean and we found the location to be great! If you don't like walking or taking the metro, then this might not be the hotel for you... Check in was easy. We arrived around 2pm and were able to check into our room immediately. The rooms look really nice, but when you look close up, the quality isn't the best. The light buttons take some getting used to and the bathroom lighting is horrible. The free in room wi-fi worked perfectly. We did not do the hotel breakfast for 10 euro a day per person. There are many cafes around where you can get (great) coffee and a sandwich for 5 euro total for TWO people. Take the Aerobus from the airport - it's 5 euro each and took us less than 15 minutes (on a Saturday around 1:30pm) to get to the hotel. Placa de Espanya is the first stop and it's a very short walk to the hotel. We also took the Aerobus to the airport when we left and again, it was very quick and easy! The roof top pool is a great extra and looks out over Placa de Espanya. We hung out there at night and it was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “We are very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: MaryWadl
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a selected group in the B-hotel. Service, rooms, breakfast other facilities were very good. It is a real designhotel. Inside it is very modern and clean. Rooms are very nice. Breakfast was very good. We also used a Tapaslunch on the last day. For some of the participants was this the best food they had in Barcelona. Take the breakfast room for the lunch, if all group members want to sit. They enjoyed it. All the food comes from the own kitchen. On the 8th floor participants enjoyed the nice swimmingpool with lounge chairs. Location: circa 30 minutes walk from Plaza Catalunya. Taxi during the day circa 6,- to center. Metrostation only 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Montjuich and museum MNAC in Palau Nacional is about 20 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Location doesn't get enough praise!”
Reviews.Author: dub-dub1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the B in late August, 2009. We thought we were staying a little away from the "touristy" things on purpose, but worried that maybe we were too far away... the location was perfect! The Playa de Espanya train station, which is right across the street links to a number of major lines, letting you get all over the city quickly! Better yet, the train station is where the train out of the city to Monserratt started... easy to be on an early train when you just have to walk down the block! Plus, it the location put is in a neighborhood that we may otherwise not make it to, intentionally, otherwise. The fountain show at the museum was awesome, and no way we would have come over for it... but so glad we did... nice to be with normal, middle-class Spaniards... doing what they do on a weekend night. A lot has been said of the pool, and it is all worth it... we spent every night from 6-9 at the pool with some Sangria... so nice. Able to get chairs every time. Skip the restaurant recommendation that the front desk may give you... it was terrible, instead stop in to the little corner restaurant that is out the front door and to your left. We at there a number of times, and their Italian was oddly good.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ginger027
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights for business trip. The hotel has a strange musty smell when you enter, the carpet on the 4th floor at the elevator is totally stained, the front desk is not helpful (25 years olds who think they are hip). The shower must be leaking into the room as the bedroom wall was water stained and moldy. (When I tried to explain this to the front desk they could not understand what I was saying) In addition, as a business hotel it does not work, as the rooms are very dark, the wireless internet works intermittently, and is unable to handle large documents. This is the first time I felt the need to write a review ever, thank goodness I did not have to pay for the room. If you are 15 to 25 years old, you would find this place interesting and ignore the dirt.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel....the roof terrace makes it perfect”
Reviews.Author: mrsjofus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for 4 days and had a fantastic time. The hotel is funky and modern and the staff all very friendly and helpful. We didn't have any problems with the lighting system, so not sure why all the fuss about that. The bathroom was great and we found the bed very comfortable - my only downer on the rooms is that they're a little bit too dark for my taste but that's just a minor gripe. There's a supermarket just down the road which is very cheap so my advice to all is to get yourselves a few bottles of cheap cava (the rooms have fridges) and when you come back from a hard day's sightseeing, take your cava up onto the roof terrace and have a relaxing few hours whilst the sun goes down! Beware though, whilst the inifinity pool on the terrace is brilliant, it's also the coldest pool I've ever experienced! We ate tapas at the hotel a few evenings and it was delicious - they had a set tapas menu with a drink for 15 euros which we thought was very good value - there was plenty of it to feed two people. The Espanya metro station is a stones throw away so everywhere is within easy reach. You can also stroll up to the National Art Museum, which has beautiful views across the city -also another ideal stop to sit with a glass of cava and watch the world go by. This is where the magic fountains are in the evening too - a must see! You can also walk to the Olympic village and Poble Espanyol from here too. All in all, we thought this hotel was excellent and although not in the centre of town, it's location is perfect because you're close enough to reach everything with ease but also far enough away for it not to be too hectic - we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful bed”
Reviews.Author: funtraveler77
Reviews.Content: We had to move out from B Hotel in the middle of our vacation. The bed was so uncomfortable. Normally we don't have any back problems with, but every morning we woke up with terrible back pains. We had 2 beds pushed together instead of a queen or king and each mattress had a big dent right in the middle. The room was dark, cheaply furnished with scratched laminate floors and generally unappealing. We moved to Rey Juan Carlos and for extra 20 Euros got a five star accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel and the best location!”
Reviews.Author: 1elou
Reviews.Content: I can say that the B hotel is exactly what a traveler need for staying in Barcelona if he/she is there for tourism. It is modern, very clean, comfortable, with king size beds, really enjoying bathroom, nice room service, friendly staff, nice view especially when you swim in the pool! The location is perfect, not overcrowded as in the city center, but not too far away of that. Also the metro stop is next to the hotel so you can be anywhere in town so easy! I definitely would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: curlieq223
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the B Hotels. The rooms were very modern and clean, the front desk staff was very helpful to get our group to tours and nightclubs. We really enjoyed the breakfast as well and they had free internet accesss at the computers in that room. However, we did have drinks one night before dinner and the server was no where to be found. Overall it was well worth the money we paid. The best place we stayed on the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel, very funky.”
Reviews.Author: dafbird
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The room was very comfortable (not stuffy like must hotel rooms) & the staff very friendly. The only downfall was the pool closed on our 2nd day there. We were only there for 3 nights. We weren't informed on check in so we only got to dip our toes in on the first evening. We thought it would re open on the 3rd day but when it didn't we complained at reception as it was the main reason we booked this hotel. The receptionist was very good & told us they'd a sister hotel down the street and we could use their pool. She rang ahead & informed them we'd be coming so there was no problem. It had a nice pool but not as nice as the B Hotel. Still at least we had an alternative ( the same thing happened to us in an expensive hotel in Berlin & when we complained the receptionist just shrugged her shoulders at us, it was nice to see the B Hotel had an alternative). It's right next to the Espanya station & a few stops from La Rambla. Very handy. There's a lovely Mexican restaurant down the street when you turn left out of the hotel. There's an Opencor (supermarket) not far from it either. Very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, HORRIBLE Bar, useless front desk”
Reviews.Author: szqueue
Reviews.Content: The hotel is steps away from Pl. Espagne Metro but a good mile by foot from las Ramblas etc. One the other hand, just a hop form Mont Juic for a quick workout. Rooms are spacious and nice as noted; HOWEVER: Arriving on a rainy night we decided to try waiting for dinner hour at the bar and ordered potatoes w/aioli, "Russian Salad (potatoes w/ unidentifiable things and mayo), and mussels. Server presented us with about 30g of canned baby clams and argued that they were indeed mussels, etc and then finally admitted the kitchen was out of mussels. I guess we were presumed to not now the difference?? We braed the rain and had dinner out... upon returning at 11:45 we found about 10 people at the bar and different server, whom we asked for a bottle of wine to take to our room. Got a very curt "we're closed" (a manager later said there's a sign stating they will accommodate until midnight, so we went to the front desk, who appealed to her but was also not successful. Next morning we reported all this to the front desk who blandly did nothing. That evening we asked for a manager who apologized graciously (which we appreciated) and sent up a bottle of $3 cava (which we did not). While this is not an especially expensive hotel, at $225 per night a little service would seem appropriate. We had found a fabulous bottle at a local shop for around $45 and enjoyed it and the night view from the rooftop deck.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Niate
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in B-hotel and feel that it represented value for money. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on that service, however rooms were lovely, staff very friendly and the rooftop terrace and pool were great. Would definitely stay again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jsfountain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights during a business trip. The hotel is very beautiful and the rooms are amazing. Clean, quiet, modern, lots of room. I will stay here any time i return to Barcelona. Great location and there are plenty of restaurants around the hotel. It is located on a main boulevard which is great for just being among the "crowd", yet it was never too noisy. The best feature of this hotel is the pool located on the roof. My group would locate straight to the roof after work to enjoy the amazing views and swim in the pool and relax. The hotel is worth it alone just for that. Breakfast was very nice with a large buffet. The bar staff was also helpful and nice. Good tapas! You will not regret staying here!

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravelin
Reviews.Content: Great location, get the bus from the airport 4.25euro and its the first stop. Getting around Barca from the hotel is easy as its right next to the metro stop and the tourist ho on bus stops at the Placa too. Check in was efficient, the room was nice-modern with cool lighting-if you can get it to work properly. Complimentary toiletries but nothing else. We were under the impression b'fast was included but as we had received discounted rate due to staying 3 nights it wasn't. Upon check in other people were offered a b'fast deal of 10euros per night-we weren't and were thus charged 13euro each. Luckily we only had it one day. On that day the food was mediocre and not worth the money. There are plenty of little cafes close by where you can get coffee and a croissant for 2 euro. The ceiling was leaking whilst we had breakfast although it wasn't raining so it must be coming form the showers. Roof top pool was fab, we sunbathed up there for a few hours and had couple glasses chilled vino whilst listening to relaxing sounds-think hed kandi beach. Would i stay again? poss not as i don't feel it represented value for money. Although the other hotels in the group looked nice and staff were good so would prob try one of the others. Dont bother eating it Restaurante Elche which is recommended by Lonely planet in the area-worst paella ive eaten-and ive eaten a few throughout Spain and cook my own. Also don't eat at Les Quinze Nits of La Rambla-food and service was terrible. Head doen to the port-the seafood at Noroeste was superb-you could still taste the sea it was that fresh!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Friendly staff, clean designer rooms, pool with best view in town!”
Reviews.Author: LCW01
Reviews.Content: My absolute favourite in Barcelona. Young, very friendly and acommodating staff. Clean, modern designer rooms. Enjoy a morning swim in the infinity pool overlooking Plaça d'Espanya. Free wireless in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff and lovely pool!”
Reviews.Author: Kat Cruz
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my 10 year old daughter for 3 days and loved it. You can get a the aerobus from outside Barcelona airport straight to Espanya (metro station 2mins away from hotel) for 4.25€ single journey and it takes about 15 mins. When we arrived we couldn't find the front door as there was no handle or sign. It's actually a wooden door that slides open when you walk up to it. Also couldn't find our room as numbers are on the bottom of the walls!! However once we the worked out the light controls the room was beautiful and clean. The rooftop pool has stunning views. If you want to order food or drinks up there you have to use the phone by the lifts to ring down and they'll bring it up for a charge. Staff were extremely helpful. I asked them to recommend a nice restaurant nearby. They recommended 'El Rebost de Maria' a typical Catalan restaurant and booked it for us. It was delightful, like having dinner at a family house. Check out was at midday but our flight wasn't till late evening. They allowed us to leave our luggage which was locked in a room which meant we could see some more of Barcelona. When we collected our bags we still had some time to kill so we invited to stay by the pool and were even given towels if we wanted to swim. Don't bother with taxis, we bought a 3 day travel card that you can use on metro, buses and trams. There is a supermarket at the end of the block. Espanya station is on 3 lines so is really easy to get to places. Go see the Magic Fountains just round the corner from the hotel in the evening... it is just stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,great rooms roof top pool a bonus.”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirelass19
Reviews.Content: An excellent place to stay as close to metro, get a barcelona card and the rest is easy. Hotel rooms were large, clean and well equipped. Had a room at the front with good views over the Placa Espanya ,yes there was some traffic noise but not enough to disturb you,after all you are in a busy city. The staff were helpful and left bags at reception for the day before an evening flight with no problems and no charge. Overall an excellent place to stay and the pool area was lovely after a long day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “soooo satisfying”
Reviews.Author: bartHolland
Reviews.Content: i keep it bit short: the b-hotel is perfect your not in the most bussiest part of barcelona but within max 15 minutes your everywere..the pool is the best of barcelona looking bit about montjuich. at the edge of the buildingroof.....whats the point of a expensive hotel without the possibillity for relaxing when one is tired...staff was verry good....my special thanks goes to a lady that works there wo was from argentinian orrigan...thanks for your good care you were so positive to me/us...b-hotel is also not to big not to small just perfect to give familar atmosfer thanks

Reviews.Title: “Less is More”
Reviews.Author: socalbeachbum97
Reviews.Content: We're more of the resort type when traveling, but "B" is one grand boutique hotel! Sleek design, attentive personal service and decktop pool combined, makes this stay a happy one. You really can't go wrong here and definitely get your bang for the buck, at B. The previous reviews describe the B very well. It's unfortunate one of them had such a poor experience and not the perfect trip.

Reviews.Title: “NICE MODERN”
Reviews.Author: KseniaS
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel! Forgot my Nokia phone on a bed on a departure day... They returned it to me after 1 week when I came back from Mallorca Very polite reception! good location, not in the very heart of the city but in a calm safe district...nice swimming pooll...

Reviews.Title: “Really satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: maevec
Reviews.Content: Just read the review previous to this one and i couldnt disagree more! I reckon we probably stayed around the same time as you as we're only back a week. I thought Hotel B was fantastic! Our room was very large, and the bathroom was imaculate. I love the whole marble thing as it makes me think everything is so clean. We had no problem with the cleaning of the room. As for the previous guy saying he was "spoken to in broken english"...YOU WERE IN SPAIN! How about you speak in spanish! How arrogant! We also left our bags in the lock up and they were fine. You were just unfortunate. It happens in every hotel in every country. I would not say it was the norm at all. Honestly, this hotel was really nice. We got it for €98 a night and it was well worth it. The pool on the top floor was really nice and you wont see many pools in hotels in Barcelona at that price. There were about 12 sun loungers with 4 couches with 8 armchairs in a shaded area. You probably would struggle to get a lounger instantly, but people only stayed there for a while from what i could see. Most people dont come to Barcelona to sit on a sun lounger! I've never put up a review before, but i was so incensed with the previous review that i thought i would give you guys a better and well rounded review. No idea why the previous guy is so bitter! Or if he's used to 5 stars. Here in Ireland, i would say the hotel would get 4 stars. We had a great stay there and would definitely go back. If i had to think of one bad thing, it might be that i'm a light sleeper and the traffic woke me in the morning. But i do stress i'm a light sleeper. I wake at the sound of a pin dropping :)

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: AT YOUR OWN RISK”
Reviews.Author: MSTRVL3000
Reviews.Content: Having read the positive reviews, my friend and I decided on the B Hotel for our 4 day stay in Barcelona. It RUINED the trip. (1) Room was flithy. Hair in the bath and in the bed; dust EVERYWHERE (there are no drawers for your things in the room); Sticky cup marks on shelves; dirty glasses in the minibar. (2) Telephone didn't work, and despite asking for it to be fixed every morning, it wasn't. (3) No sincere apology for any of the above (4) No manager on the premises to deal with anything (5) Rude staff - who in broken English - made very little effort to make things right (6) Shower at the pool did not work (7) Pool deck, although lovely, was very small with hardly any seating. Ended up lying on the floor on a towel (8) If you want late check-out, it will cost you an extra 40 Euros. No thanks (9) Having decided against late check-out (as our flight wasn't until 10pm), we left our bags locked up "safely" with the hotel. Bags were tagged and we were assured that they were safe. BAG (with passports etc) WAS STOLEN from the locked, "secure" back room at the hotel. WARNING: This hotel had the absolute worst service I have ever encountered.... Spend a bit more, stay somewhere else. This wasn't worth it. Only nice thing was a cafe across the street (called "Ben") where breakfast was reasonable and tasty and the owner in English and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Accomodation & Location”
Reviews.Author: McKennaB
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Ideal location, superb rooms and great roof top pool with beautiful views of the city. Most importantly: wonderful staff, particularly on reception (special mention for Cecilia who was very helpful:) ). Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for sightseeing with rooftop pool and seating area”
Reviews.Author: nvaliris
Reviews.Content: We visited at the end of July 2009 and found the hotel pretty much as the other reviews very modern inside, which could feel cold to some as it's dark inside and the used of "mood" lighting everywhere. The roof top terrace with pool is a bonus and a really nice place to be, granted its not a massive pool but its nice to cool off and relax, what more do you want. Breakfast was ok but you pay extra and had a good selection of cooked, cold meats, pastries, salads, cakes, etc. The room was a good size and we had a room facing inward which had a very small balcony thing but no views.. The room was very clean and modern with again the "mood" lighting with a combination of switches depending on what you want lit up. A piece of advice check out the switch for the WC first otherwise you will end up lighting up the whole room in the middle of the night. The TV was quite basic and had poor reception of channels. The bathroom is like a designer has gone mad, some will love it and some will hate it. There is glass between the bath and the main room but with blinds which can be used to block the views. You will need to find the controls in the bathroom for the blinds - we did by accident. The shower was great but the main problem was that as the sides of the bath tilted slightly outwards all the shower water ended up on the floor and flooded our bathroom. Just use lots of towels. There is a mini bar and well stocked which was nice as was a safe. For evening meals we ate out and found a selection of local restaurants in the area but liked a pizzeria we found only 2 mins from the hotel on the corner and square of Carrier d'Entenca and Carrier de la Diputacio. Cant recall the name but the food was excellent and great tapas. I guess the main downside for the hotel is the in the evening you are not in the centre so either you take the Metro or you try to seek out those locally used cafes. The metro is just round the corner from the hotel so easy to go straight to the centre for three euros and takes about 5-8 mins or to walk takes 25 mins but is nice early in the morning then get the metro back. Oh and something which is not that well advertised is round the corner is a massive magic fountain sound and light show which is free and quite magical "la font Magica" in Placa de Carles Bulgas and worth seeing. There is a big new police station right opposite which is handy when you get something stolen. Just a word of caution Barcelona is renowned for pick pockets so only take money you intent on using that day and minimal cards. At the metro don't flash your cash whilst buying tickets at the machines or show where you are putting you wallet. They tend to observe this and then easy pickings on the metro when busy. Regards airport the Aerobus stops in Place d'Espania which is next to the hotel and on return the stop is on the other side of the square and for Easyjet UK, London flights it T2 bus you want as there are two identical buses one for T1 and one for T2. All in all can't fault the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary and Modern with a Beautiful Pool”
Reviews.Author: LeicBoy
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner spent 3 nights at this hotel and we would definitely recommend the hotel. The staff are very friendly and nice they actually understand customer service. As soon as you walk in through the doors you know its going to be a nice stay. The hotel is not pretentiousness it has a nice relaxed feel and atmosphere. The price of the food etc… is very reasonable considering your in Barcelona. You are located a 2minute walk from the tube stop which is fantastic as you can travel to the beach in 15-20min and the centre in 10-15mins. There are cafés and local shops near by so you can also grab something. The room was modern, contemporary and clean which was great. The food was nice of what we had at the hotel. The pool was really nice with great views. One suggestion is to see the magic fountains as they are a few minutes walk from the hotel and it’s fantastic! There was also Free WI-FI the way it shoul also be! The only two drawbacks we found were the balcony was more of a window ledge and the mattresses were very soft, but the mattresses may have just been our rooms. Enjoy as am sure you will!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel, Value for money.....a bit noisy?!”
Reviews.Author: marcokl28
Reviews.Content: Went to Barcelona recently for 4 days and chose this hotel from reading Trip's reviews. It is a funky little hotel. I'd rather stay in this clean, comfortable, modern looking 3 star hotel than other higher rated hotels that cost the earth and aren't as nice as this place. PROS: In my experience, the location's great, the reception staff were friendly and polite, the room was modern looking, the rooftop pool is nice addition during the blazing hot weather, breakfast was included when I went. CONS: Noisy location?! The hotel is just on the edge of a massive 6 lane round-about and tunnel so there was a bit of traffic noise from time to time but the major gripe was a rumbling sound every 10 minutes! It wasn't enough to completely spoil the holiday but I could definitely hear and feel what seemed to be a train going by! Overall, it was a nice stay for 3 nights holiday but reading the other reviews on this site, I wonder if anyone else had the same noise problems I did?

Reviews.Title: “B hotel more like A+”
Reviews.Author: antprior2009
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from my short 4 days in Barcelona! I did some previous research on hotels and The B hotel looked great. I was dubious with regards to hotels in the past having fantastic photos but then let me down in person. The B hotel did not disapoint at all and was better than i thought it woudl be. The room was very clean and welcoming, a great place to relax and although quite a busy road outside the rooms were very well sound insualted. The staff were excellent and very helpful. The booking was easy via their directr site and even took notice of my requirements of a high level room with queen size bed. Rooftop pool was a lovley place to relax and looks jsut as good in person as it does in the photos!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, modern hotel, fab rooftop pool!”
Reviews.Author: mumof3littleboys
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (11am) so room not ready (3pm) so went to rooftop pool. Pool has a supplement of 4euros which I think is harsh considering that there isn't really much service and choice on menu. Also, you have to call them up every time, this was annoying. Our room (503) was very funky and trendy, the lights system is amazing. We'd asked for a double bed but ended up with 2 singles together. The location is approx 30min stroll to La Rambla, be prepared for lots of walking. 5min to magic fountains. The hotel was quite quiet which was nice as Barcelona is so busy it was nice to retreat to the hotel. Breakfast was ok. Overall would recommend to anyone but next time I would leave the hotel for lunch and visit a nearby cafe and get drinks from supermarket...much much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for visiting Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: lxtobar
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 4-nights stay at B-Hotel and it was just brilliant. The rooftop pool and terrace is just the best there is out there, with an amazing view of Plaça de Espanya. There's a metro right next to the hotel (but we didn't hear anything at night on the 4th floor) and also the Aerobus from the airport stops there. Quiet area, but next to the Magic Fountain and Montjuic and easy transport to any other place in town -- we used both the bus and metro. Breaskfast was also very good with a wide selection. Hotel staff was always very helpful and pleasant, gave us a map on arrival and tried to get us the room we wanted. A+ treatment! The only "bad" thing I can complain about is the damp smell in the room floors (but not in the rooms!) which didn't really smell bad, was just somewhat odd to have it. Maybe it is due to the carpet, not sure...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: acptbay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our first nights of our honeymoon at B Hotel and were very happy with our stay. Upon our early arrival the front desk staff were very accommodating and friendly and set us up with a room upgrade and bottle of champagne to celebrate our honeymoon. Our room was fantastic! It was a corner suite with an excellent view of L'Espanya square. We loved the modern decor of the room (and entire hotel). The roof-top pool is very cool and we spent a fair bit of time up there after exploring the city. We spent our first day in Barcelona at Monjuic and were thrilled with the B Hotel location. It was also very easy to get to from the airport - we just hopped on an AeroBus for 4 Euro and we were there in about 15 minutes. This was much appreciated after 20 hours of travel. We loved our 3 night stay at B Hotel and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing destination hotel for a conference”
Reviews.Author: cwmfelin
Reviews.Content: We held out bi-annual conference at teh B-Hotel with colleagues from Asia, Africa, Americas and Europe. All found it delightful and efficient for a 3 day meeting. The staff could not have been more friendly, I wish I had a note of their names to credit them all. When not in the meeting, I spent time in the bar and at the amazing infinity pool - you cannot miss this, especially at sunset. The location is perfect for your first trip to Barcelona and I'm sure you'll fall in love with it too and go back many times.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: pineappleguy
Reviews.Content: Hello, the B-hotel is not that great, attitude at checkin, safe not working, no laundry, roof top deck closed for a private party, no ice machines, no maintance staff on duty, internet broken, front desk could not make any decisions without phoning a manager who was off duty. It did not meet expecations. Many better places.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Comfortable, Friendly & near Magic Fountains”
Reviews.Author: Sunsetmama
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was close to the Magic Fountains & was very pleased with my selection. The hotel is only 3 years old, modern with comfy beds. The reception was friendly with multi lingual staff. My booking was for my daughter and I so we could do some sightseeing. Our room consisted of two comfortable single beds, my daughter was pleased with the crisp white cotton sheets. Other reviews mention difficulties with the modern lighting in the rooms, we didnt have any problem. It was a simple press button system worked after inserting your room keycard. We shut the blinds over the bath for privacy in the bathroom & WC area. We found there was hardly any traffic noise & had a really good nights sleep after our busy day. We were offered breakfast at 10euros each at reception & were pleased we took this option up. Breakfast consisted of bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, catalan dishes of empanada (tuna, egg, tomato, pinenut pie - very tasty), assorted breads, Jams, cheese, meats, local sausage & tropical fruits. All washed down with coffee and juices. A very good selection. The pool area on the roof was a very pleasant area, but those who do not like heights may find the infinity pool a bit daunting. Paying our bill with different reception staff was again very friendly without any problems. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but did find that there was a lack of restaurants in this area for an evening meal. We walked up the road toward Barcelona Sants station front entrance and found a chinese about 400mtrs away, nothing else except a small cafe on the way. We ate well there for less than 20 euros for both of us including a jug of sangria! The tourist buses & metro are close by. The magic fountains are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-A Haven after sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: choppers149
Reviews.Content: perfect for metro and train links.in total about 45 mins from airport. Buy a Barcelona card online before travel and collect at the airport. Covered nearly every form of transport and a few discounts.Brill location for the Camp Neu and other major sights.about 20 mins walk to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, some issues...”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvls
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Friendly Staff, Good Prices! I would recommend B-Hotel to others, all around was a good experience I stayed in 709 Executive room Had a nice balcony and plenty of widows with great views. The only issues I had were: Shower leaked a incredible amount of water on to the floor from under the seals that hold the water on the ledge of the tub. Not enough seating at the pool. Now which can be good if you have a spot, nobody is on top of you, but if you dont have a place your S.O.L! Need a pool attendant! Those issues are so small that I would go back again no questions asked! Great place keep up the good job.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jim148
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights during June. Very clean and stylish room (505, B-corner room). I noticed on one day that the glass door to the toilet had a crack near the hinge, next day a new door had been fitted and I hadn't yet told the staff! So very attentive to the quality and safety of the rooms. Great location, right next to Espanya metro and a great hotel to explore Mont Juic from (get yourself to Font Magica one night!). Roof top pool was great for relaxing after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, love it, love it!!”
Reviews.Author: aquaboyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the B Hotel for 7 nights and loved it. It is a modern hotel, with an amazing roof top pool and view. The staff were fab and extremely helpful, in particular Cecilia at reception was wonderful and provided us with lots of tips on Barcelona. We requested a quite room, which we got. We would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, staff, rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: cairnsscene
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2009. As an owner of a hotel in Australia I take a particular interest in other hotels. This hotel is a great package. Rooms are funky, modern and comfortable. I was given an upgrade to a corner view room and that came with an outstanding view of the Plaza Espana. The service from the start at reception, then to the breakfast staff and even the housekeepers was exceptional. I booked direct with the hotel via their website. The location is also good. Close to the city centre, transport and just on the next corner a convenience store...that sells everything from freshly baked bread to wines, beers and sprits. I would have no hesitation recomending this hotel. The pool on the roof is a great place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “super chic, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: lowesquare
Reviews.Content: it's like an ikea hotel - and i mean that as a flattering comment! basically you get a super chic place for a really good price ... it's made to be a tourist hotel, so that you have a nifty rooftop pool (it really does look like what the photos show) and a very euro-designed room replete with bidet, but things like the "bar" is more just a counter where you could get a bartender to mix a drink for you, the "business center" is two computer terminals, the king size bed is two twin beds covered by a king sized fitted sheet. regardless, it was a fun experience, i slept really well, and i def would recommend it to anyone passing through barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value for a very swanky hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Scratchpaper
Reviews.Content: Using trip advisor for our lodging advice in Barcelona, we chose the B-Hotel due to its appearance and semi-value pricing. For the price, we were so incredibly impressed by the B-Hotel. The decor, the rooms, the bar, and the food are all very impressive. Not to mention the amazing rooftop pool and deck which really are the highlights of staying here. On the pool you get great views of the Spanish Plaza and nearby historic museums. Great stay we would absolutely recommend it and would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel, fantastic pool but off-putting reception ruined everything”
Reviews.Author: GoldenKiwis
Reviews.Content: We reserved our room by email, four months in advance. When no confirmation arrived within a week, we worried that the form had not gone through properly, so re-booked, stating in the "special request" area on the form that we had already tried to book and - since we were traveling all the way from New Zealand - we wanted to be sure we had secured a room. On arrival at the reception desk we were told that because we had booked twice we had two rooms reserved and payment for both would be taken from our credit card. Clearly nobody had read the note on the second application. This was so ridiculous we could not believe it. It was eventually sorted, but ruined our stay there. They do not have a restaurant, but the Hotel Catalonia Barcelona, on the Plaza Espana itself, has a gourmet restaurant with very reasonable, set-priced menus. Next time we will stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Crinkly
Reviews.Content: Wife & I had an extended Bank Hoiliday weekend at the B Hotel. Wonderful friendly & helpful staff at Reception. Rooms are modern & trendy, no problems with the lighting system as some people apppear to have had from reading previous reviews, it just takes a few seconds to figure it out. Had a problem with the electronic door card & was immediately upgraded to a larger room with a good view of Plaza Espana. The hotel is located three Metro stops from Plaza Catalyuna & La Rambla, fare is 1.35 Euro each way per person although you can buy a multi trip ticket from the ticket machines. There are very few good restaurants located around the hotel , so you will find that you need to get down to the center to eat. The hotel itself has a very limited food menu in the bar. Breakafast is a self service buffet and the food is good, dont leave breakfast to the last minute or you will find some of the food items are all gone! The bar in the hotel is really quiet & not much used by guests, so, if you are looking to have hectic evenings this is not the place for you. Drink prices in the bar are very reasonable & the bar staff are very nice & friendly. The pool area on the roof has spectacular views & is a good place to relax , sunbathe or read. To sum up, a very nice hotel, reasonably priced, great staff & makes a great base to explore Barcelona from.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept- but done on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: pixietourist
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were impressed with B Hotel- the recption area is modern, the staff were friendly and welcoming. Again on first inspection the room was impressive- good size, nice balcony (if you can call it that- more of an outside ledge), uber trendy bathroom with glass wall into bedroom, on balance however we just felt whilst the concept of a lot of the design features were great- the reality was it had been poorly/cheaply constructed. eg. shower leaks into bedroom area, all over bathroom floor and showerhead filthy. What the room lacked in terms of quality the roof top terrace made up for!! It was a brilliant space to chill out after a hard days sight seeing, the sun loungers were comfy, the views spececular and pool refreshing! the location was good- right by metro, short walk to magic fountains and handy supermarket less than a minutes walk (plus adult supermarket opposite if that sort of thing takes your fancy!!). All in all we enjoyed our stay but felt compared to other hotels we have stayed in in Barcelona it wasn't superb value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: TheSubmariner
Reviews.Content: We booked this 2 night stay well in advance to take care of a good discount. My wife and I were not dissapointed. It really is a trendy, almost art deco type hotel. They have new fixtures everywhere. The staff were friendly. The breakfast was very good too. The rooms were top notch although I was not too thrilled that they make two beds into one. I think that is a European thing though. Nevertheless, I couldnt fault the room much. The pool deck at the top was fantastic. I went up there for a sundowner cigar and a drink. Very relaxing.... The metro stop is right there across the road. The rooms are soundproofed too. Free wifi in the rooms and fridge were cool too I would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: StanleyWales
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say a Hugh Thank you - for all your help, running up to the stay at the B hotel, and also your help while I was there - most appreciated. I also wanted to mention the girls on the desk , Monica, Zuzana, Adriana and Cecilia. They are all an asset to the Hotel, they are all so friendly and willing to help all the time. The help they gave me while I was running the conference was amazing and really appreciated. The Hotel is very Trendy and as soon as you get use to the lightening you are your way. the front of the Hotel can be noisy, but the back is very quiet but what do you expect being so close to the city. Would definately stay at the B-Hotel again for Business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great roofdeck, great service!”
Reviews.Author: MoSmileyCA
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at B Hotel for three nights after a business trip to London. The hotel was great, from the moment we checked in, to the moment we checked out. Upon arrival the receptionists were very nice and helpful. We went up to our room to drop off our stuff. The room was very modern and sexy. The lights took a minute for us to figure out (hint: insert your room key) but overall very nice. There was a bath-tub, which, from what I understand, isn't very common in Barcelona. The bathroom did get pretty wet everytime one of us showered, but neither of us gets particularly bothered with these sort of things... I liked the location a lot, despite the fact that it was a cab or subway ride away from most of the action -- you could walk into the more happening parts of the city during the day if you don't mind a walk -- but if you have plans or something the metro is the best bet -- Plaza Espanya is a two minute walk away. The roof deck was also beautiful. We spent a few hours lounging by the pool, drinking Cava and relaxing. It was really romantic. And a great view. It wasn't warm enough to go swimming when we were there, but I imagine it would be great in the middle of the summer. The room service wasn't great. One night I wasn't feeling well so my boyfriend ordered room service while I rested. It looked pretty bad -- not un-edible, but definately in need of a serious upgrade. The receptionist was also very helpful on check-out. Calling us a cab and even offering to be in touch with our airline (We had a question about the flight). Overall I thought the hotel was pretty great and will probably stay there again on my next trip to Barcelona (which honestly can't be soon enough!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique property with big sexy rooms, floor-to-cieling glass walls and peak-a-boo shower.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite hotel experiences amidst the 100 or so in which I've stayed in Europe over the past 2 years! Modern trendy boutique hotel located on central Plaza Espana. The new construction exterior facade is dominated by the floor-to-cieling glass walls of the rooms. On top of the hotel, a gorgeous infinity pool looks out over the large majestic Plaza and the Montjuic hillside above. The spacious lobby has high ceilings and I believe a restaurant (that I did not experience). Service at check-in was professional, friendly and quick. Upstairs, a large corner room invitingly waited. (we had only paid for the least expensive room... not sure if this was an upgrade or just good luck.) The room was huge for European standards! A large inviting bed draped in plush linens and fabrics. A plasma TV freestanding in the middle of the room facing the bed. Glass walls that wrapped around the room, curving slightly with the face of the building and looking over Plaza Espana. (oh my, the view of the plaza bathed in the orange-pink light of dawn!!!! I will never forget it.) The large bathroom in the center of the room, again, all new construction throughout, had top-end fixtures and toiletries and... the sparkling clean bathtub/shower sat adjacent to a glass wall back into the room. Depending on the numerous lighting settings inside/outside the room/bathroom, one could enjoy the beauty of a shower from the comfort of the big bed. The prices we found on Tablet hotel were simply stunning for such a top quality hotel. Anybody who enjoys a modern boutique hotel experience should love this place! I rarely go back to the same hotel, but for the B Hotel, I know I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, noisy location”
Reviews.Author: Hobartgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights. Our room overlooked 7 lanes of traffice and was near a huge round-about so it was quite noisy and the tiny balcony could not be used because of the noise. Nice pool area on the roof but was too cold for a swim. The rooms are large but have THE most complicated fittings. The lights are madness - eg to turn on the toilet light you need to press the TV button on the console. We never really worked out how to turn lights on and off other than by trial and error. There was a blind separating the bathroom from the bedroom and had to ask reception how to close it. Also had to ask reception where the hair dryer was. Went to use it the next day and it did not work. They did send another up for the remainder of the stay. The hotel has three internet computers available for free use. The staff were very friendly and helpful and all spoke good English. Close to the Metro station Made the mistake of booking over the Grand Prix weekend so the prices were doubled (did not know at the time of booking)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Europeanhoneymoon
Reviews.Content: Room was quite large, bathroom was good and decent sized if a little dark. Very modern hotel, enjoyed Sky News and the amenities provided. Very comfortable bed, nice to have a couch. Location is ok - great if you are arriving by train from Sants Barcelona; only a 10 minute flat walk and good access to metro stations however if walking only, probably better to stay nearer to the Ramblas and la Sagrada Familia if that's what you're there for. Not many good restaurants within walking distance - we used the metro which was not a problem. The hotel itself is good, the staff were friendly, wireless internet was free and we didn't sample any food.

Reviews.Title: “Gird your loins”
Reviews.Author: Eaden
Reviews.Content: This was a weekend trip just before I had to go to a conference. The hotel is in a really useful location near a subway hub, and a great venue for doing the open-topped bus tour. But it's a little difficult to share a room with a platonic friend without blushing - the over modern bathroom was a bit too much of a challenge as if you want privacy, you have to get a degree in engineering just to sort out which buttons to press or levers to pull in order not to display yourself to the whole bedroom. Apart from that, the hotel was excellent value, had a nice roof balcony (although there were builders working on the next door block). getting food was a challenge too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great value. Location requires metro use.”
Reviews.Author: tz3d
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe how nice this hotel was. Great design, great amenities, great room. There is an amazing pool on the roof of this hotel. The only issue in the room was figuring out how the lights work, it's a little complicated, but still really cool. The rooms are huge and the beds are enormous. The bathroom is also really cool, there is a window between the bathroom and bedroom. Pretty great for a couple. The only drawback is the location. It's not a bad location by any means. It is just a long walk to the Ramblas or Passeig de Gracia. The Metro is right there, so it is very convenient. Just know when the metro stops running or you might have to take some cabs. The location is near some big convention centers. So if you can schedule your trip when these conventions are not taking place, you should be able to get a sweet deal at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good three star but don't get too excited”
Reviews.Author: MarkCWales
Reviews.Content: First, the best thing about the B hotel: stunningly efficient, friendly, cheerful service. I had read other reviews and was not sure but the staff were brilliant. We had a conference over two days and stayed for four nights. The reception staff were always proactive, really concerned about our well-being and very enthusiastic. The rooms are very design-led. They look good but -- as usual in design hotels -- are not always practical. The large, heavy doors bang loudly; the furniture and the cleaners can scrape across the bare, laminate floors; voices echo around the minimalist corridors. Don't try sleeping during the day, even with earplugs. You have to ask for an iron (there seems to be a shortage because they always want to know when they can come and take it back) and the ironing board is one of those small, table-top types. There are no drawers for clothes (and only three small shelves) and they have those annoying hangers that slot into an odd holder. The bedding is really not pleasant. The cheap sheets are a bit too small for the thick mattresses. If you want more than sheets, the hotel only offer acrylic blankets. The ones in my room were stained and smelled of stale sweat. I went to the department store and bought my own. The food is very disappointing. The tapas menu is ok (but not great) -- other food is really mediocre. The fruit salad, for example, comes from a tin, complete with artificial cherries. Still, Barcelona is one of Europe's great restaurant cities so, just plan to eat out or buy food from the supermarket (100 metres away and open from 9am to 2am every day, including Sunday). The food may be bad but the staff who serve it are always willing to help. The rooftop pool is a lovely place to sit out (great views and a nice atmosphere) but not a great place to swim laps. The nearest gym is a 15 minute walk -- check the various opening times of different branches but the Dir chain provide excellent gyms for 12Euro a day or 25 a week. The hotel staff are very helpful at pinpinting which branches are closest. The conference room is nice with a terrace for smokers and natural light. The temperature control is a bit idiosyncratic but which conference room isn't? Overall, good three star value with lovely people but a few real shortcomings

Reviews.Title: “I will come back again.”
Reviews.Author: mona831
Reviews.Content: Location - Great: walking distance to Metro Plaza Espanya. Montjuic is also in the walking distance. Airport is close enough to go by taxi without worrying about traffic jams and there is a airport shuttle stop nearby for economical travel. Service - also great: very friendly staffs at reception, bar, breakfast and business center. They are efficient and speak good English. Interior - very cool! Simple but well designed and comfortable. Facilities - meeting room and catering service was good. I did not go to the pool but I heard it is also nice. Bar serves good food and drinks at reasonable prices. Wireless internet is for free and there are computers at the business center and 1 by the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, amazing breakfast, quite good location”
Reviews.Author: queryski
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a few nights during a week trip to Barcelona. We had a fantastic experience and would highly recommend this hotel. The hotel is right next to the Espanya metro stop, so really easy to get around, and just a few stops from teh centre. We walked into the centre on the first day and it didn't take long at all. A few good sights are really close by (Font Magica, Olympic Stadium, National Museum and more). The staff were really helpful and friendly, and had no problems when we rang at 11am of the day we were meant to check out to ask to check out a little later in the day. They gave us good tips and were always bright and friendly. Even though we were on a slight budget we opted for breakfast at the hotel and were so glad we did. For around GBP10 each you get the most amazing choice of breakfast, nothing is overlooked. Cereals, fruit, pastries, bread, cheese, yoghurt, roast vege, olives, toast, donuts, pretty much anything you could want. Our room was very clean and the cleaning staff always did a great job. the rooftop pool is fantastic and you get a great view. Really cool to go and chil out beside after a big day out sight seeing. I'd highly recommend this hotel if you can book in early and get the big discount for doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, cool rooms, great pool”
Reviews.Author: LanceFan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in Aug 2006 and had a great time. We loved the rooftop pool! The rooms are spacious and very modern - it did take us a few tried to figure out the lighting, but it's not impossible to master. The metro was very close by, so we could get anywhere very easily. The neighborhood itself is quite nice, with good restaurants withing walking distance, a pharmacy across the street, and a place that sells beer/liquor only a 5 minute walk down the street (great for bringing to rooftop for a drink and view of the city). We thought the hotel staff were quite helpful for recommendations on where to eat, what train to take, etc. Overall no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, smart hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: Ali_P_75
Reviews.Content: Found this to be a nice hotel in a pretty good location for a reasonable price. Found the reception staff friendly, the design pretty funky and the room to be clean and above average size for a major city. Location was pretty good - a couple of metro stops from Las Ramblas and handy for the "Bus Turistic" - the "hop-on, hop-off" open-topped bus that travels round the major sites and stops in the Placa Espanya, just metres away from the hotel. We also liked the fact that, on arrival from the airport after catching the train to Sants station, we were able to walk to the hotel in under ten minutes - no faffing around carrying cases up and down stairs to the metro! Ordered room service the night we arrived and the food (ham and salt cod croquettes with a side order of fries) was reasonably proced (especially for a hotel) and plentiful. Had a few problems getting the order across as my Spanish accent is appalling, but they handed the phone round until they found someone who could understand me, so no harm done! The hotel was quiet when we stayed - so the bar was always empty, but I can imagine in the summer it would be a lot fuller - especially with the roof pool which was closed in January, but we walked up to look at the view and were pretty impressed. Would definitely consider staying here again as it is a brilliant base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, new hotel at the right price, service a little chilly”
Reviews.Author: tonydennis
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the B Nov. 19 and 20 to stay in Barcelona for two days before our cruise. The hotel is less than 10 euro away (plus 1 euro charge for baggage) from the port. The value is pretty unbeatable for what we got, a stylish, very hip hotel right out of Wallpaper magazine. Extremely minimalist but with good use of materials. However, much of boutique design is looking very generic using the same zebrano woods and concrete and industrial materials, etc. This could be any cool hotel in the world - I didn't expect Gaudi, but would be nice to see some Spanish boutique influence. But I'm quibbling here, because the design is executed extremely well, especially for the price, we paid only 100 euro per night for a standard room. While the price is right, and the accommations are great, the staff (at least some of the staff obviously think cool surroundings mean a cool - non welcoming attitude) In a tiny hotel staff attitude is really important, because it's like a little home away from home. (which is why you don't book a big tour bus hotel) We ended up going to the nearby Plaza hotel across the road to book two tours and ask for advice because the staff were so much friendlier, even though the plaza is ironically a very busy tour bus kind of hotel. Maybe we were spoiled. When we arrived in Barcelona the airport employees were incredibly helpful and friendly and when we got lost getting to the B, some Barcelonians helped us out of the blue, so we were overwhelmed at how warm and friendly the Spaniards were. When we got to the B the front desk folk were, I must stress, not rude, but definitely not warm or welcoming - but really quite indifferent would be the attitude. Which is OK, but not a great way to welcome guests. We have stayed at many boutique hotels all over the world (including all of the Ian Schrager group in New York) and I understand getting good staff is always a problem, and we also realize this is not the Four Seasons with their level of training or pricing. We were just spoiled because the average Barcelonian was so friendly, that the chilly atmosphere of the B staff was a bit of a shock. Also, the security guard at night (or I think he was, he wore a jacket and tie) could learn to smile more - he doesn't have to say hello to guests or even acknowledge them - but you really felt you were intruding in his space in the lobby. The security guard at the Plaza, on the other hand was quick to show us how to use the public telephone when he saw us struggling with it. To be fair we only met four different front desk staff in our two days. The two women were helpful, but the guys needed a bit of a reality check, no one (guy or gal) said hello or acknowledged guests as they came in and out of the hotel, which I guess is standard procedure. The guests may also have an attitude so maybe that's a reason? Front desk staff also didn't seem to know much about tours, attractions, etc. We also asked for a quiet room because of the construction and were given the standard line that all rooms are quiet. This isn't true, you can hear sirens going up and down the street and motorcyles going to work at 6 am, where we were on the fourth floor facing the street. Also you are sandwiched between two major construction sites. I grew up in a major urban area, so this didn't bug me all that much, but because it was my vacation, I really was hoping to sleep in. Overall, I would likely go back to the B because of the decent location and the extremely good price, but ask for a quieter room. I would also continue to use the staff at the Plaza for my tour bookings, etc. so you get the best of both worlds. Use the B for your room, but use the staff at the nearby hotel for your other needs. On a plus note, management does seem to care a lot about continuous improvement and feedback, which bodes well for the hotel group. A well priced, well located hotel that could use an attitude adjustment. cheers

Reviews.Title: “B Hotel was the B-est!!”
Reviews.Author: MickyPa
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the B Hotel and we absolutely enjoyed our stay. On our arrival we were greeted by a very nice girl, who gave us all the informations we needed on how to get around, even handing us a very useful map of the city. The Hotel is situated right next to Plaza Espana and a 30 minutes walk to Las Ramblas and Placa Catalonya. We don't usually use public transportation but the Hotel is very close to a metro station which it would take you everywhere you need to go. In Placa Espana you will be able to get a bus to and from the airport for only 1.60 euro, which is very convenient. We do not reccomend taking a taxi from the airport, they all charge a flat rate of 35 euro, and the Hotel is only 20 minutes away, so the price seemed very high. We were given a room facing the street, and even though the traffic can be pretty busy, we weren't bother too much by the noise coming from the outside. The room had a beautiful modern feeling, with a very nice bathroom, a flat screen TV and a little fridge filled up with all kind of drinks. Breakfast wasn't included in our room rate so we decided to take advantage of the buffet only on the last morning before our departure. The price was a bit high, 13 euro per person, but it was well worth it. The buffet had all kind of food like cereal, cheeses, salami, eggs, fresh fruit salad, yogurt and sweets. Plus coffee and tea to order. There is enough food to fill you up for good part of the day. We would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect Location”
Reviews.Author: ymous
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 2 days prior to my visit via hotels.com for only £55/night. Upon our very late arrival, we were upgraded to an executive room. The room was generously sized and faced the back so was nice and quiet. Referring to the comment two doors down about the missing bathroom door, this is a design feature of the room. There is no door between the bath and the bedroom, there is a black glass wall. There is a door for the toilet. Whilst not in the centre of Barcelona (a 30 minute walk from Las Ramblas), we found ourselves perfectly positioned for our visit to the monestry, which was on direct train route from the local station, and the castle and the sea were both walking distance. I did not try the breakfast here. There are lots of cafes and bakeries nearby where we got a coffee and pastry for 4 Euros. There were many small bars where you can get very good quality and reasonably priced tapas, especially along the adjacent street Avenue du Paralel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb”
Reviews.Author: Martin68
Reviews.Content: Location is a little out of the centre but I didn't find it a problem. The hotel is five minutes walk from the Placa Espanya metro stop and you can get into the centre very quickly or it's a 20 min walk to Placa Catlunya. Had a 6th floor room facing Grand Via. It is a very busy road and there was traffic noise but this is a city hotel so it's fair to expect it and it didn't bother me. If you're a light sleeper, there are some rooms on the inside of the hotel that you might want to ask for. The room is a good size with large desk, comfortable chair and sofa. There is a full length door and tiny balcony that you can step out on for a bit of fresh air. Bathroom is good with a decent sized bath and seriously powerful shower which amazingly doesn't go all over the floor like most do. The mood lighting in the room (but not the bathroom) is really excellent and it's all controlled by buttons at the door and bed which cycle through various settings. Venetian blinds to the bathroom are fun (the controls are below the bathroom mirror in case you're wondering!). Wi-fi is free, fast and reliable (and as a bonus works on the roof terrace which is stunning!). The buffet breakfast was absolutely excellent with a wide selection and staff that kept the food topped up, cleared/reset tables and actually seemed to take pride in their job. In many hotels the buffet breakfast seems to be an excuse for the staff to hide away as much as possible so full marks to B-Hotel. I used room service once and it was good. The menu is pretty basic but fresh, well cooked and reasonably priced compared to many hotels. The staff were friendly, attentive, efficient and helpful throughout. The niggles are few and far between. The safe is slightly too small for a 15" laptop and the designer should be shot for the lack of decent lighting anywhere near a mirror! All in all, this is a really fabulous hotel for travellers on a midrange budget who appreciate contemporary design. Note you can get extra discount by booking more than 30 days in advance on the hotel's own website. I rate B-Hotel very highly indeed for a 3 star and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown property.Unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: FCMUsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at B hotel last spring for 4 nights. The hotel location is good; in Placa Espana at the bottom of Montjuic Hill.On the other hand, the hotel is rundown, dirty , smelly and the staff was unprofessional. One of our rooms had stains all over the wall and the carpet; the bathroom door was missing and the air conditioning broken. As we were going to stay there four nights we asked for a quieter room and we were put right across from a construction site. Of course, we were told no other room was available. We were awoken by the unbearable noise every morning early. The W.C. room door was missing but according to the staff was not a big deal! We checked out the night before and realized there was a mistake in the bill; they had charged us less when we told the employee about the mistake we were told not to worry about it; the discrepancy would have been explained to the supervisor by the employee .We were told to consider that as a discount we should have gotten for all the inconveniences. The next day at 4:30am when we were leaving for the airport, we were called by the same employee and we were told that in reality that discount offered the night before, could not be given to us. We did not have the time to argue and as we had already paid what was on the bill, we left telling the employee to have the supervisor call/ e-mail us the next day to solve the problem( I left all my home & work details on top of my passport and cc info they already had).We also said not to involve the rest of our party in this issue BUT the other people in pour party were asked pay the difference causing a significative embarrassment .Following my e-mail, the hotel manager accused us to leave without paying(!)and offered a ridiculous refund for the rooms' AC, W.C. door, etc. that we did not accept. Very unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: PremierGirl
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay in the B hotel, Barcelona. We could not find any fault whatsoever and have so say that it has been the best value experience ever. I did a massive amount of research before I booked and found the best value by booking directly on the hotel's own website. We also got an 'early booking' discount and the average cost per night was 47 euro, without breakfast. The hotel is located beside Placa d'Espanya. The metro system in Barcelona (located a couple of minutes from hotel) makes transport very easy and most parts of Barcelona very easy to access. On my last visit to Barcelona, June 2008, we stayed on Las Ramblas which was a great location for Las Ramblas and the Barri Gotic. I feel that the location of the B hotel did not take from my stay this time and I will definitely be returning. A note on booking restaurants; I did alot of research on the top restaurants and cross checked different websites. I prebooked a different 'top' restaurant each night through toptable.co.uk and this eliminated the bother of looking for good restaurants each day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karagiozis
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend for five nights in September and really enjoyed it. The room was excellent and the decor/style was very original. Very clean and the bathroom adds a very nice touch. The staff throughout the hotel were fantastic in particular the reception desk always helpful and accommodating. The location is slightly out of town (15-20 mins walk to the center depending on pace) but it is right next to a metro station (3-4 stops) and you dont really notice. Weather permitting the rooftop pool is an ideal place to relax with some nice views. Would definitely stay here again if I came back to barcelona. One last thing, would highly recommend the tapas of the day set selection at the hotel (excellent value and very tasty).

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lbcf
Reviews.Content: Our 3-nights-stay at the B Hotel was perfect. We loved the chic and simple design, the lighting in our room was great, the swimming pool was awesome and the location, unbeatable (for our taste: not too close to the Ramblas, near to a metro station (lines 1 and 3), near to the fountains, Montjuic, Fundacio Miro, only 15 to 25 min to the airport using the Aerobus). The staff was very friendly and corteous and they spoke spanish and english, at least. We stayed here with our two-year old daughter. Everybody was super nice and kind to her and even though there are no children amenities in this hotel, she thoroughly enjoyed her time at the hotel's roof-top swimming pool and at the playground of the "Parc Joan Miro" (only one block away) when we were at the hotel, which was not much, we spent a lot of our time getting to know the city. We had a good experience with room service and breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Gorgeous Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TeeGee101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the B-Hotel back in 2005 - but have visited it since though not to stay. The hotel had only recently opened when we stayed for 4 nights. It was gorgeous - Really stylish. Great connections to the city centre via the metro which is right outside the hotel entrance. We have visited Barcelona about 5-6 times and this is one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The only reason we have stayed anywhere else is down to availability. B-Hotel always seems to be fully booked when we are in town! Staff are friendly. Rooms are very clean. Beds are very comfy. Prices seem to be rising each year but you can still grab some bargains. Recommend for city breaks - couples, not families - don't think there is anything at hotel for kids...there is a roof top pool. this is pretty cool but if you are scared of heights - beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Alright if you are not fussy”
Reviews.Author: ChampagneTasteEurope
Reviews.Content: Looks too good on the internet hence the disappointment with reality. To be fair, it is well equiped for a three star but it is a bit far out, though close to the tube station. The free wireless in the room does not really work and when it does it is very slow. breakfast was a disappointment, i think we paid 36 euros for two....was not really worth it. Roof top pool is also not up to scratch... I think they are trying but it is designer look on the cheap... Staff are 1st rate though. I know there lots of ums and arrrs here but I would only recommend it if you are not a demanding type, that would be happy to have some amenities and does not mind long walks, taking the tube or taxis to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great discovery.”
Reviews.Author: stanley9
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Barcelona for the first time with my girlftriend and we stayed at the B-Hotel and had an absolutely amazing time.
