This hotel is extremely chic and in a great location for those who prefer not to stay too close to the madness of the Ramblas. It is very close to the Magic Fountain which has an amazing light and music show in the evenings. Getting to the Ramblas, the beach and the marina is extremely easy as there is a Metro station and a bus stop incredibly nearby and Spanish public transport is fast, clean, very cheap and air conditioned. The hotel itself is beautifully designed and has an amazing roof top deck with sun loungers, complete with an infinity pool, which is a great place to chill out after a day's sightseeing or before heading off at night. The rooms themselves are great too and have excellent bathrooms although the lighting takes some getting used to! Our only criticism would be the awful overpriced breakfasts. Guests would do better to walk around the corner to Paul's the upmarket bakers and buy some top notch pastries instead. Incidentally, we'd heard that Barcelona could be dangerous with lot's of muggings but we felt quite safe strolling through the town at midnight. Finally, this hotel appeals to couples of all sexual persuasions but is not suitable for families, as it lacks child friendly facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Calby71
Reviews.Content: I was with a party of 6 girls, celebrating a big birthday. The hotel was perfect for this. Lovely terrace with pool, and the friendly staff on hand with beers for us! I booked directly with the hotel and got a very good price. I would recommend staying here as you are minutes away from the Metro and the stop for the tour bus, which I would thoroughly recommend. I didn't have breakfast in the hotel as it was 13 euros, but there were plenty of restaurants on the main street. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: VolleyNOR
Reviews.Content: Great modern design hotel, perfect location at Plaza España(Bus and Metro connecting all Barcelona 10 meters from the hotel), serviceminded staff, lovely teracce area, nice pool view, comofortable spacious rooms, tasty various breakfast, free internet use. Everything was perfect! Absolutely recommended!! A&E

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: molly_malone_81
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading positive reviews on tripadvisor. I was very happy with it overall, really great modern design and good value to be had online. Great breakfast too, with lots of choice and variety. One minor quibble would be that while the reception staff are very polite, the bar staff were not very helpful to us when we tried to claim a free meal that was meant to be included in our booking deal, but maybe they were just having a bad night! Also, the bathrooms in the rooms are a bit strange with the shower being "on view" to the bedroom (although there is a way to screen it out as we eventually discovered after a few days) and our toilet door was a sliding door...modern design can have its pitfalls!. The hotel is right beside a metro and very easy to get to and from. Overall, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the "B" Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaPeggy
Reviews.Content: I was more than pleased with our stay at the B Hotel. It was very modern, clean & very convieniently located to the train station, airport & tourist buses. I would definately stay there again. I always check several web sites. 1st prices(very reasonable), then for reviews, and we (there were 6 of us) were not disappointed with anything at the "B". Peggy S California

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: timbo56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights on a romantic/sightseeing break. Although it is slightly out of the city centre we found it a great location. It is easily accessible from the airport by the airport bus right outside the terminal. They will drop you at Plac Espanya and the hotel is right there. When you want to head into the city centre there is a metro station just across the road from the hotel. We found this the easiest way to get around and were in the city centre within 10 minutes of leaving the hotel. Within 10 minutes walk of the hotel is the hill of Montjuc and the Font Magic which are worth a look on weekend evenings when the fountains are set to music. Also next to this is Mies Van Der Rohe's Barcelona Pavillion, a mecca for architecture buffs. We carried on walking up the hill, helped by a series of very welcome outdoor escalators and after a half hours stroll with some beautifull views of the city, we were at the Joan Miro Museum. Carry on from here and you can get the Fununcular railway back to the metro system. We found the staff really helpfull and friendly. Breakfast very good with a great selection which definitely set us up for a day of sightseeing (sausage, bacon, eggs, tortilla, cereal, toast, croisants, pastries, fruit, tea, coffee, juices, cold meats, bread, cheese, tomato, boiled egg, etc.). General design of the hotel is cool and modern. It was clean and well maintained. Slightly form over function in some things but fun anyway. The rooms are pretty big and well laid out. Much bigger than you would get in some 3 stars. I'm guessing there are certain criteria you need to fulfill to get a higher star rating because this is way better than some 3 stars I have stayed in. Maybe the fact that they don't have a full restaurant hold it back. We booked through last minute and it didn't say whether they were twin or double beds on the booking. My wife added in the comments that we would like a double and they had a record of the comment at reception when we arrived. We were told we had been given a 'Matrimonial' bed. I don't know if this is the normal double size for this hotel but it was massive. The glass divider between bedroom and shower was an interesting concept although maybe not so good if you were travelling with a friend! There was a venetian blind between the panes of glass but we never managed to work out how to close it. The deck on the roof is great for a relaxing drink although it was a little too chilly to test the pool when we were there. One negative thing I have seen in other reviews is the fact thet there is a lot of building work around which spoils the view. True there are a lot of buliding going up and cranes nearby but we weren't disturbed by the noise at all. I guess it isn't the best view in Barcelona but from what I saw most of the upmarket hotels in the city centre were either on narrow lanes with no view at all or on fairly busy streets anyway. If you want a really nice modern hotel AND a beautiful view of the seafront or marina I think you probably need to up your budget. Unless someone knows different and I'd be glad of the reccomendation. I've also seen some people have mentioned that there is a sex shop across the road. Unless you have children who you don't want asking awkward questions or you are particularly sensitive I wouldn't worry about it. The windows are completely blacked out and there is nothing on display from outside. Overall we had a great stay and would be happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Unpolite receptionist”
Reviews.Author: MACY13a
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent, but the receptionist was very unpolite and rude. She told us in half an hour to check in and when we got there she said that she was mistaken and that we had to come back in more than 4 hours later! Very unprofessional for such a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pro and con”
Reviews.Author: ceedaworld
Reviews.Content: The B hotel is a fashion hip hotel. I am well traveled and have been in many types of places. Pro Nice size room. Efficient staff. Clean and sanitary room. Normal good breakfast.(eggs, bacon breads, fresh OJ, pastries, fruit ect. Nice bath amenities.(Could use a 3x magnifying mirror in the bathroom as it is dark in there) Rooms face front and back of busy street. Higher floors are nicer.Back rooms are quiet but they face a wall. Close to airport bus. Right across the street.Either aeroportobus (4.05 eur) or city bus line 46 (1.20 euro ).26 min ride to airport at 10 AM time Next to the Magic fountain. 400 meters away. A must see on the weekend startng at 9 PM. Walk out the door turn right and then left. Fun infinity pool but the view is being obstructed by the construction next door.They are building a mall in the old bull ring. Go to google earth to see it. Fun bath room. Lights work by dimmer switch.Glass bath room walls make the room appear bigger. Free internet. Such a well thought out room but the toilet paper was difficult to access. And the bath is easy to flood the floor. Remember the old adage form follows function.Hear that Mr hotel designer? Con. Staff is just efficient .I got different answers to the same question. Why don't all staff members know about the weather forecast? It's a big factor in sightseeing and it should be posted or the staff should have a little clue as to the forecast for the day. Noise from construction next door. It is 30 meters away. Breakfast should be in the price. Bad feng shui as the bar is not a place to hang out. No restaurants in the area. Rooms are soundproof to a point. Other guests are quite varied. Mostly younger crowd as this is a hip place. Starting to look like a 3 year old hotel. If you get a good price this is a wonderful base for a first time visit. It is safe, and a member of the NN hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Devil is in the detail”
Reviews.Author: AllegraLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the B last year on business as it was ideally located for the convention centre, but have just returned from a leisure weekend with a friend. It's always interesting when you return to a place because you take in more of the detail - and now that the whole 'Hip Hotel' concept is ubiquitous, it's the detail in such places that can often make a passable experience into a special one. So, a few things worth noting with the B as of May 2008: 1. The whole construction thing next door has taken on a nightmarish life of its own since last September. Our room looked out onto the skeleton of what is evidently going to be a multistorey carpark, blocking the view of a fabulous traditional bullring. These rooms are dimly lit anyway (it's what you expect in a hip place, right?) but this carpark monstrosity kills any natural light completely. 2. On the same subject, the rooftop terrace and chillout deck trough (it's only a metre wide so not a pool, but nice for a dip) loses most of its atmosphere when you have workers hanging off cranes just a short distance away. And as for the noise - well, forget any quiet meditative moments gazing towards Tibidabo.... 3. The bathrooms generally get rave reviews at this hotel, but we found a lot of the details pretentious and a triumph of style over substance. The deluge shower is literally that - poorly designed shower panel makes you flood the room in minutes. I just pity their chambermaids having to do the morning flood control! The downlighting makes the mirrors pretty useless - a small illuminated shaving mirror wouldn't be too uncool surely? There are no hooks anywhere. There is a venetian blind system between the bathroom and the bedroom, which we had to ask how to control at the front desk so that my friend and I could enjoy at least a bit of lavatorial privacy!! It really isn't too much nowadays to get the best of beautiful design and practical function in a hotel room, yet the B has way too much of the former. I'd say the place is due a rethink on updating some of its 'hip' features, in order to stay on top of an increasingly competitive market in Barcelona. One practical tip as a parting thought - to avoid minibar charges, there is a fab little kiosk opposite the hotel entrance on Gran Via (next to the sex shop...) and it (the kiosk, not the sex shop) sells everything you find in the minibar at a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and good location!”
Reviews.Author: Trish22
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the B Hotel for 4 days in March. The location while not central, is a short metro ride to most attractions. It is also convenient for getting to the airport. The rooms were tasteful and comfortable. Loved the bathroom! The lighting was also unique. My only complaint about the room is that the ventilation system is quite loud - even when we turned it off, you could hear a noise everytime the system engaged and disengaged. This became annoying after a while. The infinity pool and patio on the top floor are spectacular, though we didn't get to use the pool as it was quite cold. Had breakfast at the hotel once, and it was okay, though nothing to write home about. Internet access was included and reliable. The underground parking is overpriced (30 euros) and very, very tight but highly recommended, as theft is prevalent in Barcelona. The hotel did lack vibe at times - not a lot of activity in the evening at the bar. Service was also very slow and not always very knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: DanielMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Booked the B hotel based on the reviews and the fact that it has got the nice location and transparent bathroom. Was not disappointed at all. Very nice modern design inside. The bathroom definitely is the selling point of the hotel. I filled the entire tank and just laid there listen to the music while gazing out the glass panel to the floor-to-ceiling window to outside, the view was nice at night! (but not that much during the daytime, there was a constuction going no just next door, I suppose that the view will be comprimised when the building next door finished. Check in and out was fast, staff speak nice English and quick to help. Very nice location, just steps to subway. However, it is close to the main busy road, could get a little bit noisy if you are light sleeper, but the heavy curtain helps to block the sound and light. Didn't use the pool or breakfast. Internet was free and fast. Nightstand has this convenient lights control panel shuts off all lights with just one button to push. However, it also shut off the power outlet, which I used to recharge my laptop (bummer) Hotel exterior looks old and dirty due to the approximity to the roads and constuction. Rooms inside also starts to show the ages (some chips and scratches). In general, it's everything I needed: nice location, reasonable price, modern bathroom, quiet, free wi-fi and safe box in the room. Will definitely consider next time

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overhyped”
Reviews.Author: thetribeman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for four days in April and while the hotel was modern and clean there was too many bad points to make this an enjoyable stay. The good: 1. Clean hotel 2. Large rooms 3. Close to metro The bad: 1. The rooftop pool is an oversized bath 2. There is no good restaurants and bars close by and the metro does not run after 12 so it a long trek home after a night is over. 3. The hotel has no atmosphere The ugly 1. The staff are rude and unhelpful which leaves you with sour taste 2. The hotel is overpriced for a 3 star

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel for younger travelers”
Reviews.Author: boston_tripadviser
Reviews.Content: I came across the B Hotel listing while looking for a reasonably priced boutique hotel in Barcelona. Overall, it was a pleasant experience, with a few caveats. Positives: - Great rate - Hip place with nice bathrooms and a cool roof deck - Decent sized rooms - Friendly staff with excellent English skills (not always a given in Barcelona) - Strong free wifi connection - Convenient location right on the metro and major bus lines, including the airport bus - Very, very small balcony overlooking Plaza Espanya Negatives: - Very uncomfortable bed (two singles pushed together with a definite ledge in the center) - Location a good 25 minute walk from most tourist attractions. The metro is right there and will get you almost anywhere in a few minutes, but if you want to walk, it's a small hike. - Room pretty sparse--no clock, simple phone and small TV. - A lot of construction right next door from the hotel. While the room was pretty quiet, all you see is cranes and cement trucks. Again, overall, a pleasant stay (except for the bed). I would recommend it to young travelers who don't mind walking a bit to get to where they need to go. Lots of small cafes and food stores nearby. Business travelers might find the amenities a little lacking.

Reviews.Title: “fanatastic”
Reviews.Author: azizis
Reviews.Content: I went with my gorgeous girlfriend,to stay there in aug 2007. What a fantastic experience and i have to share it with you. Before i forget, please keep in mind that easyjet is the best airline to fly with to Barcelona (as opposed to ryan air) if only because of the airports. Easyjet flies direct to the city centre, whilst Reus and Gerona airports are an hour away. When arriving we were a bit bemused as it is next door to an old bullring which is being made into a shopping centre, so consequently it was like a building site, well actually not LIKE one, it WAS one!! The entrance into the hotel is most impressive,in a very trendy way. A massive sliding wooden door welcomes you, a bright clean entrance,with a relaxed fashionable seating area and bar. The reception staff were very friendly and presentable,and made us feel most welcome. The lift and corridors were very up to date and fresh. The design concept of the hotel is most unusual and very sleek. The bedroom was outstanding,using unique fabrics and materials to create a stunning look. The bathroom was exceptional, the bedroom lovely, with some nice touches including nice accessories, a well stocked mini bar, tv with sky channels. The view was of a shanty town looking scene, but who cares, the hotel was outstanding. On the third floor is the breakfast room. Breakfast is buffet style, with everything you can think of, all freshly made and well presented. On this floor are 2 pcs with free internet access. On the top floor is a rooftop pool and sunbathing area. Again the furnishings were outsatnding, drinks can be ordered from the reception. Piped music is played, whilst looking out over a busy part of Barcelona, and also a crane and builders knocked away at the building site. All very surreal, but an amazing experience. The hotel is situated on a busy tree lined avenue, with lots of benches to stop and chillout. The road is packed with banks,shops and coffee bars. It is about a mile and a half from the main area, but its a lovely walk to and from the hustle and bustle. We felt safe walking home in the early hours, and there are many coffee bars on the way. The hotel is also very close to a major attraction, the art museum, which is placed at the end of a tree lined avenue, up what seems like a million stairs (escalators available). Its fantastic. In the evenings, it is spectacular. There is a massive fountain, which changes colours and performs somersaults in time to classical music. Its an amazing site. Most people ive spoken to since, never knew of its existence. We only found it by chance, but believe me it was fantastic. Even if you dont stay at the B Hotel,and believe me, you should,make sure you visit this monument. In summary, my words can never convey ow amazing our stay was at the B Hotel. We like nice things, and we are quite hard to please (especially my girlfriend of course!!), but there was not one thing that we could criticise this hotel for. If i had to describe it in one word it would have to be STUNNING.

Reviews.Title: “Way more than a 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: Bridie27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. The rooms are lovely with huge beds and state of the art decor. The working of the lights can be a bit confusing as they worked by buttons but wouldnt be long getting used to them. The pool is on the roof and although small, its still lovely to go up and relax and sit beside. We went in Apr so it wasnt very hot but would be lovely to lie out in the Summer. The room was extremely clean on arrival and was cleaned every day with them even checking to see when suited us to have it cleaned. The staff were more than helpful and very friendly. Didnt actually eat in the hotel so didnt sample the food there but if the rest of the hotel is anything to go by, it would be lovely. Even though this is meant to be a 3 star I would class it more as a 5. I couldnt recommend this hotel highly enough. Would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A-stay at the B-Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tupacamar
Reviews.Content: Spent two lovely evenings at the B-hotel. Loved the modern decor of the room. We were upgraded to a huge room with a great bed and wonderful bathroom. Found the room to be quiet and the hotel staff to be very helpful. We did not try the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “'B' good value @ B Hotel”
Reviews.Author: princesspentium
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days/3 nights @ B Hotel - chosen on TT recommendations. Overall we were very impressed with the hotel. It is within easy reach of the airport, especially if you pick up the Aeroport bus (4.5 euros single) from outside the terminal. The bus stops in Placa Espanya and from there it is 5 mins walk to the hotel. You can identify it easily when you get off the bus as there is a huge 'B' on the top of the hotel. The design is very minimalist and modern, we asked for a quiet room at the back, although we were told all rooms were quiet due to double glazing but we didnt want to chance a room at the front as the road outside is very busy. Staff speak good english and were very helpful to us. We had a twin room , clean & spacious, with plenty of storage space for a short break. The bathroom is lovely but rather dark and it took us till the 3rd day of our stay to find the controls for the motorised blind when gives privacy to the shower/bath! Its on the wall next to the socket nr the sink if you want toknow what to look out for! Bed linen was good quality and 2 nice pillows were provided. Toiletries in bathroom, including, throw away toothbrush & razor with shaing cream, as well as other usual gles & potions. Buffet breakfast was 13 euros each which might sound expensive but we treated ourselves as it was our anniversary. This was served on 1st floor which doubled as business centre (2 pc's with printer - which was out of paper & ink when I wanted to use it to print out our checked in boarding passes!) Breakfast was very good, ranging from an assortment of juices, cereals, dried & fresh fruit, cold meats, cheeses, sausage, hardboiled eggs, tomatoes, cucumber etc Also hot food, scrambled eggs, fried potatoes, bacon and assorted tortillas. Plenty of different bread & rolls, croissants, including custard filled and chocolate ones. There was also a tart, apple/custard. Toast, jams, marmalades too if you were still hungry. Coffee and tea were brought to table by waiters. We filled up on breakfast so we only needed a snack lunch most days. There is a bar, for having a well earned drink, near to reception, which also serves tapas - if you're there at lunchtimes or early evenings. Placa Espanya Metro is located in the nearby square with at least 8 entrances. A single journey cost 1.30 euros, or a T-10 ticket with 10 journeys for 7.20 is better value, if you are travelling round the city. We found the Metro, clean, quick and efficient. very easy to navigate too. We used the Bus Touristic during the day, which stops in the square. It is a hop on/off bus which runs from 9am to 7pm. You buy the ticket on the bus. It costs 20 euros for 1 day or 26 euros for 2 days. We bought the 2 day tickets and found they were better than the Metro (which we only used for return journeys in the evenings when we went out to restaurants). It also saved our feet when we just wanted a rest and a ride round! There is a narrated description of the sites using free headphones in at least 8 languages! Just plug your phones in a choose your language. The bus has 3 routes, blue - north, red - south and green - east. The blue and red routes are the most useful, stopping at all the major sites. They run every 10 to 15 mins and there are changeover stops which cover blue/red routes. With your ticket you get a book of discount vouchers for the majority of the city sites - such as the Sagrada Familia, La Pedrera, Maritime Museum (excellent) Fundacion Joan Miro and many others. I booked restaurants for the 3 evenings we were there before I left the UK. I used www.toptable.co.uk a very useful site, which allows you to book restaurants by email in lots of cities around the world. Overall we would stay at the B Hotel again, a slight compromise in location but with public transport so good, this wasnt a problem and it was nice to have a quiet hotel to get a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, modern, very reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Respilosa
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the B-Hotel and was very pleased with my experience. The B-Hotel is a great value. Other people have said negative things about the location, but I disagree. In fact, the very competitive rate made the location fantastic, as far as I was concerned. It's not right around the corner from most of the tourist-y stuff, but getting anywhere from the B-Hotel is easy enough on foot, by taxi (cheap in Barcelona), bus, or Metro. Plus, I got to experience a small slice of "regular" Barcelona. I was a solo female and felt completely safe walking to and from the hotel at night. Airport transportation to and from the hotel is especially convenient. The room I was given was attractive and very spacious. The room decor was minimalist modern, but not cold. Very large floor-to-ceiling windows facing the Placa D'Espanya were great. I wouldn't have felt very comfortable staying in the room with a new lover because the bathroom was poorly insulated and opened directly onto the room. On the other hand, the toilet is separated from the rest of the bathroom by a sliding door, which is nice. That said, there was one thing that really annoyed me: the hotel plays bothersome music all night long in the hallways and the rooms aren't insulated well enough to block it out. It made me crazy. I live smack in the middle of a large city and am not at all a light sleeper, but had to resort to earplugs to deal with the music. They play it during the day as well but the steady hum of traffic outside renders it almost unnoticeable. At night, there is no traffic to drown it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Moutarde22
Reviews.Content: After staying 4 nights at the very nice Hostal Goya, we had to move because there was no room available for the rest of our stay in Barcelona. We were suppose to spend two nights at the B-Hotel but we end it up staying three nights because of a cancel flight. The room was great! Modern, spacious, as bright as you wanted to be. The staff was very courteous. The rooftop pool is spectacular. We didn't use it (it was March!), but I could just imagine myself finishing a nice day in the city on the side of this pool. There's better location for a hotel in Barcelona, but there's also a lot worst. The B-Hotel is situated just by plaza Espana, very close to the Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in relatively good location, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: staralliance1k
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a relatively convenient area with the metro being a minute away. We arrived late at night and were greeted by a rude man, Antonio Caballero. We firstly didn't get the room we asked for, returned to get it changed and were then given a room with no door between the main room and the bathroom. He took the problem with little care and told us that he couldn't anything about it. The same man checked us out and still possessed his arroganant attitude. We weren't even given a "thank you." However, other than this man, the hotel is stylish and modern with good access to sights.

Reviews.Title: “B= Best”
Reviews.Author: ChristianeM
Reviews.Content: I could not say enough about the service at this hotel! The reception went well out of their way to help me and made certain my stay was a very pleasant experience. The hotel is located right across from the Fiera (perfect for trade shows). In the adjacent square (Plaza Espana) you can board a tourist bus for 20 Euro which will take you all over Barcelona and you can hop on and off at leisure. You can also catch a direct bus to the airport for just 3.90 Euro. The room was very modern with clean, fresh lines. Both bedroom and bathroom were spacious and the lighting was fantastic! I found the hotel well suited for business travel with free internet access and a spacious desk and couch. I also used the meeting room facilities here and was quite pleased. The lobby bar is a fun scene and ideally suited to meeting friends and chatting. I would definitely return there again and would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect room, 10 out of 10 !”
Reviews.Author: Brazil 26 Couple
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Dec-07. Perfect location, 5 min walk from subway. Close to restaurants, bars & mini markets. Nice design hotel with confy room & excelent breakfast. Helpfull staff, free PC with internet downstairs. Great pick for business, honeymoon or general purpose. Perferct swimming pool for summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: the-boo-bears
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the B hotel between Christmas and New Year. When we arrived the very polite receptionist apologised that there would be a slight delay in checking in due to a large party arriving just ahead of us. She then arranged for a free drink to be brought to us in the bar, to apologise. The delay was no more than 15 minutes, and before we had finished our drink she came back with our key! The room was stunning, very modern and very clean. The space is nicely laid out and has lovely views of the The Arena and The Palace. I can not praise the staff or the hotel highly enough, both made our trip very comortable and relaxed. The only odd thing with the hotel is the lighting system, the combination of lights is a little baffling, and takes time to get used. The hotel is located very centrally and is very close to several bus stops and 2 main Metro lines so getting around is simple. It is even close to the Hop on Hop Off Bus stop, so it is perfect for tourists. The hotel is also reasonably priced, with our 3 night stay costing just over €300, which for the quality of the hotel and its location, was extremely reasonable. Overall I would just say that it is a great hotel, good value, pleasant and helpful staff, and it is in a great location. If you get a chance definately stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Way up the pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: bellmeister
Reviews.Content: Before you book this hotel, you need to ask yourself what you want. If you want a hotel that has lots of bars, restauraunts and shops within easy walking distance, then this is not the hotel for you. If however you want a hotel that is close to the metro and therefore easy to get anywhere is barcelona quickly then this could be for you. But way up the pros and cons. Pros: very close to espanya metro station (L1 and L3) modern and spacious rooms with great fitout in room safe front desk spoke english and were helpful supermarket 50 meters away free internet access in lobby great rooftop pool and terrace comfortable zip king beds BBC and sky news on LCD TV good water pressure in shower price - you should be able to get a package for under £100 per night Cons You can here and feel the trains go underneath the hotel. Its not loud but you can notice it. If you are a light sleeper it may not be for you. There is not much around the hotel apart from the supermarket, but you can walk to magic fountain, The Palau Nacional and montjuic park. It takes 25 minutes to walk from the ramblas or €10 in a cab. Quite a lot of ambulances went past with sirens blaring. The lighting system is complicated - i recommend you try and work it out as soon as you get there, dont wait till the middle of the light on your way to the bathroom as you may inadvertently start an in room disco. All in all its a good hotel if you can put up with a little bit of noise and you dont want to be in the heart of the action. But i wouldnt pay more than £100 or $200US per night. Next time I might try the gothic quater.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the weekend in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Arturas
Reviews.Content: Nice designed rooms, easy to get to the center and the airport makes this hotel a great place to stay! Had courtyard room and totally no noice!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: memoria-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Good hotel but not central.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: aber-fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 31st October 2007 to 4th November 2007. Overall, I would rate the hotel as being very good value for money. It is a modern hotel (opened 2005) with an interesting design. The rooms are quite large, with a large bathroom/WC area. Although I don’t necessarily expect this in a hotel, on our visit, we always found English-speaking staff present (though some staff were not English speaking). The bar/breakfast manager was English, and very helpful. Breakfast was a buffet, with a variety of foods available (ham, cheese, tortillas, bacon, bread, croissants, cereals, fruit, juice etc.). Snacks/light meals were also available during the day/evening. We chose this hotel because other travellers said it was quiet (despite being on a large thoroughfare). Our room at the back was indeed quiet for three nights, and we slept well on the king-size bed. On the fourth night, a Saturday, some locals held a party nearby – but this was hardly the hotel’s fault! Overall, the hotel was clean – bed linen, towels etc. I had one complaint here – our cleaner did not wipe the vertical surfaces in the bathroom, so that a stain on the side of the sink was not removed. A bit of staff training on cleaning surfaces would help. We didn’t use the small swimming pool on the roof (it was November!) but it was surprisingly sunny and warm for the time of year, so we enjoyed spending half an hour there in the mornings to plan our day. If travelling to or from the airport, unless you have a lot of bags it is worth taking the A1 Aerobus – this costs less than 4 Euros, and stops at/near the Placa d’ Espanya, just near the hotel. The journey time was around 15 minutes, off-peak. There is a very convenient metro stop at the Placa d’Espanya – three lines run through it, which get you to the downtown areas in 10 minutes or so. The T-10 (10 journey) tickets are good value. One word of advice – many of the automatic ticket barriers (but not all!) are ‘left-handed’ so you need to hold the ticket in your left hand and pass to the right of the barrier. I saw many tourists trying to walk through the barrier to the left of the ticket-checker, and being puzzled that they could not advance – we did this ourselves, at first! Sights near the hotel include the Montjuic area, with a cable car up to the Castle – excellent views on clear days. The ‘magic fountain’ is very near, as is the National Palace – a very large art gallery. In town, queues for Gaudi’s Sagrada Familia (cathedral) and ‘La Pedrera’ (town house) were very long – go early if you want to get inside these. It is easier to get in to the beautiful and highly original Casa Batllo, a short way down the road from La Pedrera. Another spectacular building is the Palau de la Música Catalana (concert hall) – well worth a visit, with drinks and tapas available in the foyer – try to catch a concert, if you want to see the upstairs areas. We didn’t come close to seeing everything worth visiting in 3 days – so we’ll be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish B Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juli3G
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at the B Hotel. Very impressed with the modern design. Staff were excellent when asked about local facilities ie shopping, bars and restaurants. Breakfast was the best continental buffet I have had anywhere. A good walk to main centre, but enjoyable. The best feature was the rooftop pool and terrace area. The second best was the design of the bathroom. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great design, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: chloeshiny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights on my first barcelona visit. It is one of the best designed hotel i have ever seen. Rooms,bathroom,terrace,bathroom amenities, everything was unique.Rooftop view was spectacular at night, however the swimming pool was way too small for a hotel with 80 rooms. Breakfast had a lot of choices, there were tapas, light food, cookies,pastries, all kinds of fruit juices and drinks. Plus, it was served till 11 oclock, which was good for late sleepers. Other than all the good things, hotel staff didnt really speak english, and the ones who spoke answered me back in Spanish. It is such a shame cos there were many american tourists at the hotel.Last day, i needed to use the so-called `business center` and it was a total dissapointment.First, the printer wasnt installed on the hotel computer so i had to bring my own laptop, and connect the printer.And then there were only a few sheets of paper in the printer and one side of them were already used,but they were turned back to the clean side,so when i tried to print a document, it was successfully printed on the used side of the papers. I am sure it is not so difficult for a hotel that charges the customers minimum 150Euros for a night to supply clean and unused papers and properly working computers for business center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: snowcrash
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the B-hotel in October of 2007 and had a great experience. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms were well designed and clean and spacious. Rooftop pool was great. I would definitely stay here again. It is located right on Placa Espanya and next to a metro stop. The breakfast was great and staff were efficient and friendly. For the price this is one of the best hotels in Barcelona. The hotel is a little noisy but this did not prevent me from sleeping well. The rooftop pool bar was not staffed, you must bring your own drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: bhhandel
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Barcelona with a friend, and we chose this hotel mainly because it looked very different from your average hotel, we liked the boutique-style, and we got a very good deal on it through the airline. Had read some negative comments about the location, but to be honest, I don't know what they're on about. The hotel is on Plaza Espanya, you can see the metro station from the entrance, and using that, you get anywhere within minutes. We usually went out to eat in the Passeig De Gracia area, and walking back from there was no problem, it took us about 20 minutes, just following the Gran Via. The hotel decor is really something else, they've really made it look like something a lot more expensive than it really is. the bathrooms are quite something, we actually had to phone reception and get instructions on the shower taps. There were a few minor things like some scratches in the flooring and a couple of loose threads on the bedspread, but all in all the room was spacious, comfortable, well-presented and CLEAN. The overall feel of the hotel is that they do try to make an extra effort, for instance the toilets in the public areas all have real towels instead of paper tissues, and free internet access is provided. The rooftop pool is also quite something. The breakfast is not at all bad, but included more sweet pastries and cakes than "real" food, so most days we just had food from nearby cafes, or from the supermarket practically next door. We stayed for a week, and I'd be happy to go back at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about the roof-top pool...;)”
Reviews.Author: TheOracle
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the B-Hotel with my girlfriend for a few romantic days away with each other. When we arrived at the hotel, we were not dissapointed. It is however important to note that this is not a full services hotel, for example, it has a bar by the rooftop pool but no barman behind it, there is a bar in the main lobby but it shuts at 10:00 in the evening & there is a room to take breakfast in should you so desire...but no restaurant to talk of that will serve dinner etc... For us, that was not a problem becuase if you in Barcelona, quite frankly, you are there to explore the streets anf find bars and restaurants either recommended to you or that you have researched already. This hotel is a design hotel first and foremost so what you will see everywhere are touches of minimalism and bespoke design pieces matched with your trademark design hotel mood lighting. Check-in was efficient and we were racing up to our room in no time at all. At this juncture I feel it necessary to point out that there are two categories of room. The first is your standard room which encompasses a king, queen or two twins together bed (important to specify upon booking) with a modern bath/shower, fun/complicated mood lighting, 20" LCD television with limited channels and floor to ceiling windows spanning the width of the room with a half metre deep balcony in front. When booking, specify that you would like a room facing the Plaza Espana as the room are very well sound insulated with aircon so worrying about leaving the balcony door open is not an issue and you can wake up to a marvellous yet buzzing view. The second category of room is on the corner of the building and is substantially larger with a 32" LCD television. My best advice to you is stick with the standard room and specify a high floor with a view of Plaza Espana as you cannot go wrong!!! The roof-top pool is a novelty for a three star hotel and is very attractive with enough loungers to keep you comfortable and some easy chairs and wicker sofas with tables for drinks the you may have. Dont expect to maintain your fitness regime while in the pool here as it is only small but is very refreshing (especially in March) and is wonderful after a hot day exploring Barcelona. We were happy with our room and the service we recieved and having researched many other hotels, I can assure you that you will be hard pressed to find better for the price and location. If you want the five star experience you will find 90% of the time that in a standard room you will be put in an interior facing room next to the aircon generator which is no fun. Here that is not a problem, of course you must remember that they are a 3 star hotel and not to expect the concierge to pull out rservations at "el bulli" (Restaurants Number 1 in the world) at a last minutes notice. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here and am always irritated by the people that moan about the inpracticalities of the mood lighting, bathrooms and other aspects. You are staying in a design hotel so expect that sometimes the designer will have chosen aesthetics over ergonomics!!! If you require any further info please contact me and I will be happy to divulge and please see the photos that I have enclosed with this review. Thankyou ;)

Reviews.Title: “A place really worth staying!”
Reviews.Author: ereme
Reviews.Content: I have already stayed in this hotel a couple of times and also tried different hotels of the same category in Barcelona. This time I spent five nights and I must admit this is obvioulsy the best choice for a very decent cost. Rooms are clean and spacious, rather innovative in their design (with a rather sophisticated lightening system), staff is friendly, the roof with its tinny pool is a nice place to hang around, even despite the rehabilitation of the arenas facing the hotel. I would like to see the bar improved (it is not very cosy) and maybe a small restaurant would also be a good idea!

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderfull...just B-Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MariaCoimbra
Reviews.Content: First the pool, on the roof, so simple hugging Plaza de España and us…so strong image and so relaxing…the sound of city traffic and the b-hotel music choise…so amainzing and so calm… Next the room again a happy view! The colours, the furniture, the smell, the bed and the bath! Just two nights and three days so intensive as Barcelona! So much fellings together that make you thinking that this was the perfect choise… the perfect place…the perfect view…the pefect city. To good to b forgotten… Maria Morais Coimbra Portugal (we stayed on 31 Augst, 1 and 2 Sept)

Reviews.Title: “Cool Barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: ljrslp
Reviews.Content: B Hotel in Barcelona is a very cool place to stay. The rooms are very clean and modern as is the rest of the space. The roof top pool lounge was neat, and the hotel is right next to Placa Espanya, a major transport station, as well as the magic fountain light show at the base of Montjuic. We were there the end of August 2007 adn we had a great time. The hotel staff was very accomodating and helpful and the room service was very reasonably priced so that the night we flew in from NY we stayed in and ordered rom service even t hough we wouldn't normally do that. Only cons are that there is not much else of interest in the immediate area and there is no restaurant in the hotel - they do have breakfast daily but we were never up early enough for it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice 'different' hotel in Barcelona !”
Reviews.Author: voetballerke28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of nights in June and as we wanted something different (and a pool was important for us) we choose B-hotel at a very reasonable rate (90€ per room per night), knowing that hotels in Barcelona are often over-priced in the high season and that you can only get a shabby pension for 60-70€ per night it's worth it paying the extra for far better quality. The rooms were nice, spacious, very contemporary with lcd tv, 'open' bathroom and domotica. Very well cleaned and with a nice atmosphere to them. Friendly reception staff. The pool (with panoramic views) was a big bonus to cool down after hours of sightseeing. I can recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “excellent but we moved on !”
Reviews.Author: JessieDublin
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews and photos we booked the hotel for 3 nights beginning August. We were thrilled that the airport bus dropped us almost to the door and were very impressed with the minimalist decor of the foyer. Hung about the pool until room was ready. The terrace, pool area is slickly designed and in desperate need of greenery! Our room was lovely with comfy beds and kooky lighting, Nothing to complain about so whaddya do but pick holes!!!!! Check out the open shelves for wardrobes which WRECK the minimalist vibe! Spend three days trying to figure out how the lighting, shower blinds work. Marvel at the mis-positioning of the loo roll holders (one bad aim and the rolls get saturated!!) The lemon scented soap is to die for! So why did we pack our bags and move on to another hotel? We like to ramble and it is just too far to walk into the centre of town. We felt that although the hotel was super efficient and clean, it lacked soul, atmosphere. The reception areas are not welcoming and we never saw a soul sitting in the large empty spaces. I think the hotel is very good; perhaps a little clinical; maybe suitable for the business traveller who is less interested in soaking up a bit of atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at B-hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah-j-knight
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 3 night stay in Barcelona and the city is fantastic but staying at this hotel made it even more memorable. It is only about a 20 minute taxi ride from the hotel (which cost around 20 euro) we were greeted by very helpful and polite staff. First reactions to the room...very modern, very clean and the views were brilliant. The definite highlight to this hotel is the terrace, luckily the weather was great and swimming on a roof whilst looking out over Barcelona was unbeatable. A perfect place to relax after a day walking around in the heat. We also had tapas in the hotel which was very nice and once again the staff were very helpful with translating some of the menu. The location is great, a metro station just over the road by the huge fountain on the Placa Espanya, there is also a tourist bus pick up too so everything is easily accessible. An added bonus was when we visited the casino, they asked us where we were staying and we got free entrance when we mentioned this hotel. What we saved of course went straight on the roulette wheel! I found this hotel great value for money and we will definitely be returning to this hotel when we go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: JLLondon
Reviews.Content: The good reviews of this hotel are completely justified. The location is excellent (10 mins walk from Las Ramblas and right next to Espanya metro stop), the roof top pool is a treat and the rooms are modern and very comfortable. The only thing I would say is that it is probably best to request a room at the back as the front is on a busy main road. That said, I dont think it's possible (or desirable) to find a hotel in Barcelona away from the hustle and bustle of the city- that's the fun of it! I loved Barcelona and this hotel made my trip even better- excellent value for money too!

Reviews.Title: “Great minimalist place, maximum experience (by Manuela and her mom)”
Reviews.Author: Notfarfromyou
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my mother and our stay was flawless. Very comfortable, friendly staff, great spacious bedrooms and wonderful pool environment. The location was spot on, as plaza Spanya is a couple of minutes away and it's close to one of the most dynamic commercial streets of Barcelona and the airport bus. Great value for a modern, no hassle environment. Best of all was the options for breakfast where there is consideration for diabetics and health-minded people. During our stay we noticed that the hotel was family friendly, gay friendly and also very appropriate for women travelers. If you are looking for a minimalist, high quality, design hotel a bit off reach from la Rambla craziness, then this is the place to be. A couple of minus: 1) the constructions around the hotel really takes away the feeling of convenience and sphere of the hotel environment. I'm sure when the construction is over, the hotel will be more visible. 2) The hotel bar should offer fancy cocktails and the cardio-fitness facilities (in project) should be offered very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Minibreak”
Reviews.Author: whlsarah
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for a few days in May Half term and we were very very happy with our whole trip. The hotel itself is easy to get to- just a short taxi ride from the airport. The hotel has all the facilities you would expect and is very stylish for the price. The bed was extremely comfortable and once we had sorted out the temperature using the air conditioning we both had a great nights sleep. The bathroom was larger than we expected with both a bath and shower. There was plenty of hot water. I would agree with previous reviews that perhaps breakfast isn't the best value option here, but the atmosphere is great and there are plenty of different options. The hotel is just minutes from the Metro- very cheap and easy to use. Also close to Montjuic and the sights there. We walkd to the botanical garden then got a cable var to the beach. Beware the queues for the open top bus though- we bought tickets from the booth then when we got to the bus stop we found a long queue and had to wait for the third bus before we could get on. Overall a fantstic break- don't miss our favourite highlights: Park guell, the beach, Nou Camp, Architecture, tapas, sangria and pleanty of sunshine!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarryBadger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my significant other and we had a great time. The bed was huge, and very comfy. The room was clean and modern. We had fun trying to understand the lights as they are a touch random but overall it was very pleasent. Staff were friendly and helpful and spoke very good english, and the barman gave us the biggest single shots of jack daniels imaginable! The pool on the roof was a treat as well, although a bit cold when we were there! Great location, close to the transport links. I would advise getting a pass to use the trains, but i would also advise just walking around as its a beautiful city! Definitely recommended

Reviews.Title: “A really good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LeanneOxon
Reviews.Content: My husband and i are just back from the b Hotel,barcelona, we stayed for 3 night and had a really fantastic time The majority of the reviews written on this hotel i agree with but there are a few that i feel are totally unfair and hence this review The location of the hotel is very good you are within easy reach of all the major attractions either by a leisurely walk or by the metro (the stop is just opposite the hotel) there are various cafes etc along the way to stop for a refreshment if needed ! The noise we didn't find a problem YES there is a very busy road just outside but what do people expect you are in the middle of a city! and the double glazing is very good, i suppose it is what you are used to! we found the staff very friendly and helpful. we arrived at around 11am to be told that a double room wasn't yet ready but if we wanted to wait till around 1pm then a double room would be available (bearing in mind most hotels in britain don't allow you to check in till 2 or 3pm) the receptionist took our case and sure enough when we returned at around 12.30 our Double room was ready! Overall i would recommend this hotel if you like modern deisgn for a reasonable price in a good location !

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaSims
Reviews.Content: B-Hotel was decent .. Ok location, easy to find, and easy to tell a cab driver where it was. It was hip without being painful. Loved the room, and the service, while still Spanish, was better than other hotels I've stayed at in Barcelona. (maybe because the girl I delt with the most was German.) Did it make my trip special ... no, Outside the room itself, a Chic'er copy of the Hilton in Athens, ... the so so attitude of the staff really kept you on edge as to what you might have to deal with if you really needed them ... Lucky for us I didnt. This being my 8th trip to Barcelona all I needed was a place to lay my head ... The room more than delivered there. Everything worked and did it in a modernist .. cool . way ... So maybe not the best hotel for first timers, or shoppers .. but good if you love the city ... like design, and know what you are doing in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fun design - comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TandemWorld
Reviews.Content: It's pretty hard to go wrong with the B Hotel. The location puts you just a few Metro stops away from the center of the action (which is a good distance to be!). More interestingly, the hotel offers a truly unique design perspective. We uncovered a number of refreshingly unusual elements during our short stay. Worth checking out and booking if you've found a rate that works for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Chee+Bashu
Reviews.Content: It's 3 star hotel but inside is really like 5 star, very good price and if you don't mind not staying middle of the city. This is the place to stay. It takes 30-40 min to centre of the city or 5 -10 min metro ride. My husband & I love walking around the city so it was very nice wondering around towards the city centre. Hotel staff can be little more helpful but wasn't bad at all. Room is amazing and spotless clean, very contemporary, walking distance to Barcelona Contemporary Museum and it's worth visit if you like Contemporary Art.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic pool!”
Reviews.Author: travitin
Reviews.Content: I loved the B Hotel predominantly for the pool area! I stayed here end May/beginning June 2006 and the pool was a great place to relax after a hard 1/2 day of sightseeing! The location is a bit out of the action and we always took the metro to get into the centre of town. There is not much around the hotel so we had breakfast at the hotel (a fairly standard, hotel-price, continental style). The rooms are good and very spacious but some of the room interiors and communal hallways are little scruffy. The room cleaning was also a hit and miss. It's a great price for the facilities but a little out of town for me as I prefer to avoid public transport when on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the B Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moondahgi
Reviews.Content: The B Hotel was an exceptional hotel for the price. I have OCD and am Germ-a-phobic and would NEVER stay in a place that wasn't A+. I read other tripadviser reviews and absolutely agree that this is a FANTASTIC hotel. Great location to the underground that takes you all over the city and to the airport. The room was HUGE (especially as we had just come from London where our hotel room was the size of a closet). There was a flat screen t.v. with internet access (cheap) inside of the room. We had a large sunken bathtub and a large, modern shower. We danced around the room to Spanish music before catching the underground metro to the beach (p.s. eat at Nirvana and sip green tea while watching the sunset (my 6 year old son play ing on the beach among the topless american college girls was interesting). The staff was fantastic and super-helpful at B-Hotel and the only thing that might upset super-sensitive people is that if you have a room closer to the old bull fighting ring...then you might feel the underground...we didn't..but the cleanliness FAR surpasses the inconvenience of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated but satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: prahaman
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I like modern design hotels and I need wifi access. This one had good ratings on this website. But apart from the design, the amenities, and the reasonable price, I would have preferred to stay closer to the center. I'm only giving it a 4 rather than 3 because the wifi really worked in the rooms and it often doesn't. the hotel has a nice big bed, even for a single, a deluxe bathroom with bath tub, and an incomprehensible hi-tech lighting system that works to satisfaction after you have pushed all the buttons a few times, using all possible combinations, on the three sets of controls scattered around the room. but I found myself asking why i didn't like this hotel better. I decided that the brown and grey color scheme wasn't too cheerful and everything combined made the hotel feel to sterile. Also, the location sucks for tourists. It is close to a metro but not within an easy walk to any noteworthy tourist destination, restaurants or nightlife. It is at least a 40 minute walk to place de catalunya and nothing that interesting along the way. 20 minutes will get you to Eixample. After the metro closes you have to count on 7euros cabfare to go pretty much anywhere in the center. Many people complain about the breakfast, but hotel breakfasts are one of my pet peeves. I don't want to pay 12€ for something i could get for 4€ by walking 2 minutes down the street, so i always ask if it is continental breakfast, buffet, or omelettes, etc. The front desk manager said you can choose. But when actually went down to the breakfast the next morning, i just saw a big spread of cold cuts, lots of nice croissants, rolls, bread, etc and a big selection of drinks, yougurt and cereal including a diet breakfast section. So I asked the waitress if there were omelettes and she said "scrambled or omelette"? So that was quite alright -- but you have to ask in spanish, they don't speak english!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: boricuajetsetter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the B-Hotel for 3 nights and the rooms were great for the price (95 EUR). The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was really nice and the bath products were very nice. The rooms are decorated very nicely also. The staff was very friendly and nice. I left my cell phone in the taxi and the front desk helped me contact the taxi companies. The location is great because you can walk though the Gran Via, Plaza Espana is literally next to the hotel and it's a great site to see at night. There is also a metro next to the hotel and bus stops. I recommend the bus because you get to see more of the city. I also recomend the breakfast at the hotel. For 12 Euros is not bad. A nice selection of fruit, cereals, cheese, ect. Also great selection of juices, coffee, ect. And for us Americans, we always appreciate free refills in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jones143
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive feedback that has already been written. A very funky hotel which is very well situated. There is initially lots of fun playing with the light switch and trying to find out how everything works. The Bathroom isn't a problem, as long as you find the switch for the blinds. Th only complaint is that the breakfast was a bit over ppriced for what it was, a very nice breakfast but not worth 12 euros, especially when spain is so cheap in general (compared to the UK anyway). The beds are very comfy and we had no problem with noise at all. Overall a very good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not thrilled”
Reviews.Author: HelenaAthens
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 11-nights stay at B. The pros: - Tastefully decorated - Spacious, spotless and comfortable rooms - The bed was absolutely great!! - The location: a minute walk from Placa Espanya and the metro station, and less than 15min. to Montjuic-but 30 min walk to the Placa Catalunya and the centre... The cons: - The noise from the street and the building site that is right in front of the hotel entrance. It was impossible to sleep after 08.30 am. - The breakfast buffet: way overpriced for the quantity and quality. And beware: be sure to go to the breakfast room in time, because at 11:00 sharp the hotel staff will remove everything from the buffet quicker than you can say "b". - The staff: some of them were ok, but most of them seemed almost annoyed to see us... -And a personal experience: at check out, i noticed that we had been charged for the stay more than the price of the booking. It was quickly corrected, but... - The lights were a problem for us, too, but we maneged to overcome it (we did spend 11 nights at the hotel, after all) Overall i would say it was ok, but if i were to go back to Barcelona (which is an amazing place to be, by the way), i would look again. The variety of medium priced design hotels is large in Barcelona, and i am sure there are better choices,

Reviews.Title: “100+ positive reviews can't be wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Cambridge_Student
Reviews.Content: B-Hotel has been (almost) unanimously highly acclaimed by most reviewers. Should that give the reader enough comfort? I am tempted to say yes, and you can count me among those guests who really enjoyed their stay at the B. We were there from 28/12 to 1/1. Price was ok for the category, except for New Year’s Eve, which was a whooping 85% above the hotel’s low-season rate. Everything positive and negative has already been written by others. I can only add a little: - Location: scary at first sight, because it overlooks a massive traffic roundabout (España) which dwarfs the Étoile in Paris and the nearby Arenas which are being rebuilt, the rooms are well insulated acoustically, and we got a good night’s rest without earplugs. But don’t expect a quiet environment after 9am. And yes, you can hear the slamming of neighbouring doors and the chatter in the corridors. - Connections: two minutes walk to the Aerobus stop; one minute walk to the metro, which takes you to the bustling Rambla in less than 10mins without changing lines; Montjuic is in walking distance; I really don’t understand people who complain. - Facilities: free Internet perfect to check local info; pool was closed (fancy a swim on 31/12?); lobby stylishly cold; breakfast ok but overpriced for the quality (€12), which might compel you to overfeed to break even. - Rooms: like so many before, I didn’t manage to grasp the functioning of the lighting system, but it was fun to try, for a short while! Lesson to be learned: don’t install fancy equipment in your own home. The bed cover looked, in some places, as if it had suffered a close encounter with a cat's claws, but the mattress and the pillows were soft as foam cream. A delight. - Bathroom: the glass cubicle is really not an issue, since you can “close” it with shades, once you have found the switch! Part of the game, I guess. The sliding door to the loo (which is enclosed in the bathroom) was missing in our room! If privacy/intimacy is an issue for the room occupants, the bathroom is sub-par. Shame, because the design is very nice and pluming of superior quality. - Staff: very positive experience. On arrival, we were given a twin, which I didn’t like. Changing rooms was dealt with swiftly. Overall, despite a pricey tag (conditioned by the season) and some minor minuses, I warmly recommend the B-Hotel for a young and/or design conscious clientele with a mid-range budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigapplered
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 night stay at the B-Hotel after returning to Barcelona following a cruise in the Med. Check in was easy and the staff all spoke perfect English. We had to drop off our bags as we arrived early (around 10am) and our room wasn't ready, so we did a little sightseeing and came back later in the afternoon. We had a room overlooking Gran Via on the executive floor. It is a very modern and stylish hotel, similar in style to a W hotel, but very affordable. The bed was comfortable and the room was nicely furnished. As others have said, the lights take a little getting used to, but it was fine once you figured out the system. The roof deck is very nice, although it was a little cold for swimming when we were there. They were actually having a photo shoot when we were up there for a fashion magazine. It's a great location at Plaza de Espanya with easy access to the metro as well as the Airport Bus. A great deal for a great hotel in a great city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fi_82
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights in October. As soon as we arrived we loved it - it is very stylish and is immediately different from your average tourist hotel. The staff were very helpful and welcoming adding to the good first impression. The room was great - lots of space, a huge bed, plus a sofa. We liked the glass box bathroom and all the funky lighting settings. Only downside of the room was the shower which flooded the whole bathroom on several occasions! Unfortunately the weather wasn't great when we were there so we couldn't make full use of the roof terrace but I imagine its great when the sun is shining. It is right on a busy road so the views are exactly picturesque but its impressive nonetheless. I would definitely recommend the B-hotel for a relaxed, stylish city break.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend w/o reservation”
Reviews.Author: a9zn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at 2 other hotels in Barcelona prior to the B-Hotel, then stayed here for 4 nights. As for me, paying a little more to get much more space & comfort is well worth it. Definitely noticed the vibration from the metro, even in my room 514, which faces the backyard. Although the hotel claims all rooms are sound proof, you can still hear your neighbors' door slamming or chatting next door. The number of restaurants in the neighborhood is rather weak, so I usually go eat near La Rambla, which is only a few metro stops away. In addition to the computer w/ Internet access in the lobby, there's another one on the 1st floor, which allows you to print your itinerary or flight check in confirmations. The buttons for lighting in the room aren't terribly intuitive, would appreciate some kind of instruction. Pool is being repaired as of now. Gym is done but doesn't have a permit yet. However, the gym 'Dir' is only 10-min away, pass the Taragona station. Peak hour admission is 12 Euros; offpeak is around 8.5 All in all, this is by far the best experience of my 2-wk stay in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectation”
Reviews.Author: Design_Addict
Reviews.Content: I stayed at B Hotel for 3 days. I wanted to stay on design hotel, I had many choices, but I decided to stay in this hotel for the value they offered the moment I visited Barcelona. LOCATION PRO: This hotel located near Placa d' Espana (about 3 min walking), Montjuic area (the Olympic area), which is nice. The city itself is really worth the visit. The Metro station is near, the tourist info is also so close, the official tourist bus terminal is also on that location. Next to the hotel, I think they are building a matador arena. There are two OpenCor (grocery) nearby that open 24hr. CON: Being so close to the Metro station, you can feel the Metro running under you, even when you are at the 4th floor (this is where I was staying). Also, the area is not a very lively area (unlike Placa Cataluna). Everything is pretty much close, even restaurants are only open on a specific time (8pm -11pm). Even the hotel doesn't serve anything past 11pm. So, it's a bit hard to find food, although I did have a chance to dine at a very nice restaurant for a nice Paella nearby the area (ask the receptionist for advise). Another thing to consider, there is only 1 Money Exchange at the nearby hotel, so prepare to change your money first, since this hotel only accept euros. HOTEL & ROOM PRO: GREAT. Let me say it again GREAT design. It was spacious. The details are pleasently considered. You get the feel of modern art, and modern technology. The light switchs are hi-tech with stainless steel. They use a lot stainless steel in their design style, that makes this hotel a contemporary minimalis. I was awed with all the details they put in the design of the hotel. Even the bathroom blind uses switch to open and close. The placement of the lighting are perfect, gives you a soft, relaxing, and comfort environment. The Hotel itself has some unique nice smell. I got a room with a nice view, overlooking the Gran Via and Placa d'Espana from the little terrace in the room. The top floor supposed to have a terrace with a really nice view of the area, unfortunately it was closed for renovation when I stayed there. Overall impression of the room...WOW! CON: not much, just u can feel the vibration of the Metro going underground and the bathroom is not totally covered, they are only separated by a glass and there is a blind which you can close. And the side, there is a semi transparant green glass that separated the bathroom and the aisle. It was okay, just don't feel like there was total privacy when you take a bath. If you are couples this will be perfect. ;) SERVICE It was okay. Well, more than enough, the staffs were really nice and friendly. They were very helpful, and they speak English fluently. The only drawback was that I had to carry my bag myself as there was nobody from the staff offered to carry my bag to my room nor when I checked out. Other than that, it's good service. They are really good at advising their guest to get around Barcelona. VALUE I booked this hotel for €100/night include breakfast AND a welcome cava. THIS IS AMAZING, consider the kind of place you are staying and what you get by staying here. Can't get any better. OVERALL CONCLUSION I really recommend this hotel to anyone who visit Barcelona. I myself for my next visit might want to stay somewhere closer to the Placa Cataluna (They have sister hotels like Jazz and Soho), depend on the promotion they will be having.

Reviews.Title: “Oh so sexy!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Minka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in July, and we loved it so much we didn't want to leave! If a great sense of style and design for an affordable price is what you like, then I would definitely recommend this Hotel It was only a 15 euro taxi ride from the airport, and situated overlooking the magnificent Plaza Espana, which is just a couple of metro stops from the bustling tourist centre of La Rambla. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, and the reception area was simple and chic. The rooms are amazing in design - spacious with a beautiful colour scheme, with the bathroom glassed off with an electronic blind that allows you to bathe while overlooking your room (or someone in the room overlooking you!) I was a little concerned about the idea of 2 single beds making up a double, but it is done in such a way that the only thing you notice is how HUGE the bed ends up being - which my husband loved! The pool area, while not being huge, was still large enough to enjoy hot summers afternoon's lazing around sunbathing, reading, and ordering up bottles of white wine. All in all, a definite find! Would love to go back next summer!

Reviews.Title: “The B captures the style of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Gloucs
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, spacious room (superior room) and a good hotel for the price. Receptionists were excellent, being both friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very varied and well laid out, with service good. It's a pity there is no restaurant in the hotel of an evening and few in this district ( Plaza Espanya) to choose from, although a small selection of Tapas bars nearby. Need to walk into the centre about 20mts or ten on the Metro. (Excellent transport facilities in Barcelona , efficient, safe and clean.) The arena building (old Bullring) next door, once finished, could improve facilities in this area however. It seemed a safe area to walk around at night and out of the bustle of the Ramblas, so location has its pros and cons but hotel itself was very good value. I would say the B hotel reflects the style of Barcelona quite well !

Reviews.Title: “Wonder Stay at B Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LanaP
Reviews.Content: This hotel will not dissapoint. My friend and I had a wonderful experience at B. The hotel is boutique modern style. The staff was very friendly and helpful with absolutely every request we made. I'm a stickler for cleanliness and the hotel and rooms were kept spotless. The beds are incredibly comfortable, it was like sleeping on a cloud. They have internet service in two locations which was very convenient and also provide lovely gels, soaps, toothbrushes, etc.. in the rooms. The Bathrooms are very funky with an overall spa-like atmosphere. We stayed there in June and at that time they were just starting to build a mall directly across the street. We were concerned about noise but never heard a thing. The breakfast which costs about 12 euros was well worth it. They offer a very wide selection from fresh fruits and juices to meats and cheeses to cereals and yogurts and breads. Great way to start the morning! I highly recommend this hotel. My only complaint (which is not a big deal) is the lighting. It's very dim, and for women, it was hard at times to style hair and put on makeup.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: Innocent_Criminal
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed at the B-Hotel for 4 nights and i have to say the hotel did not disappoint at all. For a 3 star hotel in a central location of a major and trendy European city we got our money's worth and then some. The location is not too touristy but that’s fine because of the proximity of the metro which is only few stops from the touristy center. And the connection to the airport via the Aerobus is easy, quick and cheap. The hotel's design is very modern and definitely not cheap looking. Sure it lacks the final finish but this is not a 5 star hotel. It has some cool gimmicks that you would never find in a hotel within the price range in Paris, London, and Amsterdam etc. Such as the automatic lights in the hall or the LEDs in the elevator. Not to mention the very cool pool on the top floor, room & bathroom design, LCD TV etc. The only drawbacks are views of the rooms, which are non-existent, the very late check-in (15:00) and the breakfast is definitely not worth the money. While the staff is not top-notch we did not have any problems with them. And the free Internet on the bottom and 1st floor is a major plus. As long as the B-Hotel keep their prices (I paid €130 for a double through easyhotels.com) then I would definitely come back again. It was a real pleasure for a romantic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: jeznfu
Reviews.Content: SERVICE We found it really good, however when we were there one of the guests had an argument with one of the staff about a misbooking. All staff speak very good English and are friendly and helpful. COST I found it less expensive to book directly with the hotel. I think it was a pretty reasonable price at 130 euros per night for my wife and myself. Don't forget that you get charged an extra 7% tax on top of the room rate. CLEANLINESS Excellent throughout. It was spotless, although there was a slight smell of cigarette smoke in our room which was hardly noticeable. LOCATION / TRAVEL As the other reviewers have said the hotel location is at placa espanya. Easy to get to from the airport. Costs about 25 euros by taxi or about 4 euros by aerobus. The metro (underground / tube) is about 3 minutes walk away, just the other side of the old bull ring (the conversion from a bull ring to a shopping centre has been designed by a UK architect who also designed Madrid airport...). The tourist bus goes from just the other side of the roundabout which is about 3 minutes walk away. Get an all inclusive ticket from one of the official tourist stalls before you leave the airport. They cover travel by aerobus, metro, tourist bus and give discounts for entry to attractions. The hotel is next to a main road and construction is still going on at the bull ring so opt for an upper room. Make sure you get to see the fountain display just across the road which starts around 7pm - ask at reception. FOOD AND DRINK There is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Bummer. However there is a supermarket just down the street where you can get bits and bobs. The hotel offers breakfast at 12 euros, but no lunch or dinner. They have a pretty funky bar as well, but we didn't drink there. Try the maoz bars ([--]) for lunch as they are really tasty and keep you going at 4 euros a shot. FACILITIES There are eight floors to the hotel. If you can, stay on floor seven as they have larger rooms and are really comfortable. Floor eight is the pool area which is great! You can see around the placa from there. If you smoke try to stop, but failing that there is a balcony to each room where you can go to feed your desire. If you do, I hope you don't suffer from vertigo as the balcony is about 18 inches wide with a glass side. The rooms have flat screen TVs, but why would you want to watch TV in Barcelona? They also have mini bars and a fridge. The bathrooms are very "X-Men - magneto" like in their tiling but very well done. The shower sprays water over the back of the bath so watch out for that. We would stay there again, and I think we probably will.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Change”
