Reviews.Author: Tonksy
Reviews.Content: We chose the B-Hotel on the basis of the reviews in TripAdvisor - well done fellow travellers! The Hotel is modern and clean - and whilst we had trouble finding the front door (sliding wooden panel amongst all the glass) and struggled a bit with the lights in the room (too many possible combinations) - we would definately stay again. The location was great - and even being right by a building site (They are turning the old bullring into a shopping /entertainment centre) and the Placa Espanya it wasn't noisy. We had a great corner room lots of space and a huge bed. The shower got water everywhere - but once I remembered it wouldn't be me mopping it up it was cool! The rooftop pool / relax area was fantastic for a sunset beer and snack Tea and Coffee in the room and the bar opening after 11pm would have given it an excellent score. We didn't do breakfast in the hotel (12 Euros each was a bit steep) but went along the Grand Via towards the centre - two blocks down for a great coffee, juice and fresh croissant. The food / beer / service at the Suarna Restaurant - cross over the Grand Via and head for the blue lights - was great too and full of locals which is always a good sign. We bought the Barcelona Bus Tour (not Bus Turistic) and the Barcelona Card via Expedia at the same tome as paying for the hotel - good move. The vouchers can be redeemed in the airport info desk and a new bus route (no 46) goes from terminal B of the airport to the Placa Espanya and is included in the Barcelona Card which also gives you loads of money off offers and free stuff. The Barcelona Bus goes from Placa Espanya and the voucher can be redeemed on board - there are less buses than the Bus Turistic - but the route is simpler and has less people on board as a result!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for £60 a night”
Reviews.Author: PG77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in June with my girlfriend, B-hotel was easy to get to from the Saints Rail station, either on the metro (stop is 100 metres away from the front door) or 5 minutes in a taxi (taxi rank is just as close). The hotel is quite far from the main tourist drag but that's no bad thing, 10 minutes on the metro and you're right in the main city centre The other reviewers are right, the decor and presentation of the hotel are way above what I would expect for the price. It sounded a bit too good to be true but I trsuted the reviews on here and was not disappointed! The rooms are clean, big enough for a city hotel and very modern, the light switches are a bit confusing, but by no means detract from the overall experience. The bathroom with the electric shutters was a nice touch, there's even a phone in the toilet, though quite why I'm not too sure! The rooftop pool is a real treat, we arrived on a Monday afternoon and it was deserted, a quick call downstairs to room service and ice cold beers and snacks were on the way up, perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel - Convenient, quiet location; friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: PetorianCitizen
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at B-Hotel in late September and thouroughly enjoyed it. Easy to get to from the airport - when the airport bus stops at Plaza Espana, B-Hotel's checkered facade catches the eye immediately. We arrived on a mid-afternoon flight, so I was concerned when we were told that our room wasn't ready. As it turned out, I needn't have worried - the reason for the delay was that the very pleasant staff were upgrading us to a superior room. Room 203 was spacious and clean. The layout and decor may not be to everyone's taste, but we loved it. The glass bathroom definately makes sharing a room at B-Hotel an "intimate" experience. The shower was great, and there were some ok bath products (though be sure to bring your own toothpaste - the hotel's mini tube is not what I'd call minty fresh). The lighting's a bit tricky at first, but manageable. The LCD TV is a bonus, witha couple of English language news channels. We didn't eat at the hotel. Ramlas and the old town are just 10 minutes away on Barcelona's excellent metro, with a station (Espana) just 5 minutes away from the hotel. The short hop to one of the cafes (try Croisanterie del Pi) for coffee and pastries was a pleasure. Overall, we loved B-Hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: jennn721
Reviews.Content: Overall, we really enjoyed B-hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was fairly spacious, and it was in a great location. I had been worried about noise from the street and construction as I am a light sleeper, but we were on the 7th floor (the top floor) and I never had any problem. The lights were a bit confusing but we eventually figured it out and the blinds in the bathroom were fun to play with. The only problem was that occasionally the bathroom would have this funky smell to it, almost like a cross between cleaning solution and sewage. Sometimes at night the smell would get worse and it became quite an annoyance, which will probably prevent us from ever staying at the B-hotel again. Overall though, the B-hotel was great and nobody else seems to have had a sewage smell problem- so maybe it was just our room.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Dani-F
Reviews.Content: Very nice in every way, cool decor, definitely above usual 3 star standard, we're used to 4 or 5 star hotels and this fit the bill. Roof top pool and bar area is lovely and amazing views, go up at sunset as the lights on the huge fountain nearby go on. Not central but right across from metro station and on bus route, travel is no problem and I'm a great believer in not having to walk, save that for Las ramblas! Do not miss the light and music show at the magic fountains round the corner, very memorable. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very funky”
Reviews.Author: Pharang
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 06 for 4 nights after 4 nights in Madrid. Chose this hotel as we wanted a little luxury after staying in a lovely 2 star in Madrid. We arrived at the hotel at 8am (after getting off the overnight Madrid to Barcelona train). Check in was at 2pm but they said our room was ready so we were able to check in immediately. Front desk staff speak perfect english and are very polite and helpful. (The room service staff who took the order didn't speak that great english or my pronunciation of the spanish terms was very bad!). Location about 50m from España metro station. Right next to the bull ring which they are converting into a shopping mall (don't worry you won't hear any construction noise - in the four days we were there they didn't appear to do any work!) The hotel pool on the roof is fab if you just want to very gently swim while looking over the city. The view is very cool. This is not a hotel for children, it is definitely a couples place. The room was very cool. Huge bed and i mean huge - you could easily get lost in it. Flat screen plasma tv with lots of english channels, lovely big couch, there is a safe and air conditioning, fresh towels and sheets daily and a fridge. View wasn't so great from the room but we weren't really looking out that window, spent more time on the roof terrace or out sight seeing. Bathroom very swish but, not a practical design, when having a shower remove the towels from their location at the back of the bath as the water travels round the ledge and will soak them, also you may want to put a "water blocker" at the end of the shower screen too...you'll see what i mean when in the shower! (there is a mini supermarket close by for bits and pieces just turn left when you walk out of the hotel.) The bus to the airport also leaves only 50 metres away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Daveaisy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night mini break in Barcelona and stayed in the Hotel B, is was fantastic and wish we could have stayed longer; would definately reccoment this hotel. It has all the facilities you need and all faultless. Great +++++.

Reviews.Title: “great city base”
Reviews.Author: lettucefire
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice, great for a city break. The location is great if you want to be away from the ramblas and the middle of the city. We stayed for 3 nights over the grand prix weekend and it is only about a 15-20 min walk from the nearest Renfe service to the circuit. There are plenty of good tapas restaurants nearby. It's also only 30 minute bus journey from the airport and it stops right near the hotel for a few euros. If you like a more chic city hotel this is for you, glass bathroom, flat screen tv etc. I read plenty of reviews before going about the lights being complicated and it did take a while to figure out. The toilet light near the bed is a great idea. I couldn't get a wifi signal and disappointingly the pool & bar upstairs was closed which would have been nice to see. The staff are friendly but when we were there the hotel was v quiet and a bit soul less. all in all I'd go again .. breakfast is very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice-Looking Hotel but Way Too Many Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynTraveler10
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in the B-Hotel. Yes, it is very sleek and modern-looking, but they sacrifice convenience and comfort for this modern look. Who wants a bathroom that you can see through and hear everything out of? And the lights, while not that hard to figure out, were definitely more annoying than clever. Some of the problems: Our phone didn't work the first night we were there and no one could figure out what to do, not even a manager, even though the problem could apparently be remedied by three keystrokes into the computer downstairs; there are no clocks anywhere in the room and the front desk did not give us the wake up call we'd asked for (even though we went downstairs and asked personally, and in fluent Spanish) so we almost missed our flight home; there is constant construction going on outside and while it's not too loud to sleep through for a girl like me from New York City, it was annoying to hear jackhammering early in the morning; the hotel does not have an operating restaurant or bar (unless it was just closed for August?) and the neighborhood's choices are pretty bleak - you have to take the Metro if you want to eat somewhere nice. We booked B-Hotel because the great reviews here on Tripadivsor made it seem like we'd be getting a great hotel for a cheap price, but I was very disappointed: $120 a night might not be a lot for a hotel in Barcelona, but it's too much to pay for a hotel with so many inconveniences that's located in a neighborhood you can't have fun wandering around in after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Sticks77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Modern, clean & very accommodating staff. We arrived at 7 am & were provided a room with cot for 2 yr old son straight away. Roof top pool great particularly for steamy Spanish July's. Quite a walk to attractions such as La Rambla but metro station & double decker tour bus stops across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous fortnight at B-Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maudesjp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at B Hotel in July for two weeks with our two children aged 19 + 15 to celebrate a family birthday and had a wonderful time. The staff were at all times courteous, efficient and helpful. The beds were very comfortable. Yes, they are two singles pushed together but this was not a problem in any way. We had requested a quiet room and indeed it was. I think the back rooms are quieter than the front rooms which overlook the main road. There is the odd rumble from the metro but it did not disrupt our sleep and was barely noticeable. There was a good choice at breakfast time of rolls, croissants, fruit, ham cheese etc. Coffee was not great. The pool is not very deep but provides a refreshing soak at the end of the day. There is MASSES to see in Barcelona. We were there for two weeks and still did not see everything. Highlights were 'Magic Fountains' at Plaza Espanya just round the corner from hotel. Barcelona Pavillion by Mies van der Rohe also near hotel. Parc Guell and of course all the Gaudi buildings. The Joan Miro gallery and surrounding gardens near Montjuic (40 mins walk from hotel).The beaches are great too. Particularly the ones near Avenue Diagonal (about 40mins on metro)

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary and Cool! Just what you need in a fab city!”
Reviews.Author: laurabeebs
Reviews.Content: The striking appearance of B-hotel hits you as soon as you walk up to the sliding wooden doors. It truly is lovely. We were in room 715, facing onto an apartment block, not the nicest view we could have got, but still got to see the castle on the hill etc. And lets face it, we weren't there to look out of the balcony window 24/7!! The rooms are designed to be modern and comfortable - the bed was blissful, queen size - wanted to ship it home! The bathroom is beautiful too, my plumber boyfriend was more than impressed! Only downside to the bathroom would be that the doors don't close properly, and certainly no locks, so when you "need" it's a pretty public affair! Not good if you're there with someone you don't know so well (business trip etc). The pool area is also fabulous, however the 4 euro service charge is perhaps a bit steep if you want them to bring drinks etc to you. But hey, its a nice hotel, what do you expect!! :-) Overall I'd definately recommend this hotel to couples visiting the city. And of course the city itself was simply stunning... now to plan our next trip!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “More like the C-hotel- And don't fly British Airways!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nanda326
Reviews.Content: So, my best friend and I have planned a trip to Barcelona for five months. I read some great reviews about this hotel on tripadvisor and decided to book it for a few reasons. One, the room was fairly cheap and I heard that it wasn't too far from the city center to worry about transportation. But, BEWARE!... while the hotel itself is nice and modern there are a few setbacks. First, the severly non-chalant attitude of the front desk is particularly frustrating. British airways lost our luggage [do not fly this airline! They have lost thousands of bags since the terror scare and they are doing nothing to accomodate those who are without clothes, medication, toilettries, etc-my friend and I had to buy all that stuff in Barcelona when we should have been sightseeing and buying souvennairs] and we informed the front desk that we were expected our luggage-if found- to be dropped off at the hotel. They wrote this down and took note of our unfortunate situation. We spent FOUR nights at the hotel and on the morning we checked out- they forgot to give us a wake up call, therefor we almost missed our flight to Malaga AND when I told them that my luggage was still missing, they all of a sudden remembered that luggage HAD BEEN delivered- it's was my friend's. They had it for TWO days and did not tell us. Even after we specifically told them that we were expecting our luggage. What did we get for an apology....a shrug of the shoulder and a "oh, sorry about that". Totally not acceptable. Now, the hotel is located five minutes from the city center. The metro is a three minute walk and the airbus from the airport stops at the square where the hotel is located. Cabs are anywhere from 10-12 euro depending on where you're going. Oh, and the lights are -- to figure out and they don't believe is clocks. That is why we almost missed our flight besides the complete incompetance of the front desk. Don't stay here unless you absolutely have to. There is no night life and there is construction every morning outside of the hotel at the bullring. B- hotel is a BUST.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the decor”
Reviews.Author: amcc80
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice and very clean. We stayed in room 201 which had absolutely no view so it was just as well. We also hired a car for the three days we were there as the hotel advertised parking under facilities on their website - however it did not state that this was at a cost of €25/ night which exceeded the cost of the car. We found staff to be generally unhelpfull. Also the noise and vibration of the underground could be heard and felt in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: zulan78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon after reading positive reviews on this hotel. We took a cruise on the Mediterranean so our first night was one night before the cruise and returned for an additional five nights after the cruise. The first night was not an impressive experience. Our flight got in late and when we arrived at 11pm, the receptionist told us there were no other rooms available except for the one that was given to us. I stated on my online reservation that we were on our honeymoon and found two single beds pushed together. The sheets were seperate, so as a honeymoon couple, we couldn't even snuggle up together. We also experienced a very hot and humid room with the toilet area smelling like urine. The only way we could cool down a bit, the AC was not working in our room, was to open the door to the outside, but there was a vent blowing from the outside and was loud. I was glad to be out of that room after one night. I could not stand it and had my doubts about returning. Oh, and the light switches are not easy to use in any of their rooms. They operate near the front door, even the bathroom lights, and you do not know if you have turned on the bathroom light until you go back and forth to check. It is not convenient for anybody who really has to use the bathroom in an emergency. Thankfully our experience on the second lag of our journey was better. We got to the hotel on the wee hours of 9:30am on a Sunday morning after our cruise. The room wasn't ready, which I was prepared for, so they asked us to come back around 2, as they stored our luggage in the back room. We went to Las Rambla, came back, and were told our room still wasn't ready. We previously told them we were on our honeymoon and we wanted to make sure we were going to be sleeping in the same bed. They upgraded us to room 705 which is one of the biggest rooms they have in the hotel, and the receptionist was very apologetic for their tardiness to get our room ready. It was definitely in a better condition than the one we were previously in. Though I still smelled urine in the bathtub and one night around our bed, I do not know if the housekeepers use the same towels to clean the toilet and the other areas of the room, but it was quite disgusting to experience this multiple times. Other than the few probems early on, I finally got situated into the room and became comfortable after the first day. I found the free internet access very accomodating for guests - there is one by the lobby and two in the business center which is available until 12am. The pool is open from 9-9 and is quite nice, very long, but we didn't have time to swim in it. The metro is ony 3 blocks away and is easy to use. We noticed that the colossium next door was under construction and was worked on during the night time which caused a little noise in our room. I was still able to sleep through it and it seemed like construction stopped once there was sun light. We found the staff to be curteous and we had an unexpected cancellation with our flight which forced us to stay an extra night. When we first spoke to the receptionists about staying an extra night, they informed us that we would have to move to another room. I was a bit surprised that we couldn't stay in our current room. My husband went back down the next morning to ask about staying in our room and this time the receptionist said it was fine. To our experience, the staff members in the morning time were more experienced. Forget the night time staff as they are newbies and really do not know what they are doing. Checking out was a breeze and they did not charge us for our phone useage even though my husband spent 20 minutes trying to contact our airline. For the price we paid, I guess we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, shame about the receptionists”
Reviews.Author: tadvisoruser
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group of friends on June, and cannot really fault the hotel itself. Rooms are lovely, very comfortable, good shower/bathroom. The rooftop is really nice, with a pool around the exterior. This is only small but was sufficient. There aren't really enough loungers though and people often ended up laying on towels on the floor. It would also really benefit from a bar/snack area up there. You can get round this by ordering room service up to the roof (there is a phone up there). The only real gripe I have is the receptionists. We arrived at the hotel just after check in time, only to be told our rooms weren't ready - we'd booked 4 rooms, none were availiable. We were asked to come back in an hour - no problem, we went and had a wander round and got some food. Came back an hour and half later only to be told our rooms still weren't ready! The annoying thing was the reception staff couldn't seem to care less and offered no apology whatsoever! I don't think they had any ounce of customer service at all! This aside, the rest of our stay was very good, and the hotel itself was great. Just a shame about the service...

Reviews.Title: “Sailor Sam's Hen doo”
Reviews.Author: stephy26
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, you really can't fault it, we were on a hen party of 6 and not one of us found a fault at all. I would stay here again its beautiful and very contemporary which is excellant. For past reviews we even figured out how to shut the blinds in the bathroom. There's a switch next to the electric point in the bathroom which closes and opens the blinds. I would definately recommend anyone to stay here. It was great to have a pool on the roof, the breakfast was great, the reception staff were fantastic very helpfull you couldn't fault them. We had no gripes about this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: enigma1211
Reviews.Content: B-Hotel is located near the Spanish Plaza which has the "dancing fountain" every weekend and right next to the Arena (used to be a bullfighting ring, currently under renovation to become a shopping and entertainment complex). Also the metro is just around the corner...just 4 stops to Catalunya which is the city center. Friendly staff who speak near-perfect English, all-you-can-eat buffet breakfast for 12 euro per person (kinda pricey but good selection), free internet access until 11pm and free use of the rooftop swimming pool. Most importantly, the entire hotel is air-conditioned for the hot summer months. Also, the airport bus stops frequently at the Spanish Plaza...very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Mucha
Reviews.Content: We spent one night of our 5-day stay in Barcelona at B-Hotel. I made my booking based on the reviews here and was very pleased. I had quite a good deal through Hotelclub (113 euros incl. breakfast). Positive sides: + modern design, spacious room + nice bathroom and toiletries + varied breakfast + location: first I was a bit sceptical about the location (Placa d'Espanya) - thought it would be too far from Placa de Catalunya. But it's just a few metro stops away, and it's also at walking distance from Poble Espanyol. Also close to Eixample and its nice restaurants. I prefer this location to Ramblas, which seems too crowded and "touristy". + no traffic noise as the room faced a "shaft" (which on the other hand meant that we had no view) + easy access to airport with bus Negative sides: - some noise from the corridor The lighting system was not as difficult as I had expected, and as a tip: the blinds in the bathroom can be shut and opened from two buttons situated above the wash basin (if I remember correctly).

Reviews.Title: “Best Barcelona Hotel and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: mattmat14
Reviews.Content: Just got back to Oz from Spain and France. Stayed for 3 nights at B-Hotel. Have stayed previously in Barcelona in some bad hotels and took the gamble on staying 20 minute walk from La Ramble. WELL WORTH IT. The B-Hotel is a fantastic modern hotel. Beautiful rooms with mood lighting. Everything you needed was there (except an iron). I found the lighting system fun to use. Very comfy beds and pillows. Completely opposite to the dumps you find around La Rambles. Will definately only stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Immy
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day trip to this wonderful hotel. We were situated on the 6th floor in one of the corner rooms(by request at check in). The corner rooms are slightly larger than the normal room size giving a broader window view and a desk to put things on. The bedroom is nice and modern and spacious and is of the same style as the rest of the hotel. Lighting system in the room, is awkward and takes a few touches to get the right lights on and off etc. I can see why previous occupants have had trouble working the lights. The buttons are multi use, and their is a half second delay in lights coming on so can be confusing. Bathroom is nice and trendy....no locks on door though and transparent window with blinds(controlled thru switch by sink) can be un nerving if not sharing with your partner. Bath and shower are combined in one. The Double bed is two singles pushed together, quite often i found myself falling into the gap as i shifted to other side of bed to give the mrs a cuddle. A proper Double bed would have been better but from reading reviews two singles joined together are the norm in spain. Minibar fridge available in room which is also handy to store drinks bought from the local shop at cheap prices. Traffic noise is hearable from the room, due to the busy plaza espanya being 200metres away but is a low hum in background. If you like absolute silence in your room then this wont be the hotel for you. The double glazing windows do a good job of keeping majority of road noise out. Location of hotel is excellent. 200m from placa espanya, which is home to the national museum and the gorgeous nightly water fountain show. Very handy being right on your door step. Metro and bus stops are right nearby. Metro is very efficient. Buy a ten stop ticket and use this on your stay or a multi day pass. Much more economic than buying single tickets every time. Internet PCs are available for use on the 1st floor, including a inkjet printer, and usb ports. The breakfast service had a good variety (if your not vegetarian), but certainly not worth paying 12 euro extra for, if not included in your room price. Instead you could nip down to the local shop and get a much better selection for a much cheaper price. Only real negative i found with the hotel was the lack of an iron available. We did manage to get one delivered to the room for a short period of time. The hotel instead promotes their in house ironing/laundry service. A number of staff informed us (incorrectly) the ironing service was free but the order slip showed otherwise. Summary of hotel Pros : Location Cost Modern, Clean Hotel Good Staff Excellent Aircon Nice rooftop sunning area and small pool Free Internet PC's to use. Local shop nearby for COLD drinks and pastries, nibbles etc. Cons: No irons available (unless you are persistent), they promote their in-hotel ironing service (at cost) instead. A little traffic noise (this didnt bother me) Breakfast not worth asking money if not included with room. Only 2 english channels on the TV, Sky news and bbc world. Two single beds pushed together.

Reviews.Title: “B for beautiful !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dawpal
Reviews.Content: Just spent five days at the lovely B-hotel in Barcelona. I decided against the Hotel Jazz (which is part of the same hotel group [----------]) because its in the noisy, busy central area. Prefer the peaceful life meeee! Stayed in room 711 on the very top floor (the roof infinity pool is on the 8th floor). Hotel review as follows: ADVANTAGES: 1. Location – superb location. -Close to the Espanya Metro Station (5 mins via Metro to La Rambles on L3 Green Line). -Close to the AeroBus stop (the A1 blue bus. 15 mins journey to airport. Every 8 mins. Cost 3.75 Euros per ticket). Much cheaper than taxi fare (25-30 euros) -Close to the MNAC, Pobla Espanyol and Water Fountain attractions (10 mins walk). These sites were the highlight of my trip despite seeing the Gaudi Attractions, Barcelona FC stadium and Port Guell areas. -Situated in a nice quiet residential area. Felt safe walking around even at 12am!! Close to shops toooo 2. Hotel Infinity Pool: - WOW – offers views of the Placa Espanya and wayyyy beyond. WOWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW - Opens 8am – 8pm. Pretty busy in the afternoon but there is ample space for everyone. Water can be cold in the morning. - I think the hotel was building a BBQ on the rooftop when I was leaving. - Rooftop included pool, changing room with washing facilities and a trolley containing spare towels. 3. Room: -Room 711 was a very good size. -Only one of three rooms with a clear view window – check with hotel. -Very nice modern appearance with cracking fittings. -Check out the ceiling in the lift – changes colour as you move up and down. Nice touch. -Cleaning staff did a great job with the room. Sparkling bathroom every morning. 4. Staff - Staff very fluent in English. Very helpful when I was pickpocketed in Las Rambles area. Helped me contact Police and organised crime report. 5 STAR CUSTOMER SERVICE. -Booked the Tablao Carmen Flamenco show for me. Located at the nearby Pobla Espanyol. Cracking show. Lovvvvved it!!!!! 5. Internet access: - 24HR Internet access in foyer was a godsend for checking work emails. DISADVANTAGES: 1. Room: -The shower has blinds which I couldn’t close. Hence, shower is see-through. Shower maybe weird if you go with family or friends. (just close your eyes !!) -Electronic button lighting system can be tricky for some visitors. All in all, this is a feature packed, modern hotel which should have a 4-star status. Add to this a great location, helpful staff and beautiful views from the rooftop pool and you are definitely onto a winner. Simply superb!!!!!!!!!. Note - Price may increase because of the nearby bullring which is being converted to shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “B - Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: PearlyPotter
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from an 8 day stay at the B Hotel celebrating a special wedding anniversary. We were upgraded to one of the larger rooms without asking (room 309) and it was huge. The bed was enormous and so comfortable - neither hard nor soft so it would suit almost everyone! The bathroom is stylish with a super power shower. The glass panelling alongside the bath with the partially open venetian blind that cannot be adjusted did not bother us. Our only reservation is that an older person or someone who was not fully mobile may find it difficult to climb in and out of the bath as it was inset and there was a fairly wide ledge to negotiate. The lighting was entertaining - not sure we'd got the hang of the system even after 8 days but so what! It was brilliant to return to the hotel in the afternoon or evening to superb air conditioning - much needed in the 30 degree plus temperatures. The hotel is 200 metres from the first drop off stop for the airport bus - price 3.5 euros each. It's 3 metro stops from the Ramblas - or a 35 -40 minute walk. The nearest Starbucks is about a 20 minute walk away. The nearest convenience store is 100 metres away - ideal for water, cold drinks and alcohol. The staff were friendly and helpful and we would certainly stay at the hotel again and recommend it to others. It far surpassed the 3* hotel we usually use in Paris and was even better than the last 4* we stayed at in Barcelona. We had a fabulous anniversary holiday and were delighted with the B Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this ultra-modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Super-modern hotel is right next to the Plaza de Espanya, which means easy access to busses, metro and taxis. It's located in a neighborhood with several cafes and a supermarket (OpenCor) a block away. We never felt unsafe in this neighborhood, and did walk around at night. The staff was very friendly and the free internet stations were a nice touch. It is a little far away from the city center (La Rambla, Barri Gotic, Sagrada Familia, etc.) but the metro puts it all within 15 minutes. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: NCStateTraveler
Reviews.Content: Good * Location is near metro access. * Very close to everything * In more of a neighborhood which gives you a better feel for life in Barcelona * Best AC that we experienced in all of Europe * Modern element is fun Bad * Hotel caters to younger/partying English speakers * Long walk to La Rambla (short metro ride though) * Took a few minutes to understand lighting * Bathroom showed dirt in places.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms but some issues”
Reviews.Author: Que
Reviews.Content: This is a contemporary hotel located just off Placa Espanya. For the price (100 euros per night for a double room) we thought it was good value. Despite the building work going on at the bull ring nearby and the busy traffic on the roundabout, the room (which faced the Gran Via) was relatively quiet and we had no trouble with street noise at night. It was nice that the windows opened onto a little balcony. The beds were very comfortable - there were two singles pushed together rather than a double, but this is apparently quite common. We had read about the problems with the lights on Tripadvisor before we arrived but it still took a while to work out which buttons to press – I think that whoever designed the lighting was trying too hard to be clever and what could have been a quirky feature turns into something quite annoying especially if you want to use the bathroom in the night without waking your partner. The reception staff are very efficient and friendly but housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired. The range of toiletries is good when you first arrive (the usual shower gel, shampoo and soap, plus razor, toothbrush, comb, individual packs of tissues, bath sponge and more). Unfortunately, none of these were replaced during the stay and we had to ask every day for more. I know that most people would take some of these items, but does anyone take bars of soap for washing your hands? They are so tiny that I lost one down the plughole in the sink the first night, never to be seen again! The mini bar is a nice touch, but again, there were no replacements until we asked. To be fair, the receptionists seemed as baffled as we were with these housekeeping problems but resolved them very quickly. Room service was a bit hit and miss – we ordered ‘Coffee Americano’ twice. The first time was fine, the second, they delivered Espresso and we had to reorder. Check your bill if there are any errors, as they did try to charge for both. It would be useful if there were coffee making facilities in the room as with all UK and US hotels. The pool on the roof was very handy for a little rest after a busy day and was very quiet. There is a Metro station within a couple of minutes walk which connects you with the rest of the city (buy a ticket to cover you for the number of days you are there). There really aren’t many places to eat or drink in the immediate vicinity, so this is very useful. If you are heading for Las Ramblas or nearby in the evening, the green line takes you directly there and the trains run until midnight (or 2am on Fridays and Saturdays). They are also very safe even at such late hours.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place but a little annoying”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are pros and cons to this place. The hotel is fascinating with all its contemprory furniture, decor and gadgets. However, our key did not turn on the funky lights when we slid it into the slot and we kept having to go to the reception a couple of times each day to have it re-calibrated. Their is a lcd tvs in every room, but dont be fooled, it is the size of a computer monitor. I wish they had just put regular 29" tubes instead!! The carpets are also stained inn some places and look a little ugly. Our bathroom door was missing and my brother was very stressed about his shower every morning. However, he got thru all 3 days fine! The pool deck on the roof is absolutely gorgeous. It was packed with a young beautiful crowd sun-bathing and playing loungy music on their i-pod decks. The view is really nice as well. We got a horrible view of the back of a dodgy building with clothes hanging in the balcony with our first room, but the reception was quick to change it to a more pleasant one. The location is a little rough. There arent any pleasant restraunts or cafes within a walking distance. Plaza Espania is a walk away and has the coolest musical fountain show on sundays though. The metro is opposite the st. and is 3 stops away from Las Ramblas. One night, we got hungry and ordered the most horrible club sandwiches I have ever tasted! So here's a big tip, dont order room service. Just grab a beer and head to the roof top when your in the hotel. All in all, an awesome place for a young group of travellers on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly chic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pactio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the B-hotel for 3 nights in June 2006 and absolutely loved it!! Great things about this hotel include: 1) Located centrally at Plaza d'Espanya - it's a 1-minute walk to the Metro 2) Easy access to/from Airport - there is an aerobus stop right at Plaza d'Espanya so it takes only 20 minutes to get to/from the airport to the hotel. 3) Beautiful modern hotel - the style is a modern chic one that is very simple, with no cluster anywhere. Sleek wood & metal furniture. 4) High-tech rooms!! - my favourite part of the hotel! All the lights can be controlled from your bedside table, so you never have to get up from bed to turn off the hallway or bathroom lights. The bathroom is divided into the bathtub, which has glass windows looking out into the room (no walls!) outfitted with electronic blinds (allowing you to close the blinds if you need some privacy) and a separate stall for the toilet. 5) English-speaking staff - the front desk staff have a good mastery of English. 6) Very reasonably priced for a hotel this nice! I didn't find anything remotely wrong with the hotel and highly recommend it to anyone who's thinking of going to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer48
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the B-hotel instead of Fira Palace, where a conference I was attending was being hosted, and had no regrets whatsoever. The hotel is steps to the subway and about a 10-minute walk to Montjuic, where several art galleries and museums are and which is also the lushest and greenest part of Barcelona. The highlight of the hotel was the fantastic rooftop terrace which overlooks the Placa Espanya and is a wonderful place to relax after a day of sightseeing. If breakfast isn't included in the price of your room it costs 12 euros, which is a bit steep I thought for what is essentially a continental breakfast. Instead, go to the supermarket at the end of the street and buy juice and a pastry. One downside of the hotel is that it is a fair distance from where most of us wanted to eat dinner at night -- the Old Town -- and one night after discovering that the subways closed "early" (midnight) we did have to hoof it home. However, you could also take a taxi. The rooms are very modern and it took me about half an hour to figure out how to operate the lights. Free computer access with high speed internet is available in the lounge from 7 am - 11 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great, reasonably priced hotel for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: San Antonio member
Reviews.Content: Given some recent negative reviews, I was a bit concerned about the B-hotel. However, my stay was great. The rooms are clean and comfortable. They also offer something different from the standard big hotel. I liked the clean modern design. Hotel staff were nothing but helpful, and the breakfast was really good. I also really appreciated the free internet access. Overally, I was very happy with the B-hotel. I have paid more for a lot less elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city!”
Reviews.Author: Bely
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic break in Barcelona. Neither of us had visited this great city before so after trawling through this site we booked the 'B Hotel'. We were not disappointed! We had a large room on the 7th floor with great views of Placa Espanya, which was surprisingly quiet even though we were on the roadside. The staff were friendly and more than enthusiastic to help with all requests - restaurant suggestions, room service etc. The rooftop pool was a godsend as the weather was fab and you could call to the bar/room service for food and drink. We found the location of the hotel to be ideal - only 15mins easy walk from La Ramblas, metro stop on the doorstep, tourist bus, aerobus and the great fountains and museum too. We will definately return again as the city has so much to offer but a must on any visit is the Parc Guell, Sagrada Famillia and El 4 Gats restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: captainbeaky30
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the previous reviews. Its a very well located hotel - great for the airport bus, the train for Montserrat and the metro for the rest of Barcelona. Its clean and modern with helpful staff who speak english. The rooms are clean and very modern looking. The only complaint is that there are no guidelines on how to operate the room lights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeju
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel after reading the excellent reviews it received on Tripadvisor. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and found the rooms comfortable. Our bed was 2 single joined together and this produced an enormous bed that we were delighted with. The lighting system was unusual but not that difficult to figure out. I liked the glass walls in the bathroom but make sure that you're sharing with someone that you're close to, there are blinds but I couldn't figure out how to work them. There was a nice box of treats in the bathroom and the a well stocked mini bar. One suggestion that I would have is stock up on a few bottles of water and some beer from the supermarket a block down and put them in the mini bar. It's a lot cheaper than paying the hotel prices. The location was good. It's right on the Placa D'Espanya and close to the magic fountain. The airport bus stops nearby as does the tourist bus. There's a metro station outside the door too. We didn't find many bars or restaurants in the area and I think the next time I go to Barcelona I'll stay closer to the Barri Gothic or the Ramblas as this seems to be where all the action is! That said it was only 4 Euro in a taxi to the heart of everything. One bar/restaurant to check out is Rita Blue, it's on one of the squares off the Ramblas. It's very chilled out and serves great cocktails. They also serve food but as I didn't eat there I can't say what it's like.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Yaounde
Reviews.Content: better choice! Modern design, excellent service, beautiful spacious room, free in room wireless. I suggest you request a corner room, they are a lot bigger with a desk/lounge area in the corner. The glass enclosed bathroom with a unique colored tint was a nice touch. The hotel is located in the Sants area, a stone throw fom the placa Espanya where you can find the Aerobus, taxis (which we hardly used) and the effiecient metro. The hotel is also close to the spectacualr sites on Montjuic: Joan Miro Museum, Museum of Catalan Art, the Ciaxa Forum, and the amazing spanish village Poble Espanyol and more. The neigborhood felt safe, on several occassions we chose to walk back after the trains shut down from the bustling Catalunya area. The only downer was the two beds pushed together to make one. I would def reccomend the B Hotel without the slightest reservation. For those of you interested in the cool hip bar lounge scenes I'd suggest going out and about in the Jaume 1 area. The CCCB also has a really happening bar scene open late for those interested in drink and tapas in the company of young artsy locals. Barcelona is a great city! Hope some this was helpful! For what's on in barcelona for shopping dining and going out check out fadweb.org

Reviews.Title: “Disapponted”
Reviews.Author: Debyo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading all the reviews on this site and were expecting great things. I must confess to being a bit disappointed. IMy first impression was that of a cool hotel BUT on closer inspection it was quite shabby. The bedspread was awful ( pulls and nasty fabric). Although the cleaner came everyday, the floor was not cleaned in the 5 days we were there. The room was well sound-proofed from the other guests but road noise was a problem. It is on a very. busy road and the sound of sirens and horns during the night was intrusive even though we were on the 5th floor. Our last night coincided with Barcelona winning the Champions League and the horns, megaphones etc went on continuousy until 3-4am , not the hotels fault I know but nonetheless we were glad to get home for a good nights sleep ( I live on a main road and am used to traffic noise but this was something else!) The front staff seemed efficient but not over friendly. The pool was STILL not in use, I gather this has been a longstanding problem judging from the reviews on this site. There is no info given by the hotel about it's facilities ( perhaps because the gym, pool and the internet facility were all unavailable!) There were good points - great position with easy access to the metro, bus turistic and regulat buses. Good air coditioning which was most welcome after a hot day. Comfy bed I would recommend this hotel and I have definitley stayed in worse, it was good value for money ( £66 per night with Expedia) It was an ok hotel that with just a little more attention could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superficial style without substance...”
Reviews.Author: Honi
Reviews.Content: ....more Ikea than Phillipe Starke. I’m sorry to report that we were very disappointed with our stay at the B-Hotel this past weekend. Starting with the good points of the hotel, it is reasonably well located, just a 15 minute taxi ride (without traffic) from Barcelona airport (as opposed to Girona airport, where Ryanair flies into) and within walking distance of the train station. It is also within walking distance of Barcelona’s main attractions if you don’t mind long walks, which I enjoy. It was also moderately priced at around €175 per night for the room, excluding breakfast. The negatives are that the hotel is located on Gran Via, one of Barcelona’s main thoroughfares and, at night, a drag strip for wanna-be Spanish Grand Prix drivers. All night long, drivers blared their car horns in sync in support of the Spanish Grand Prix driver, Fernando Alonso, who had just won the race. We hardly slept a wink. Even the night before the Grand Prix we couldn’t sleep for all the traffic roaring just outside all night long – it was like sleeping on a motorway overpass. We also didn’t find the staff very helpful. I was quite thirsty after walking around warm Barcelona all day and quickly polished off the 3 tiny bottles of water in the room’s mini-bar. However, when we asked the front desk if they could provide us with some replacement bottles of water, they said no! The hotel bar, such that it is, was already long closed at midnight, and they declined our practical suggestion of opening up one of the unoccupied rooms to give us bottles of water from an unused mini-bar. I had to make do with half a glass of warm water left over on my bedside table from the previous night (which fortunately the maid had neglected to take away when she cleaned the room), and my partner had to quaff a bottle of too-sweet tonic water. What possible excuse can there be not to be able to give guests some additional bottles of water, even if the request is made at midnight? Another disappointment was the character-less hotel bar. I had expected to enjoy a gin and tonic in the evening at the poolside bar on the roof, but in fact, there was no poolside bar anymore. Even the bar in the main lobby was non-existent after 9 p.m. and completely lacking in atmosphere. Breakfast at €25 for two was a modest continental-style buffet with a range of cereals, bread rolls, croissants, hams and cheese, which quickly ran out and weren’t replaced. Hard boiled eggs were provided, but cooked breakfasts aren’t offered. Coffee and hot water for tea are dispensed from push-top Thermos-type containers rather than freshly made to order. Although the hotel has a certain minimalist style that makes it more appealing than, say, a Holiday Inn, it has absolutely none of the buzzy atmosphere or style of the hotels it is apparently trying to emulate, such as The Mercer in NYC, or The Sanderson, One Aldwych and St Martins Lane in London. I have stayed in each of those hotels, and B-Hotel is nothing more than a cheap, Ikea-styled facsimile of those truly stylish hotels. The metallic bedspread had pulls and loose threads on it and the carpets in the hallways were stained. All in all, I would say if you're a light sleeper or looking for a truly stylish hotel, you should stay elsewhere. If you just want a change from the usual B&B and chain hotel experience and don't mind an absense of real style and atmosphere, soundproofing or bottles of water at midnight, then by all means stay at B-Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gemybell
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and we were very happy. The room was good size, the pool area is lovely. The location is excellant and the bus from the airpost drops you right by hotel. The only negative is that the hotel describtion says 'well-equipped gym' but thay was no gym at the hotel. We had a fab time in Barcelona and would love to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: you_beauties
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 6 days and 6 nights with my girlfriend. perfect location for town, its only 5 minutes by metro to the main shopping area and you can use the green or red metro lines from Espanya, 200 metres from the hotel (turn right out of hotel). couldn't comment on breakfast but used the local supermarket down the road, about 2 minutes walk (turn left out of the hotel) and there you can get fresh bread, croissants, etc. looks like a bookshop/newsagent but sells allsorts inside. lights...don't know quite what the fuss is about, they are pretty straight forward. the main problem we had was locating the button for the blind between the bathroom and the bedroom (switch is part of shaver socket over the sink). great view, friendly staff. great rooftop. internet access via computer in main foyer for those of us without laptops (who takes a laptop on holiday? we're not all business men!). watch the funky ceiling lights in the lift as they change colour and as you move up the corridors to your room the lights brighten and dim. muggers? what muggers. just use common sense, no camera around the necks. i can see why people do get stuff nicked but these people might as well wear a sign saying 'mug me'. ps hotel has a room safe, its easy to use. hope this all helps.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rosaleno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at the B-Hotel and liked it a lot. Not only is it a stylish place and very clean, but also perfectly located close to the Aerobus-station and Subways right on Via Grande and Placa Espanya. This makes the hotel pretty loud on the other hand, but windows and AC are keeping disturbance low. Triangle shaped rooms are bigger then others (see floor plan enclosed). Try to get one of those, although any other facing the street is fine, too. Do not expect anything from the neighbourhood and the bar at the hotel. The B-Hotel is surely a place to return to, a little out of the city centre (which is not a big disadvantage) but true value for money. Check out all offers on the WWW and make use of the price guarantee at sercotelhoteles. Needless to say: Barcelona is a great city...

Reviews.Title: “A god choice”
Reviews.Author: nightcrowler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from April 16 to April 18, 2006 and liked it. As mentioned by many reviewers, the lightning system is a bit confusing but it was not a problem at all. The pool at the top is a tiny one but it would probably be nice to watch Barcelona from such a nice terrace in summer. Breakfast was OK and well worth the money (at least there were fresh fruits and fresh orange juice). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: B-Hotel is a great place on many levels. Firstly the design is very funky and stylish. I loved the bar area, rooms and the front door (once we'd found it!). The pool on the roof is a great plus and fab for just chilling out. The location of the hotel is great, being on Placa Espanya which has a rail and tube station. A walk over the road and you have easy access to the parks of Montjuic. There is no restaurant in the hotel and not much close by so we suggest getting into the Old Town in the centre which is 10 mins by tube. The rooms themselves are funky with the light switch situation creating much amusement. I felt that it did seem a little rough in places as the wooden floor scratches easily but over all it is well built. Breakfast in the hotel is 25 Euros and a small continental selection. Suggest not bothering or stocking up with a late start (it's served until 11am). For the money, this hotel is great and we reaaly loved it. A great way to spend a city break in the wonderful Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel & not too pricey”
Reviews.Author: iandel
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 nights in the B-Hotel & would happily recommend it to others. We paid about EUR 100 per night and, by chance, got one of the mini-suites because they didn't have a regular room ready when we arrived. The room was very nice - plenty of space, flat screen TV, good clothes storage & the minimalist style makes it all a bit more memorable than your average hotel. The shower was excellent, as was the rest of the bathroom, although I could have done with a bit more light in the toilet. Actually, the room in general could have used a little more lighting. As others have mentioned, the lighting system is a somewhat quirky. Apparently our room was normally a twin, but with the 2 beds pushed together. To be honest, I would find the room a bit lacking in privacy if I was sharing it with someone I wasn't already intimate with - 1. there are no locks on the toilet door, and the bathroom has merely a sliding door that doesn't fully close & 2. you can see into the shower from the bedroom.......I was with my girlfriend, so it wasn't an issue for us, but business travellers should maybe take note. Breakfast was not included in our deal, so cannot comment on the food. The location however was good. It's just off Placa Espanya which is the first stop on the airport bus. There are tourist attractions nearby (Parc Monjuic, Olympic stadium etc), and you can walk to the Ramblas in around 20/25 mins. The hotel is 2 mins from the metro. The hotel has a rooftop pool which looks fantastic and offers great views of the city. Unfortunately, it was just too cold to use when we were there. We had minimal dealings with the staff, but those that we spoke to were polite and helpful. Overall, we'd definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Design”
Reviews.Author: lola1616
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights and I was very pleased with everything. I loved the minimal design. It was simple, but in a very comfortable way. The beds were decent- of course the double is two twin beds joined as one. I believe that is the usual in Spain. The lobby and the restaurant are well desinged. As are the rooms and the bathrooms. The bathroom is not very private. It has a glass wall surrounding the shower as an enclosure for the bathroom. The rooftop seems as if it would be great in the summer. So if you prefer a beautifully designed hotel at a very resonable price, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: bridgemagoo2
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. Easy drop off from the airport bus in Espanya Square 2 mins walk and you can pick up tourist bus and metro from here to all desrtinations. Staff were great, rooms deliberately chic and minimalist. Only very slight downsides that like others we also got two twin beds pushed together and after three days we still couldn't completely suss the lights!! But this was a great hotel for the money, well placed, great buffet breakfast with lovely food (an additional E14 per head but worth it) and highly recommended all round. NB No fault of the hotel but PLEASE watch out for escalating problem of bag/wallet snatchers in Barcelona - we had attempted grabs twice in three days and heard of numerous others victims of successful attempts. It seems to be a huge problem.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooned Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Alright, this was the 2nd stay of our honeymoon (the 1st was Rome), and we were very pleased with everything about this hotel. The hotel staff was excellent. They spoke good English and pointed us out in every direction- The nightlife, tourist attractions, romantic spots and everything. The location of the hotel is excellent. The metro is about a 5 min walk. The metro is very convenient to get to anywhere in the city. I would advise on your 1st day in Spain to take the guided bus tour and figure out which sites you like and then visit them accordingly the following days. The Hotel Room was very nice and elegant. The lighting of the room was awesome (a little hard to figure out). You could dim the lights and could make for a very eventful night. There is FREE internet service in the hotel, so no need for a laptop. Overall, me and my wife have NO complaints about this hotel (and we are very particular about room standards). We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Second rate hotel with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: MadamLucyLuLu
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the excellent reviews that the B Hotel has on Tripadvisor my boyfriend and I decided to book seven nights with them. When we arrived they couldn't find our booking but after ten minutes or so of looking they did. When we went to our room we found they had given us a twin room and we had booked a double. We went back to reception to explain that we had booked a double not a twin and we were told that in Spain there is no word for twin and that a "double" just means it sleeps two whether it's two single beds or one double bed. The staff member who told us this was very abrupt. We were told that getting a double room was "NOT POSSIBLE" until the next day. We were disappointed but we agreed. The next day we went out early and when we came back we found that they had put double sheets and covers over the two single beds. We went back to reception and we were told that all their "double beds" were like this. We were given a different room that was slightly bigger but the beds were exactly the same. On the day we arrived we returned to the hotel at just after 11pm. There seemed to be a party in full swing in the bar area. I asked the barman for some drinks and he told me it was "NOT POSSIBLE" as the bar was closed. The loud noise from the party continued for three or four hours. The next night my boyfriend tried to call room service to order some food. It was before 10pm and room service is supposed to be available until 11pm. The phone rang out a number of times. I decided to phone reception. A member of staff answered and I said who I was and my room number and HE HUNG UP ON ME. At this point we decided not to deal with the hotel staff anymore. Besides the hotel staff being unbelievably rude I found the interior to be gimmicky. The lighting doesn't work very well and is pretentious. Although the light function buttons were the same in both rooms the buttons didn't work properly in the second room and we couldn't dim the lights. I think the finish in the rooms lacked attention to detail and that they cut corners where ever possible. I liked the showers but if you want to have a bath the taps are hard to reach (you have to climb into the bath to turn them on). Also there was no hot water after 11.30ish. The hotel building is quite nice overall the rooms are reasonably comfortable. It was great to have internet access in the rooms. It could have been a much more pleasant stay. The staff really let this hotel down. There was one guy who was friendly enough but the rest of the staff we spoke to were rude and abrupt. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it !!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdnadri
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very comfortable and clean , I loved the modern look and the wooden floor. The Staff were extrimly nice , they helped us with information about the city and with reserving places in nice restaurants . Its been a wonderful stay and I highly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “A must for a girlie weekend!”
Reviews.Author: louloulh
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at this fab hotel last May with 3 girlfriends. I'm only reminded to write a review now because I'm thinking of booking up again this year. We arrived when the hotel had just opened and couldn't believe our luck - what a fantastic hotel for a great price. The rooms are huge, cool and modern and the bathroom was a real design feature! The location of the hotel is great as I know many travellers want to avoid staying near Las Ramblas. The metro is fifty yards from the hotel and offers cheap transport around the city. In fact the city tour bus starts at te other side of Placa D'Espanya - very handy! My girlfriends and I got into the mediterranean way of things very quickly, often not venturing out for dinner until ten - go to the supermarket just down the street, you can get a lovely bottle of white wine for 4 euros pre-dinner (and chill it in your fridge after some clever manoeuvering of mini bar goodies!) Also, if you are a tapas fan I can't recommend enough two fabulous tapas bars we went to - Cerveceria Catalana on Caller Mallorca and Celler de Tapas on Placa D'Universidad - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited Barcelona for the first time for a Birthday treat, and what a treat this Hotel is. The room was very modern, clean, spacious and the BED, what can i say, huge and comfortable. Once we'd sussed out the little quirks of the room like the blinds in the bathroom ,how to operate the safe properly and not to be too heavy handed with the lighting we were all set to explore. The Hotel location is fine, all modes of transport just to the right of the hotel. Try the Barcelona Guided Tour bus with a two day ticket, it's great. Hop on, hop off at all of the major sightseeing attractions, it runs every 20 minutes from approx 9am until 6.30pm. We would definately visit Barcelona and the B-Hotel again, I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Grade for the B Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very pleasant stay at the B Hotel and we would both happily recommend the hotel and believe we got excellent value for our money. The modern design of the hotel was novel and practical, the staff friendly, courteous and helpful and our room was very clean, spacious and quiet even though we had a balcony overlooking the Grand Via. The buffet breakfast had a wide and varied choice of fare and accommodates early and late risers from 7 to 11am. The hotel is a stone's throw away from the transport hub of Placa d'Espanya: trains, metro and buses and within walking distance to Montjuic. All in all we had a most enjoyable stay and would go back in a flash. Only one small quip; the swimming pool was out of bounds (problem with filtration?) not that it mattered being January.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but noisy and location a bit off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, cool rooms and great service. Staff was relaxed and very nice to deal with. Ask for a corner room as they are slightly larger. Rooms facing the street slightly noisy in the morning rush. Breakfast buffe not that good, and location a bit off perhaps. Taxis are cheap and easy to come by though so did not matter much.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in a funky city”
Reviews.Author: dollmint
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel based on reviews we'd read and, having just spent four nights there, have to say it lived up to expectations! The decor was sleek and calming, while the bathroom was rather swish! The service was quite outstanding. We were upgraded to a superior room and the staff were friendly and helpful - saving us time and money with their advice! The hotel was located a couple of minutes from a metro station (Espanya) and airport bus stop. If you go for three days or more I suggest the Barcelona Card, which covers your travel costs and gets you discounts on tourist attractions. It was too cold for us to use the stunning swimming pool on the rooftop, but we went up on the last day to enjoy some spectacular views of Montjuic. A minor gripe: the mattresses were on the soft side, which wasn't ideal after a day of walking around! But that was the only thing we could think of. We've spent a lot more at much worse hotels in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel that hasn't already been said?! I booked it on the recommendation of a friend of a friend and wasn't dissapointed with it. As soon as we'd pulled up in the taxi outside the hotel my girlfriend and I were lost for words, even more so when we got to our room. We stayed on the executive (7th) floor and had a nice little balcony, amazing lighting and furniture and a great view of Gran Via. In the morning we were perfcetly placed to be awoken by the sun poking its head through our curtains, what a great way to start the day! Barcelona itself is a fantastic place for a holiday, but the whole experience was made that much better by the B Hotel. At first we thought the rooftop pool had been closed for the winter, but we realised that it was only open at specific times in the day ...we had breakfast on the roof one morning and it was incredible. The lift doors actually open onto the roof, and the pool is breathtaking, like something out of a hip-hop video. The only complaints I have are very minor: Firstly, taxi drivers never seem to know the hotel itself, so you have to direct them to Gran Via, also I think we may have had a drainage problem in our room as it always had a slight aroma of sewage when we entered. The buffet breakfast was nothing to write home about. But, these are minor problems in comparison to the quality of the hotel and the service it provides. I'd recommend it to anyone going to Barcelona, it's very close to metro stations and Las Ramblas is only a 15 minute walk away. All in all our stay worked out at £33 a night, which is ridiculously cheap for what we got. I can't praise this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “A Special Recommendation!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 6 night stay at the B hotel and I have to say that when you take everything into consideration it really does represent very good value for money. The one slight downside would be the location as, at the moment it is the subject of some nearby building works to the once very grand Bullring (soon to become a shopping centre I think). It's a 10 minute journey on the metro to the main centre of barcelona, which for us didn't represent a problem but is something to bare in mind before you book. For me that was the only negative thing I have to say. The pool on the rooftop is fantastic and our room was always clean and very quiet; most impressive was the service we received from the staff. Always polite and helpful providing us with helpful information and a friendly hello when we were leaving. The service continued even after we had we had left the hotel and were back in the UK. I realised once home that I had left a camera bag at a nearby restaurant and so I dropped the hotel an email explaining what had happened. To my surprise a member of staff went to the restaurant, collected the bag and then arranged for it to be posted back to me -all at no cost. I would like to give a special thank you to "G Albert" who arranged all this - it is very much appreciated! So all in all a definite recommendation for a hotel which for the money cannot be beaten in terms of a balnce between service, location, facilities and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value hotel in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where to start. This hotel is of a VERY high standard for the money. The thing that stops it getting higher star rating is the absence of a restaurant. This is how the Star-rating system works. No restaurant means it can't get any higher. We stayed for 5 nights, in October - after the end of the main tourist season really. The room was great. Clean, crisp and modern. The double bed was two single's wedged together, but it was HUGE and hardly noticeable. The bath was lovely, although it took us 10 minutes to find the tap! (Modern fixtures!) The only slight 'quirk' was that the wall between the bed and the bath/shower was glass. No curtain or anything. So whether you wanted to or not, you got to watch your roommate soaping themselves! Fine if you're a couple, but if you're away sharing and on business or just friends, you might not be so keen! I'm guessing twin rooms must have a different arrangement. Room was missing things that you'd expect in the UK such as a tray of coffee/tea and a kettle, but apart from that was wonderfully appointed. Great views of Placa Espana from the room - particularly impressive at night. Room service was fine if you fancied a lazy night, and very well priced - cheaper than most of the restaurants in the vicinity. The Hotel was very easy to find - right outside Espana Metro stop and the first stop for the Aerobus from the Airport. I'd recommend getting a 'barcelonacard' - available with Expedia before you go, or at the main tourist office at Placa Catalunya (about 20mins walk if you feel like it). Free Metro travel and some freeby sightseeing trips/museum entry and a boat trip. Made the holiday SO easy. The swimming pool was open in Oct, but was ABSOLUTELY FREEZING! Couldn't believe it. It was lovely to stand/lounge on the roof by the pool though and enjoy the view. Especially in the rain, but I might just be odd. About 2 mins walk from the hotel down Gran Via, there is a supermarket. Ideal for stocking up on fruit juice/water/snacks. The hotel staff didn't seem to mind, which was nice.
